review: Excellent staff, clean and attractive property, area shuttle a real plus, much better than other Hilton properties in the area and I stay at a Hilton property almost every week. I would stay here again when I am in the area.

title: Memorial Day Weekend 2017
review: At an excellent stay good price clean room and our front desk person, AIDA. Was excellent keep up the good work, jock and Jermaine I take my hat off to the van drivers and the whole team at the Hampton Inn downtown Fort Lauderdale

title: Great location.  Clean & secure accommodations.  Friendly staff
review: I'll be staying here in the future. The staff was friendly.  Airport shuttle professional & timely.  Centrally located.  Nice pool.  Clean rooms.  No on demand tv only downside.  Limited channel selection.  HBO GOOD.

title: Never Again
review: Stayed for 10 days last Christmas vacation.  Never stay there again.  Manager seems to let hooligans stay here. Rooms had five and six people staying (max was 4) and they thought every night was an excuse for a party. Many of the guests were wild and noisy in the breakfast area and at the pool. Threw footballs at cars in the parking lot.  Were confrontational and rude to other guests, swearing and rude gesturing. Management did nothing despite frequent complaints.  Rooms very clean. Nice looking hotel, but spoiled by indifference of management.

title: Quick two night stay
review: I usually pick hotels based on location to begin with.  I was in town looking at boats and this location worked best for me.  It is not in the most scenic part of town by any means.  It was convenient for me as I used Uber the entire stay and never had a glitch.  I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was.  Not sure when they upgraded the rooms but mine was very nice and modern.  The free breakfast was what you expect from this level of hotel and I had no complaints.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful which is always a good addition.  When I return I will stay at this location.

title: Great Stay
review: This was a great stay. I bought a package through Jet Blue. This  place is not on the beach but the Ft. Lauderdale Beach is only an $8 LYFT/uber ride away. The staff was amazing, my room was clean and I had fun! Thank you Marcus and Ken and the Breakfast staff for your hard work. The people who drive the shuttle are also very nice. I will  stay here again when I come back.

title: Spoiled last night in Fort Lauderdale.
review: We had stayed in Hollywood Beach for 4 days in a bungalow on the beach,but,..for our last night we decided to stay in a more upscale hotel in Fort Lauderdale close to the airport.The hotel staff was wonderful,...the room was very nice and comfortable,... the free breakfast was better than most,..AND,..the second floor pool and lounge area around it was wonderful. Free 1 mile area(and airport) shuttle was a bonus too.

title: Great as always.
review: A very pleasant stay.  Have stayed here several times now.  Like the renovations.  Staff is always accommodating.  Price is reasonable.  Breakfast is good.  Hot tub is no longer available but I never used it so it didn't bother me.

title: Thanks for everything!!!
review: My stay was completely wonderful! Staff was great,stay was great, and your shuttle driver was amazing! Please continue what ever you're doing because my stay was perfect. I would and will recommend you're hotel to anyone.

title: Hot Tub???
review: We were in Ft. Lauderdale for work, not pleasure. When booking our hotel we were specifically looking for a hot tub. When we went to the pool area, the hot tub was boarded up. Staff quickly revealed to us that it was being removed and replaced with a fountain.

title: Hampton never disappoints
review: As always, the Hampton Inn was excellent.  Courteous and pleasant staff, spotless rooms, complimentary internet.  The breakfast was very good and kept clean and fresh even though there was a full house.

title: Mr
review: Really enjoyed stay at Hampton Inn downtown Fort Laurderdale Fl. Room was very nice and clean was able to check in early around 1:30 PM with no problem. Sleep was great in room AC unit was easy to operate work very well. Had very nice complementary breakfast each morning With nice variety of food and drinks.

title: Couples holiday
review: The Hampton Inn was very good value,the staff were friendly...Hotel was completely renovated, pool was very nice...our room was comfortable.linens were nice and fresh.I would definitely stay at this hotel again...

title: Great
review: Newly renovated and much improved. We enjoyed every aspect of our stay.  Alexander at the front desk was extremely professional and helpful. The room/furnishings were quite adequate, the breakfast was very nice and the staff were extremely friendly. All told, wonderful renovation, great location.

title: NIce Central Hotel for a Couple of Nights
review: I was a cruise traveler from the West coast and wanted to relax for a couple of nights prior to my departure.  I chose this Hampton because of the advertised shuttle, free breakfast, and surprise......small, just right menu in the bar. Most of the staff members were knowledgeable enough for my needs.  The hotel is walking distance from the Las Olas area in one direction, and the downtown area in another direction.   If .....I ever have to be in Fort Lauderdale again, I will stay at this hotel.

title: Great greetings
review: Booked this stay as an overnight for cruise next day. Was greeted warmly and professionally by Kelly. She was extremely informative about hotel and its amenities. Hilton you should take pride of Kelly.

title: na
review: The lady at the counter was rude, gave us the wrong room with king bed and gave us a attitude when we asked for a 2 queen beds, saying they were sold out . Then said they had a room after i said we were leaving parking was horrible must park valet just a bad experience all and all from start to end

title: Nice property, convenient shuttle
review: This hotel was a great choice for us.  We wanted to stay close to the Broward County Performing Arts center.  The price was great, the hotel nicely maintained and the shuttle was the best.  They take you anywhere withing 1 mile for free and on your schedule.  Not much around the hotel but Las Olas area is a quick shuttle ride and has many shops and restaurants and easy access to water taxi.

title: Great hotel, staff let it down
review: Problems with billing not identified with an attempt to recover. Nothing explained upon check-in.   Did not get a good night sleep worrying about the fact the staff told me I had not pre paid the room when in fact I had & even worse direct to hilton

title: A day in Fort Lauderdale
review: Nice place, great staff, close (walking distance) to the ocean, restaurants... Continental breakfast could use a little help, but more than enough options.  Valet parking, no option, $20 charge per day...Would stay again

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Very beautiful hotel. Beds were so comfortable. Breakfast plentiful. Bar and snacks at the store. Many options. Be prepared to spend 20 dollars for parking. But it is very secure!  Close to downtown and walking distance to many restaurants.

title: Loving it!!!
review: We felt at home! Everyone was nice and friendly. Marcus the front desk guy was supper knowledgeable about the area and was more than helpful. We have always loved staying at Hampton Inns. We will continue to stay at Hampton Inn's

title: Fantastic Bar/Restaurant
review: Michelle and is great bartender and wonderful cook. She grows her own herbs and makes delicious meals. Michelle is very friendly and personable and makes business trips enjoyable. The rooms are clean and the rest of the staff are very accommodating and friendly. As a Diamond member, I am always greeted as an honored guest.

title: No water in the bathroom and shuttle driver forgot to pick us up
review: We had an early flight and halfway through our shower we had no water! We didn't have extra time since we didn't want to miss our flight.  The night before we used the free shuttle service to an area restaurant. When we were ready to be picked up we had to call twice (the driver forgot about us after our first call) and it took over an hour to be picked up.  Check out was terrible too...no one around at the front desk (it was 6am).   Had to wait 10 minutes and needed to search for someone to help.  I would avoid this place!!

title: This property would be excellent if not for one thing
review: Nice property with good amenities.  Valet parking was an unexpected surprise for me, but at $20/day it wasn't the end of the world.  I would have rated this property as excellent but it's in a dicey area of the city.  I walked to the McDonalds restaurant about a block away and didn't really feel safe especially when I saw the restaurant had a security guard to keep the homeless at bay.  This area looks to be evolving, and I'm sure in a few years the area will be much better.

title: Nice, conveniently located hotel
review: We stayed here one night before going on a cruise. The hotel is clean and comfortable,  with many amenities included, and a friendly staff. Look for bargains by booking in advance though as the "rack price" can be fairly high during the busy season.

title: The hidden gem in Fort Lauderdale- The Hampton
review: We loved your hotel so much during our vacation.  We found everything we needed at your hotel and much more.   From an extremely clean hotel, to a luxuriously grand pool to the best and friendliest bartender- Michelle, our stay was a hit.  When we see smiles on our kids faces, we know we chose the correct place to stay at.  Hampton, until we meet again.  We will choose you anytime over any fancier or upscale hotels.  Your hotel is what everyone needs.  Great job!  Garcialeader@gmail.com

title: Not a typical Hampton
review: The hotel is great! Very clean, breakfast is more than satisfactory, the pool is well kept, gym is sufficient, and the staff is great! Our walk to and from the Broward Center is a bit dodgey...Ft. lauderdale has a lot of homeless.

title: BEWARE OF OBSCENE PARKING FEE
review: It's like may Hampton Inns, but taller as it is in a mostly city type area.   Rooms were OK.  We had 2 standard beds in our room, not queen.   The water is brownish in color.   Parking is forced to a valet for $20/night!  They drive the car about 20 feet away and park it in the garage directly attached to the hotel.   The whole point is to hijack your family for an extra $20.  Avoid this property if you can.

title: Worst Hilton Experience Ever
review: I am a Loyal Hilton, DIAMOND Member and stay at all of their brands, depending on location and need. This trip, a Hampton Convenient to where I was needing to be, worked well. I have NEVER been SO DISAPPOINTED with a Hampton Stay in my life. As a Diamond member, I should have been given a "Free Room Upgrade" Automatically upon Arrival. I was NOT. Instead, my room had a bathtub that was absolutely Disgusting. Stains throughout, "rust" or "WHO KNOWS" What? I complained to the front desk and was THEN offered a "free upgrade." I was told, the New Room was Much Nicer. It was IDENTICAL, with the exception of NO Disgusting Tub. However, the air vent in the bathroom, made very loud noises. I was offered ONE night free by The Hotel, in Accordance with their "100% Satisfaction Guaranty."…

title: Fun In Ft Lauderdale Had a wonderful time in Ft Lauderdale.
review: The staff at the Hampton are wonderful.  They were very accommodating tool of our needs.  WE had them take us downtown to the river taxi were we enjoyed riding around most of the day stopping at the different areas to enjoy eating, shopping and the beach.

title: Very "Average" but the staff are Great!
review: Being that we are Hilton Honors members, we have come to appreciate and expect a great stay when we book a Hilton property. The Hampton Inn brand is no exception. We really appreciated being picked up from the airport and our driver was very pleasant and accommodating. This property is not in the best area of town, but we were provided with a complimentary shuttle ride to Las Olas Blvd. where we found many dining options. Upon our return, we were not able to use the jacuzzi as it had been emptied and had yellow tape around it. When we had checked in, there had not been mention of the broken Jacuzzi. This was a bit of a disappointment as we had traveled all day and had looked forward to relaxing in "the bubbles" before bed. Our room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and…

title: Great place to stay
review: Bed was very comfortable, staff was friendly and the hotel was great!! Well located. We really liked this hotel. We recommend this place to everyone.Rooms were comfortable. The TV was really modern. Nice to have breakfast there.We will come here again.

title: Mother and daughter in town for a concert!!!!
review: Hotel was clean and modern and new..however the location was not so good. A good few blacks away from Las Olas Blvd, where all the shops and restaurants are, but walking was not an option due to homeless people on every corner around the hotel!!!! As two girls alone I did not feel safe in daytime or especially nighttime walking anywhere...

title: Loved it
review: We love the Hampton brand. The beds and pillows are very comfy. The service is so wonderful, polite and helpful. Close to restaurants. Love the free shuttle from the airport and to places. The shuttle driver was so wonderful.

title: Hotel Experience
review: Hotel is in a deserted location and Overpriced for the location and over charge for valet parking and no longer provide free shuttle service to the cruise ship port.  Hotel is not walking distance to stores or shops. They provide an adequate compliment breakfast.

title: Opinion
review: Good Location, room decoration is comfortable and creates a relaxing atmosphere. Excellent service from the Front Desk due Marckus, Veronica, Sly, David and Aida precise advices. Bar service totally personalized from Michelle, she prepares/customize my dinner and any salad I want and makes me feel as family. Rose goes out of her way to say hi. Also Paullet from housekeeping is very friendly and goes out of her way to make me feel comfortable since I'm living here till May. This is an amazing hotel with great facilities. Thank you for making me feel at home.

title: Business
review: Typical hotel, nothing fancy. Was a place to sleep and shower during my business trip. The only parking option is valet. Breakfast is your typical Hampton breakfast, waffles, fake egg looking omelets, pastries.

title: Updated review
review: We've stayed here several times in the last few years prior to a cruise.  The hotel has been remodeled and feels much newer and updated.  The shuttle to the cruise port is quick and easy.  It's perfect for a just an overnight, light supper with a drink, and off to the cruise the next morning. The updates in the rooms and common areas make this the quality you expect from a Hampton Inn.

title: Consistantly well-run and clean hotel
review: Good central location close to Los Olas dining and shopping.  The beach is about 2 miles away. Pool area is clean with many seating options. Attracts more business clients than cruise goers so its normally quiet.

title: Good but far from beach
review: Nice place. Hot tub broken and they do not plan to fix it. Good breakfast with different foods offered. Had to take shuttle to the beach. Close to nice shopping area about a mile or so on the shuttle. Staff was good.

title: Hampton Inn Ft Lauderdale
review: We stayed here for two nights after our cruise. They provide transport to area business and the airport, but not from the cruise port. There was everything that we would need including a nice buffet breakfast, snacks, bag lunch, coffee.  The room was very clean and again had everything that we needed.  Although the hot tub was out of order, we enjoyed the pool, fitness room and the free wi-fi. I would recommend staying here.

title: Dissatified customer
review: Upon arrival was slap in the face with a $20.00 valet parking per night charge-was not warn before arrival.it was extremely distasteful especially for a honors member. I should of been given an opportunity to choose previously weather I wanted to pay the $20.00 per night or find another hotel.

title: our manager who checked us in
review: Sylvester was the manager on call that checked us in on Sunday, Feb. 26th, 2017.  He was the nicest person that I had ever met in the hotel industry and I have traveled a great deal.  My husband is severely handicapped and he was able to check us in early.  He made us aware of the proceedings and it was such a pleasure to work with him.  We do plan to come back to Fort Lauderdale next year and we plan to book because of the service we received at the hotel.

title: Noisy Hotel
review: Do not stay here train is nearby and the noise is horrible. Train passes several times during the night makes it impossible to sleep.  The rest is what you would normally expect from a Hampton inn.  The website or the staff does not advise you of the situation before or at check in.  Also there is only valet parking available for $20 a day.

title: Great place to stay!
review: The Hampton Inn on Andrews Blvd was a great place to stay! The entire staff was always super friendly and eager to please. The rooms were quiet with super comfy beds.  The recent makeover of the rooms was  evident.  I will definitely return!

title: Marathon Trip
review: My husband, sister, and I stayed in this hotel for the Fort Lauderdale marathon. The staff was very friendly on check in and also when we had any questions throughout our stay.  Room was very clean.  The valet was great and quick.  We would definitely stay here again!

title: Not a good location for family or walkers
review: This hotel is surrounded by homeless camps and is only 3 blocks from the river and places to eat but you don't feel safe walking with so many homeless laying around the area. Staff didn't have knowledge of the area, not knowing places had been closed down. Rusted and stained tub. I would not stay here again.

title: Comfortable stay before a cruise
review: Our travel agent recommended this hotel as a convenient location before picking up a cruise at Port Everglades.  We arrived later than planned due to long queues at immigration (MIA) and locating our transfer. After a long day travelling (from the UK) all we wanted to do was get to our room and freshen up.   A really warm welcome from reception and we were very quickly checked-in and directed to our room. We had a large room with twin beds which were large and comfortable. The only complaint was the bath-tub - looked as if it could have done with a major clean or if the marks were permanent, replaced.  Breakfast the next morning was basic and self service, but adequate.We are aware that breakfast is rarely included in the US, but we had plenty to eat and a number of pleasant…

title: Staff and service
review: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Location was easy to find from the airport and close to downtown Las Olas.  Continental Breakfast was absolutely wonderful. Felt safe.  Was in town for a family wedding.

title: Nothing special
review: This Hampton Inn is very average. All of the staff were very friendly but we probably would not choose to stay here again. The bed was too soft. We stayed one night before going on a cruise. The hotel had just undergone remodeling but it wasn't evident.

title: Should be nicer
review: Room was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Hot breakfast average with a decent selection and friendly helpful staff. Hot tub was out of order. Pool was cold and looked a little green. It was empty.The pool washrooms were out of order. The location was not the best. No restaurants or stores close by although the hotel had a shuttle you could take when it was available.

title: Excellent
review: The property has been completely renovated and remodeled. The staff was terrific. The room was excellent and the location is convenient to everything downtown. I would recommend this property to anyone that is traveling to the downtown area

title: To the staff.....thank you!
review: Traveling on short notice without reservations, your staff was professional, friendly and extremely accommodating. They went above and beyond........I look forward to my next visit to S. FL. (PS: Very nice hotel in a great location as well!)

title: Great Pre-cruise hotel
review: From the first call I made to the next day's transportation to our cruise ship, our stay at this hotel was a great experience. We were picked up quickly at the airport, staff were helpful and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, and the included breakfast was fresh and generous. The shuttle to the cruise port was inexpensive and we were able to arrange for transportation to the airport post cruise. I would stay here again.

title: The place to be!
review: Wonderful hotel.  The people are really nice/helpful.I was lied to which put a sour taste in my mouth.  There was a mix up with shuttle. They said they were getting me a shuttle and would pay, but I had to pay.  No refund as of yet!

title: Not one I'd return to again
review: On the surface it looked fine. The staff was nice and helpful. However, bed linens were soiled-don't know if it was chocolate or what, but I turned back the comforter to get into bed and saw a dried brown smear-yuk! Good thing we had a double queen room. Went out to the pool area earlier in the day and there were paper towels on the bottom of the pool and the pool hadn't been cleaned in a while. How do I know this? The pool bottom and sides were green. When we brought it to the attention of staff, they called maintenance who said "I'll look into it."  Don't know what he looked into, but if it was the pool, he must have thought the green color was pretty because the next morning only the paper towels had been removed. Air conditioner didn't work - had it turned down to lowest it…

title: A decent hotel in a quiet location.
review: Pretty typical Hampton Inn.  Good service at the front desk and in the breakfast room.  May be one of the best breakfast rooms in terms of lots of helpful staff and size of room-no jockeying for tables. I liked the breakfast for fresh cut fruit as well as apples and bananas and homemade oatmeal in a crockpot.  The coffee and the usual food were very good also.  It's adjacent to the pool so you could sit out there to eat or enjoy a second cup of coffee in a lounge chair. Average pool area and the hot tub was roped off, out of service the entire time we were there.  About 4-5 city blocks to Las Olas Blvd and one more to the river walk where you can board the water taxi.  I had read that some people were disturbed by the homeless.  Yes, they were in both cities we visited but they…

title: Pre cruise night
review: The room/accomodations were very nice and clean.  There is a small bar that serves 4-5 items at night in lieu of nearby restaurants, although the hotel does provide a shuttle service to certain restaurants.  Continental breakfast was provided.  Better than average.

title: Nice, friendly and quiet
review: I stayed here on a business trip and was pleased with the accommodations. The hotel has been updated and looks modern and clean. The valets who attended my rental car were polite, professional and courteous. They even asked if I was checking out the following day and when I confirmed I was, told me they would park the car nearby so I wouldn't have to wait (and then followed through). Hotel staff were all very professional and friendly. The room was really nice and met my requirements for a great stay (quiet, dark when the lights are off, comfortable bed, plenty of places to plug in my phone next to the bed). The hotel felt very safe and secure. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

title: Expensive downtown hotel not worth the cost.
review: $200 a night and $20/day for valet parking but all you get is an average hotel. Quality of breakfast is poor. Staying downtown should be worth the cost but this hotel is not worth it. Bathroom had a stained tub and water has discoloration. There are placards saying why the water is discolored but I've never seen this before while in South Florida.

title: great
review: one of the best hampton inns I've stayed at! really great distance from the beach and the airport. The breakfast is better than usual free hotel breakfasts. Staff was friendly and check in was speedy.

title: Great hotel
review: Very clean,good location, friendly and helpful  stuff . I enjoy my stay although it  was only one night. I really appreciate the shuttle service - make your trip so much easy.We had horrible  flight  so I was so happy that I just call the hotel and they sent the shuttle to pick us up.

title: This Is Obligatory, But I Will Complete It Solely Because I Started The Process
review: The property is conveniently located and very clean. I suspect that it will be a prime location in the next few years or so, as Downtown Fort Lauderdale is a growing area.   I've stayed here a few times and I have always enjoyed my stay. The rooms are a nice value for the location. The staff is generally very helpful and courteous.   Peaches, the manager on duty, is very helpful and professional.

title: Nice for business travelers
review: If you are traveling for business and will just use this hotel to sleep it is nice.  If you are on vacation or have your family with you then you probably want to stay at a hotel ar the beach.  Just don't stay here anyway because there isn't anything to do and doesn't seem like a nice neighborhood.

title: One night in Lauderdale
review: Cruise vacation Pre boarding night in Fort Lauderdale. Location was close to the port and also close to restaurants downtown lauderdale very convenient location with valet parking.  The trip through Fort Lauderdale was interesting to say the least

title: AMAZING NEWLY RENOVATED HOTEL
review: The hotel has an Amazing staff that goes out of their way to make you feel right at home. As you walk in the lobby you a greeted with a smile from their front desk staff.  On the second floor is where they serve an fantastic breakfast buffet from 6am to 10am and at 5pm the bar opens up  and has a great dinner selection to choose from if you don't feel like going out with great conversation from their bartenders. This is an Amazing little HIDEAWAY  to escape and enjoy time to relax.

title: "Sunshine in my pocket"
review: How can you go wrong leaving Maryland and arriving at FLL for a conference.  Well you simply cannot!!!  I arrived at my hotel and was immediately greeted by the front desk team of Marcus Davis and Aida Nunn.  They could not have ben any more engaging and helpful  Aida only 2 weeks on the job was a quick study and she carried herself as a longtime member of the Hampton Team.  Marcus....What a professional and personable young man.  Hailing from Landover MD, we quickly connected.  He made sure all was good for me in every aspect of my stay.  He has a very bright future within the Hilton corporation.  Two wonderful reps of the Hampton Inn that one again reinforce why I keep coming back!!!

title: Aging Hotel - Like Most Hilton Properties
review: I've stayed at this property several times.  Overall, the staff is very nice.  They seem genuine.  The hotel is aging.  They have done some remodeling of the guest rooms and common areas.  Like MOST Hilton properties, the infrastructure is neglected.  I had a roof leak in my bathroom.  They were able to move me to another room.  You'd think they would offer a me a drink or something, but no.    Parking is valet only now.  The porters were friendly and prompt.  The place is clean. Breakfast is OK; the hostess, Rose, was very nice.    There are train tracks nearby.  You will hear train whistles blowing.    I've been a Diamond Member for many years; ALL of the properties I've visited need work.

title: Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale
review: Stayed at the hotel for one night business trip.  New hotel so everything was fresh and clean.  Service was excellent from check in to shuttle bus to dinner location.  Only negative about this facility is that the surrounding neighborhood is a little iffy and closest decent dining is 15-20 minute walk so we were advised to use hotel shuttle or car to get to restaurants.

title: Nice Clean Friendly Hotel - Not Directly in Las Olas Restaurant Area
review: We selected this hotel for a post cruise stay as it was titled as being in the Las Olas area and we didn't have a car so were hoping to minimize walking to the area.  The staff were very friendly, the hotel and room were very clean. We soon realized that the hotel was in a business area and not directly in the boutique/restaurant Las Olas area. That area was about a one kilometer (.67 mile) walk.  The hotel offered a shuttle to the area. The shuttle service was a bit confusing i.e. to various locales it was free for up to one mile then cost above that distance. The shuttle service is on an as requested basis. Also, was free to the airport but cost to go to cruise port. The hotel had a breakfast starting at 6:00 a.m. Travelers should be aware that there is no restaurant in the…

title: Great Stay
review: Stayed overnight prior to leaving on a cruise. Very clean, with friendly service. Great valet parking at no charge. Breakfast has a great variety and was hot and included in the price of the room. We ate by the pool which was very relaxing. We will stay here again next year!!! Not the greatest section of town but we felt safe in the hotel.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Stayed here about 3 times and loved it. Would have booked it again this year but price increased so much we were not prepared to pay. The Canadian dollar is worth so much less than US dollar it makes a difference  Not sure why the rates increased so much

title: Convenient but flawed hotel
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a couple of two night periods in January, 2017 surrounding a wedding that we attended in Boca Raton.  The location in Fort Lauderdale was extremely convenient for our stay in south Florida.  My wife has a bad back, so when we made the reservations online, we requested a bedboard on one of the beds, and the request was reflected on the written confirmation.  When we checked in, we found that they had no bedboards.  We had to go to a Home Depot and buy a piece of plywood, which we used as a bedboard.  When we checked out for the second time, we couldn't take the bedboard with us on our plane trip home, so I informed the hotel that we were leaving the bedboard with them and where they could find it.  If they stored it somewhere, anyone who…

title: Wonderful Sausage Gravy For Breakfast
review: Decent clean hotel in downtown FL Lauderdale. Aida at front desk was helpful with early check in and lunch recommendations. Properly appears to have a lot of pre cruise guests. A must try at breakfast is the sausage gravy...simply the best. Property has a small ba on the second floor, unusual for a Hampton Inn. A 10 minute walk to Las Olas. Ok to walk to during daytime, but take Uber or free shuttle in evening as there are lots of homeless hitting you up for money. Many appeared drunk, there is a large homeless camp near the library

title: Very convenient
review: The guests at this hotel seemed to consist almost entirely of people like us--either about to board a cruise liner or having just disembarked. And with good reason. There is a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, and the shuttle from the hotel to the pier is only $8.   The entire hotel has just been renovated and is lovely. The rooms are large and well laid out, and breakfast was fine. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only exception was the shuttle that takes you to nearby restaurants. There were no restaurants close enough for us AARP members to walk to easily. When asked about the shuttle, the front desk would call the shuttle driver. The answer was always the same. He will be here in a few minutes. That was true, if 20 minutes falls into the definition of "a few…

title: Excellent Family and Budget Friendly Hotel
review: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown Las Olas from December 30 - January 2, 2017.  It was a great experience, very modern hotel, nice rooms and the breakfast was good every morning.  Of course they had the make your own waffle station, and the hot bar selections were also very good with different selections each morning I was there.  Very friendly staff, only drawback is the parking is valet only.  The location was convenient, a 10 minute drive to the beach, 5 minute drive to downtown restaurants, and only a few miles drive to the interstate.

title: Good hotel in improving area
review: We booked this hotel for a night pre-cruise and got a good rate.  Free shuttle from airport to hotel.   The hotel was just renovated and has a nice look.  The rooms were cozy and it was quiet but we were on the 9th floor.  Like the security where you need the room key to get to a floor. Aida at the front desk was great as we got in way early for check in, but she allowed us to keep our luggage on a cart and stored it for us (4 of us).  She was also friendly and patient with our many questions. Breakfast was good and the two staff worked hard at keeping up--most of the time, doing well.  It was different to have the breakfast area on the 2nd floor though.  Big negative-- shuttle service. They have a third party shuttle service "Tourism in Motion".   They have free service from…

title: Teddy is the best!
review: We visited this Hampton Inn on Saturday after a week long cruise with a large group of friends. Somehow in our booking half of us got booked in a Hampton Inn 25 minutes away and the other half got booked with this one. We were only going to be staying for a few hours before we had to catch our flights home. Teddy the manager did whatever he could to get us all booked at this hotel even though it was such last minute. He was awesome and we greatly appreciated all of his help! We took a shuttle to lunch and also a shuttle to the airport at 5 am and those two guys were awesome as well. The rooms were extremely clean and very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great customer service!

title: Hampton on andrews
review: Great hotel..great breakfast, but dont like that now you have to valet your car. The hotel has renovated completely. Now they need to work on parking. Other than tjat its wonderful and safe and has great coffee

title: Enjoy our time there until check out
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for taking the time to share your review regarding your recent stay at the Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale/Downtown Las Olas Area.  As you mentioned, we did recently do a full renovation of the entire hotel.  We are so pleased with the results and very happy to hear you are too!  We look forward to having you here again,   Hampton Inn Management

title: Downtown Experience
review: Second time at this hotel, rooms been refurbished and nice and clean that's why we went back. All happened at check out when Kelly said we hadn't payed for our stay which we shown her our hotel voucher, got home and they had taken money out of our bank with out our say

title: Professional personnel
review: I would say the hotel apply on high standards. The facilities as pool and fitness center are offered.   What I appreciate the most. I forgot my iWatch at hotel room. I called to hotel and asked about my iWatch and they found it and shipped it to me.   I am really glad for very serious honest and professional service. I would like to thank to manager Peaches Crawford, front desk and house keeping person who found my iWatch.   I would definitely return to the Hampton Inn in Ft. Lauderdale/Downtown.

title: Poor Quality Control
review: I have been a Property Manager.  In one week, I would have your place in shape.   Nobody checked on the staff, obviously.  Forgetting a wake-up call could have caused us to miss our flight.  Who would have paid for the changed flight???? All the outlets were never checked.  Maintenance should be done before you rent the room.

title: Pre-cruise stay
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for taking the time to fill out a survey regarding your recent stay with us.  We are sorry we were not able to provide you with a better quality of service. This is not typical of our usual Hamptonality and welcoming staff, and we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. We try hard to make sure all of our guests have a great stay as we are all about Satisfaction Guaranteed. Thank you for your feedback and we hope you will come back and stay with us again.  Safe travels and a very happy New Year!  Hampton Inn Management

title: Great location for Las Olas Blvd
review: We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn the day prior to our cruise departure. The staff were fabulous and went out of their way to make sure our stay was smooth: from adding us an extra room, to booking the shuttle for us, etc. Free shuttle was awesome, as we didn't want to rent a car for one night. Hotel pool area was nice, and we were able to sit outside and eat pizza that we had ordered and then just chill afterwards. The breakfast area and other areas of the hotel were very clean and nice. Room was fine too. Bathrooms were the only negative that we could discern -- each of us had a bathroom that was rather beat-up looking. The bathtubs were scratched and dirty looking and definitely in need of replacing. Other than that, it was a perfect stay.

title: NICE!
review: Great place to stay pre-cruise. We arrived very early (10 am) and they took our number to call us when we the room was ready and we left our bags with them and headed out.  We took a short walk (about a mile) to Publix to pick up wine for the cruise and then headed to the river front for lunch.  During lunch they called that the room was ready - everything was clean and comfortable.  Then we headed back to Las Olas Blvd. - great eating and drinking place along with cute boutiques and only a few blocks away.  The hotel had a station where we were able to sign up for transfers to the cruise port, which ended up being very easy.  They loaded our luggage and dropped us off right where the porters were.  Also a very nice breakfast was included so we could take it easy in the morning…

title: Las Olas Hotel
review: I always stay in this hotel.  It is clean and neat and very close to downtown Ft. Lauderdale and Las Olas where there is lots to do. It is so nice to wake up to a hot breakfast and hot coffee.  Room overlooked pool and pool area was kept nicely.

title: Location, Location
review: We planned to be in Fort Lauderdale for New Year's eve to enjoy the downtown celebrations. Hampton Inn seemed to be a great location. It is a ten minute walk to Las Olas Blvd, so the Las Olas designation was a bit misleading. There is a shuttle that will take you there, but with a full hotel, that was going to be a challenge. We easily walked it but were a bit concerned. The downtown is still a questionable area, especially in the evening. There were lots of homeless that gather at the library in the evening for shelter, but they never bothered us a bit.   The evening celebrations took place around the Civic centre with free bands, many lively clubs and lots of people enjoying themselves. At midnight, the anchor drops and there was a very pathetic fireworks display that was so…

title: Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale
review: Nice hotel, clean and all the staff were very friendly The breakfast staff were  especially pleasant.  They were very quick to refill any empty dishes and beverages - the hotel was quite full and it seemed like everyone came to breakfast at the same time!

title: Great stay for post cruise
review: We booked this hotel because we wanted to try a new location. What a great decision.  This hotel is ideally located.  The hotel itself is clean as are the rooms and breakfast areas. Front staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was actually very good.  They also offer a shuttle from/to the airport.  There is a also a shuttle to the cruise port for just $8.  We used the cruise port shuttle and had no problems.  The ideal location allowed us to walk around a bit and explore. We walked to the riverfront area and really enjoyed it. Caution: there are several homeless folks in the area but none of them approached us.  It was simply something I wasn't used to seeing.

title: Nice large room
review: Attempting to get to the hotel was a feat in and of itself. We were suppose to take a hotel shuttle from the cruise line to the hotel but the shuttle went to the wrong port. We had been waiting for over 45 min So we decided on taking an uber. After our uber ride we found out our driver over charged us. Once at the Hotel we were greeted by Ms Fatima. Where she made everything all right. She was able to check us in early as well as put us in a larger room. The room was very nice and spacious. She was professional, informative..... just plain awesome. She went above and beyond.....TYVM. The Hotel has a large area to sit and have breakfast as well as a nice pool and jacuzzi Spa (spa was being repaired). We are doing another cruise soon and we plan on staying here again. Is a short…

title: Area so so, hotel is nice with friendly service and convenient location. quick trip to beach, close to cruise port/air
review: The Hotel is clean and service was very good. We traveled a day early for a cruise.  The area is ok, but we used car service to the beach and Ship. Free shuttle from airport was quick and nice. would recommend the hotel.

title: Great ease of in and out plus CENTRALLY LOCATED!
review: Daily parking $20 all valet. Excellent location and the shuttle really helps to get around to food, etc.  Maid service is great as well ........................................................ .................................................................................................... The GM wouldn't change the room cost to what I was sent via email in September tho.

title: Great place!
review: Very clean hotel and very nice staff. Shuttle even took us to las olas that night so me and my friends could go out! Front desk was helpful and room was very clean. Only there for one night but the stay was great!

title: Disappointing
review: Our room had large rust spots in the bathtub. The tub was also dingy looking. We asked for another room and the 2nd room also had some rusting in the tub (not as bad) as well as a similar dingy appearance. In addition, the toilet required 3-4 flushes in order to completely empty. The complimentary breakfast was ok but had some issues. They ran out of coffee on one occasion and milk on another. There was no one close by to take care of this.

title: Great Location
review: This hotel is close to places to eat, shop, and it has shuttles to/from the airport and Port Everglades. The shuttle will also take you to places that are within a mile of the hotel so you can pick up any last minute items.

title: Stayed here to attend family member'since wedding
review: Loved this hotel. Great value at a time of year when there are many.many . demands on the budget. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. This includes the front desk, breakfast, housekeeping and valet staff. Will visit again.

title: Teddy Rocks!
review: The entire staff, from housekeeping to front desk were amazingly attentive.  Special shout out to Teddy and MICHELLE.  Rooms:  CLEAN  Breakfast:  Great variety and quality  Shuttle:  On time everytime  Rooms:  Spacious, updated & CLEAN

title: Mediocre
review: For the price. Not worth it. Unfriendly staff especially at breakfast. Not walking from las olas at all; touristy part anyway. I wouldn't necessarily stay here again. They don't have a shuttle to port either. They will charge $8/person

title: Great value if you are cruising.
review: Newer design, very clean with super nice staff. Best value around for keeping your car while you cruise and offering both drop off and pick up at the port. Also had a better than average breakfast buffet.

title: Great Stay
review: Teddy was outstanding in his kind attention to detail and empathetic spirit He helped salvage our 5 year Anniversary after a horrific experience with Spirit Airlines the world,industry,needs more Teddies!!

title: Stay away
review: This is a terrible property.  Poor check in as a Hilton diamond member.  Not even welcomed to the hotel or given the Hilton diamond member welcome gift.  Room was dirty. Bed not comfortable.  Air conditioner didn't work.

title: Good Hotel but not a great location
review: I have stayed here for a week. Location is close to Las O Las but surroundings of hotel doesn't look safe post sunset. Breakfast buffet and room cleanliness are good, but expect smell of paint and chemicals as Hotel is under renovation.

title: Clean and professional
review: I enjoyed this hotel very much it was in the Heart of the City had access to Airport restaurants stores it was very accessible from anywhere loved it staff was nice and helpful in every way the breakfast us were on point the attendance everyone was willing to help in every way definitely will visit is Hotel again

title: Bait and switch
review: Made the reservation and getting checked in then they tell me oh by the way there's a 20 a night parking fee (valet) if I'm paying $200 a night then I should be able to park for free so I stayed one night and left to go to another hotel where parking was free. I made a phone reservation and they should mention that in the booking process.Oh and the view is of bums sleeping outside at the next building.

title: Great Stay
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel.  We apologize that you were not aware of our parking fees.  We do have it listed in a few different places on our website as well as on the confirmation e-mails we send out to arriving guests.  Our worldwide reservation department does have this information as well and should have disclosed this to you when you made the reservation.  Perhaps they somehow overlooked it during the phone call.    We are glad to see that you did still enjoy your sleep quality and the cleanliness of our hotel.  We hope to see you again in the future!  Happy Holidays and Safe travels!

title: Great place to stay
review: We stayed 1 night between our cruise and flight home. Its a good location, a short walk from the Tarpon River and Las Olas Boulevard with all of the restaurants and shopping. We walked along the River Pathway system and there are lots of eateries open, even on a Sunday evening.

title: Has gone done hill and still under renovation
review: I have stayed here about 6 nights in 2016 - I am a diamond member and travel for work to Ft Lauderdale - each stay this year there has been a problem - the remodeling has been done very poorly - there seems no attention to detail - this time had to kick open a door to walk down steps - last stay had to ram shoulder into room door to get it to open - door jam was totally out of whack - and now they require everyone to valet park - for a $20 charge - had a problem with the valet - they parked my truck across street where they did not have permission - ended up with a bright sticker on truck window for illegally parking - Assistant Manager told me that don't control the valet - outside company - not an excuse I wanted to hear,  Wrote an email both to manager ( Peaches) and…

title: I wanted to like it...really!
review: We stayed here for my mom's sixtieth birthday on July 29th. We were cruising the next day and I was in charge of getting the hotel for us six adults. My mom also has advanced stage four cancer, so we really wanted this to be special.   I read many of the reviews beforehand and was nervously optimistic on getting this hotel. It was in the middle of a remodel and the reviews were mixed, some down right harsh, but I booked anyway.   On arrival, the young woman checking us in was so nice. She even gave my mom a 'birthday' welcome basket. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly. After twenty minutes, we got our room keys and went up to our rooms and I was shocked. Once the elevator opened up, we were met with hot stuffy air and fresh paint-- but that was ok because we lucked…

title: Love this Hotel!
review: Great hotel in a central location in downtown FLL! I came here for business for an extended stay, and definitely enjoyed my stay! Rooms are a decent size, clean, and modern. The pool is a nice size and great "rooftop" type atmosphere. I thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, especially the quiches. However my favorite part was the staff! Marcus at the front desk was always friendly and willing to help me find what I needed. Michelle the bartender is the best! She makes excellent drinks and great conversation. I highly recommend visiting the bar on a weeknight when she's there. Rose who manages the breakfast area in the mornings was always offering to clear my plate and even offered to get more juice or water if I needed it! The van driver who does the airport pickups…

title: Amazing Service, Excellent Bar
review: Had to spend a month here. One of the greatest stays I've ever had. They want to make sure you have everything you need for your stay. The bar is the best part. Michelle is the bartender and makes it a point to see that your experience is number 1. She is amazing, polite and very friendly. If you ever have the chance to visit Fort Lauderdale make sure you make this hotel your choice!

title: A nice surprise
review: Very new and extremely clean. Large spacious rooms very quiet. This is the first Hampton I've stayed in that had a bar! Great for those doing business in downtown fort Lauderdale. Great price and a fantastic value!

title: Accommodations
review: I hosted an event in this hotel with over 140 females for a weekend. I was totally satisfied with the service I received from Katherine, Gwynne and Norma in sales, Fatima and Marcus at the front desk, Alan, Lenox and Wilson as the housemen and Ayda and Rose for breakfast. They made our stay at this hotel so much better. Their customer service was exceptional and I will highly recommend this hotel professionally and personal. I am retired military and we are always looking for a hotel in the Ft Lauderdale Fl.

title: Grown and Sexy
review: The staff (Katherine, Fatima, Teddy, and Lenox) were very polite and extremely helpful throughout our stay.  Robert provided excellent service for over 140 women to our all White Dinner.  This event couldn't have been successful without their outstanding support.

title: Girls trip
review: It was a nice hotel, the food and drinks was pretty good. It was always cold in the hotel. The staff was really nice and helpful. The hotel was really clean.  I didn't like being forced to Valet park my car.

title: Grown and Sexy 2016
review: Overall was a excellent location clean breakfast was awesome they even had if you missed breakfast to go bags at the front desk as well as delicious fresh made oatmeal cookies, my only suggestion is the shuttle service needs to expand its proximity in which it goes to for guest

title: Very good price/quality balance
review: It has all you need, not more but there's nothing missing. Great business center for free. I find it's not that close to Las Olas Boulevard so having it in the hotel's name is a little disappointing. I hoped we could be able to go out without using the car but not.

title: Grown and Sexy Trip
review: My trip and my stay was amazing.  The staff was excellent. No matter what was requested  whether it was the valet, or guest services it was always provided with pleasure.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great customer service
review: I was there for a girls weekend that involved a very large group of ladies and we were serviced by some amazing staff. Shout out to Fatima, Lenox, Katherine, Teddy and the valets. They were very accommodating and made our stay like home. I will definitely be looking to stay there again on my next trip to the area.  The rooms were clean and the breakfasts were hot! Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

title: great expericence!!
review: We had a amazing four day weekend in this hotel. We had over 140 woman in this hotel and had awesome experience. One the best hotel in the area. Teddy was the best he made sure that we had everything we needed or ask for. Teddy keep up the good work!!!

title: Good bang for your buck
review: Booked this for a 2nt stay after a cruise. The staff was extremely pleasant, room was satisfactory, complimentary breakfast fine. Off the beaten path, thought it was closer to the beach but the pool was fine for our purpose and a short drive to the beach. I would rate it 3 stars.

title: Great people eager to provide a good experience
review: We stayed in room 211 and while the new remodel makes this a lovely room, there is a fan or noise from a mechanical room in an adjacent room next door making sleep difficult without earplugs. In addition, the pool and people socializing at table and chairs are only about 5 feet outside the window. The hotel staff offered to move us to a new room and reduced the cost to a reasonable rate-both fair solutions to the problem. Pros: the second floor has the breakfast room and a small bar with soundproof doors to separate the sleeping rooms and preserve the quiet. Also, there is a hallway to the parking ramp on this floor, too. The valet parking was quick and allowed "in and out" service for the single fee. Cons: avoid this room till they figure out how to eliminate the noise! Don't…

title: Thanks Teddy!
review: We were forced to overnight in Fort Lauderdale by Spirit after a missed connection. Our group arrived to find Spirit had not made the reservation for the four rooms. Teddy at the front desk was able to process our vouchers, get us checked in, even offered us his pizza that had been delivered for his dinner. This guy rocked.   Hotel has great breakfast in the morning. Rooms are comfortable, shuttle driver to and from the airport was great.  Absolutely no complaints - I will send my clients here in a heartbeat.

title: Great nights sleep
review: We were there for a show at he arts center. The hotel was a great lunch cation, nice to have had he shuttle drop us off and pick us up. The hotel was very clean, xtreemely comfortable bed, the breakfast was good, and a very nice staff.

title: I'll be back!
review: My kids loved the complimentary breakfast. And I loved the "around the clock coffee". Thanks again. Beautiful Lobby. And I will not forget the free shuttle bus from the airport. Staff was professional and made my trip extra enjoyable! Again, thanks!

title: Good base for cruise port
review: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel had good sized rooms with comfy beds and accessories , well located for Las Olas, the Riverwalk and museums. Walked to Galleria but wouldn't recommend it (Got taxi back) the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to Las Olas for your dinner of for a browse in the shops and for $8 each the hotel provided transport to the cruise port.   The hotel has a pool although the hit tub was out of action during our stay.  We had breakfast but hat was a bit limited, it was also a surprise to eat it out of 'paper plates and bowls' although we did get enough to eat. We'd come back here.

title: Great place to stay - a home away from home with real food for breakfast
review: The Valet Parking Employees & Front Desk Staff were warm and friendly.  They have coffee in the lobby and breakfast on the 2nd Floor.  The breakfast was great and consisted of fresh fruit salad, individual cheese omelettes, turkey sausage links plus waffles, juice, toast, bagels, yogurt, coffee and tea.  The rooms were lovely, crisp and clean.  They are in the process of upgrading and it is a top notch job.  We chose this hotel for the proximity to the Broward Center for the Performing Arts, which is in walking distance.

title: Great new rooms, same great service.
review: Love the newly renovated rooms and public spaces.  Location is very convenient to Downtown and Wilton Manors.  FYI, they started valet parking only on November 1st, 2016.  $20 per day to park.  I heard the front desk giving directions, suggestions for things to do in the area, giving great service like a concierge at a larger hotel.

title: Very good in everything!
review: I stayed there before a cruise, complimentary shuttle from airport, complimentary shuttle to and from Olas boulevard area, $8 fee to take us to the pier, good room and fair breakfast, good place for the value..

title: Perfect
review: We used this hotel to take advantage of their sale away service - we had a perfect night - left our car - had shuttle service to cruise port and back to hotel - very nice arrangement and the staff is EXCELLENT !!!!

title: Downtown Ft. Lauderale
review: We chose this hotel because it's close to the Revolution Club where we were going to see a show. We were surprised that the hotel has a free shuttle bus that takes guests anywhere within a one-mile radius. Very handy! Our room was newly renovated - very sleek and comfortable. Our stay was totally worth the money!

title: Leisure trip
review: Place was under renovations dust on railings to second floor and around lobby and where food served ,staff not overly friendly ,not welcoming feeling staying there,complimentary food was surprisingly good

title: Great overnight Pre-Cruise Stay
review: This hotel was booked by my FABULOUS travel agent for our pre-cruise stay the night before our cruise. This hotel was very nice. The front desk guy Marcus was AWESOME! Helped us with everything we needed to get checked in and to make sure we enjoyed our stay. This hotel was within walking distance to a downtown area near the water with lots of places to eat and drink.   Our room was wonderful as well. King sized bed non smoking. The bed was very comfortable. The next morning on the 2nd floor they serve a complementary all you can eat breakfast. They had make your own Belgian waffles, eggs, pastries, etc. you name it they seemed to have it. It all tasted great. It was a very pleasant stay in our very short time there.

title: Perfect Location
review: Close to the Bills game for our fan group Great access to Riverfront bars and tour.. Great staff.  Pool area perfect to relax between pub stops. Shuttle service another compliment. Can be summed up in less than 200 words.

title: Great stay-4days
review: Excellent experience . Checked in quickly. Parking was available and easy. Beautiful lobby and very nice breakfast area and patio by the pool.  Current renovations did not cause any problems.  Staff were very helpful.

title: dressers in the room
review: Over all I was not happy with my stay at your hotel, very accommodating.  I will not be recommending nor will I be staying at your hotel again. Parking should be included in the hotel rate. You need to put dressers back in the rooms!

title: Great hotel, great location for downtown
review: Hampton Inns rarely disappoint for me and this was no exception.  If you like Los Olas area this is a great location.  Just a few blocks.  Right downtown.  Clean even during their remodel.  Staff was super friendly.

title: Perfect overnight destination
review: We spent a romantic evening in the city enjoying Post Modern Jukebox convert at the Broward Center which was an easy walk from the Hampton Inn.  The hotel was perfect. parking garage, gorgeous new decor and a stylish cozy room with an over-sized lounge chair by the window.  we cuddled so long we missed dinner!   no worries .. we walked to the old fort lauderdale breakfast house for scrumptious homemade extra think toast topped with breakfast basics.  The bedding, the bathroom slider, the decor all made this romantic get-away perfect.  we never used the car, able to walk everywhere and if we needed, the hotel shuttle is available for free (within a mile which is very convienent to lots of los olas and downtown).   we will repeat!

title: Best non-beach location
review: Although this Hampton inn isn't the closest to the beach, the location of this hotel is best for just about everything else.  There is fine shopping and dining on Las Olas Blvd, the city center is two blocks away, and I love the indoor, protected parking.  And as for getting there, Broward Boulevard will lead you directly to the highways and back.  I love this hotel.

title: Under construction
review: Lots of maintenance issues that were not dealt with in spite of construction workers all over the place.  Area is a little sketchy.  The building across the street is a haven for homeless people and there was very stinky human excrement on the corner. We were awakened in the night by a drunk driver who hit and run a power pole.  I would not walk here after dark. The entire hotel is gray, gray, gray - depressing! Parking garage is free, but very tight getting in and out.

title: They were doing extensive renovations but this hotel still rocked!
review: So I was here during the hurricane this year. The staff were all amazing. The hotel never shut down or anything. All services were still available. The only thing that shut down was the first floor of the parking garage. Other than that, this place was fantastic. It is walking distance from pretty much all of downtown and the water. The rooms were so modern, comfortable and clean. They also, have free coffee all day long...which I oddly haven't seen in a while. I would recommend this place very much!

title: A nice hotel
review: I didn't get to see much of the hotel because I wasn't there long. However, I can say that the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower was very nice with the shower head being high enough for a person of 6 foot 4inches to fit without having to duck. The staff was friendly and accommodating. And the hotel is only a 5 minute ride from the cruise port.

title: Staff was wonderful
review: Hampton Inn beds are so comfy. The front desk staff were very friendly and worked very hard to please.it was nice to see young people take their jobs seriously and really provide customer service. It is also nice that they provide a shuttle to almost anywhere   close by

title: Great service
review: Everything was Super. The front desk with Veronica and Fatima. They could not have been more helpful. Its nice to stay somewhere where you are treated so well ! This Hotel is close to everything. Thank you again for a very nice stay !!!

title: This property just completed a MAJOR remodel.
review: I stayed in a newly remodeled room and found it comfortable.  I could tell that the results of this project were going to be a great improvement.  There was some parking inconvenience, but easily overlooked.    Just a 'head's up,' about my check-out experience.  The room rate I had reserved for was changed on my checkout bill and was increased by $40.00/night.  Normally, I don't examine too closely the bill that is slid under the door, but for a 4 night stay, I did notice the additional $160!  The accountant reviewed and copied my reservation confirmation.  He blamed it on a computer system that automatically changed the rate when I checked in.  I wish this hadn't happened because it made me suspicious of this property management.  I hope this doesn't happen to you.  The part of…

title: Exceptionally clean and comfortable
review: my room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The king-size bed with extra pillows allowed for a good night's sleep. Nice view of downtown Ft Lauderdale from the upper levels of the hotel. A hot breakfast was included and was good. There is a charge to park your vehicle in the parking garage, which I didn't fully understand. I would prefer to have the parking fees included in the room rate. Otherwise, this was a great stay!

title: Great visit
review: Even though it's being renovated, staff is terrific! New rooms are NICE!  Front desk helped me with everything, check in, directions, parking.  Forgot my razor, no problem, front desk had one for me in 30 seconds. Everyone is friendly.

title: Nice option
review: Thanks for the availability.  Nice lobby.  Breakfast available and good.  Rooms seemed clean except for the dirty sock found under the chair.  Pool was clean and accessible.  Within walking distance to a large variety of good options.

title: Quick getaway
review: Very profesional and friendly staff. We were on our honeymoon and had to encounter Mr. Matthew aka hurricane Matthew but we got lucky and only had some rain. The staff made all the the necesarry arrangements to make us feel safe!

title: Hampton inn/ft. Lauderdale
review: The hotel is nice.the shuttle to market&airport is good to have. Yes they take you to a market and wait for you all for free! Rooms and staff is nice.  CONS: hotel is renovating. NO PLACE TO SIT IN SMALL LOBBY WITH A TABLE TO DRINK OR BE ON YOUR TABLET. You can walk to restaurant in ten minutes. PROS: nice complimentary breakfast. Airport shuttle. Market shuttle. Friendly front staff.nice pool area.but small efficient workout room.BUS STATION ACROSS STREET AND TROLLEY RIGHT THERE. YOU CAN GO ANYWHERE (BEACH,MALL,SHOPPING) ALL ON TROLLEY OR BUS RIGHT THERE! BEST THING ABOUT THIS PLACE.

title: I'm still fuming
review: They charged the wrong card....they we charges we weren't informed of..we were told the money would take days to go back on...the receptionist  hung up on us numerous times after we left and was trying to follow up on our funds..then we were threatened with cops.

title: Not to bad....
review: The hotel is under renovations and we knew that in advance, however not all information was adequately disclosed.  For example, when asked in advance if the restaurant was open we were told that it was, but really, food was available if you called in delivery.  The bar was not open either.  The signs all said the pool was available, but we were not permitted to go out there, even though we just wanted to sit out on the lounge chairs and not swim.  The neighborhood is a little run down, so we didn't walk too far for food.  The room renovations are nice with very appealing colors and new floors, but when you look out our window and see the run down area you are in, it seems a bit out of place.  The staff was nice, even though our room was not ready upon check in.  The staff…

title: The jury is still out
review: On the edge of the bad part of town. Don't expect a view. Unsavory characters roaming the street. The staff was excellent. Rooms were nice and clean. If you choose not to pay for using their secured parking garage and your car ends up missing don't be surprised. No valet parking and no room service. Take out menus for 4 pizza joints and 1 Chinese you have to go to front desk to order. Renovations are going on so don't plan on sleeping in.

title: Great hotel... Even under renos
review: We got a good deal here possibly due to the renos. Where we stayed there were no issues.  Great updated rooms and staff. The free breakfast was basic, but met expectations. The fun surprise was the free shuttle to the bars.  Amazing location as well.

title: A bit off the beaten path and currently under extensive renovation
review: Stayed here two nights a couple of weeks ago.  The hotel is under extensive renovation, so it's perhaps unfair to review it at this time.  A bit off the beaten path in terms of nightlife, but they offer free shuttle service to popular restaurants such as those on Las Olas Blvd.  Buffet breakfast was good but not exceptional.  My room was clean, although the corridors were rather dirty, perhaps due to the renovation.  One of the elevators had a malfunctioning room key reader, which was frustrating.  .  Didn't get my usual HHonors welcome gift upon check-in, but I let it go.

title: Going through renovations
review: Usually love Hampton Inn; however, would have appreciated knowing that they were remodeling this particular one so that we could choose another nearby Hampton.  The noise kept us up and there was construction/dust everywhere.  Staff, however, was extremely helpful and room was nice.  Would stay again, after construction is completed.

title: I wish I had known renovations were under way
review: You always hate to get surprises when you arrive at your hotel for the evening. I was traveling on business, and arrived early evening to the sound of saws and hammers. The staff, however, were as friendly as they could be. They had no control about the environment. At least my room was updated, but there was no  AC in the hallway. The breakfast was mediocre at best.  I will be interested to visit the hotel after the renovations are complete.

title: One night
review: The place is under renovation, the desk service was great. They gave us an oversized room on the first floor, twin king sized beds.  Thai place across the street, very good food.   3:45 wake up call was on time ... Flying into Barbados.   Though our sty was just a few hours, it was a good experience

title: Has potential, remodeling is great, staff needs some training about not assigining the same room/keys to multiple guest
review: Checked in to this hotel to be near the airport on the last night of a "girls vacation."  Lobby and many floors of the hotel are under MAJOR remodel. Looks like it will be really nice when completed. Checked in then waited 10 minutes for an elevator, because they were tied up with workers carting down large trash cans of garbage. (apparently no service elevators).  Not a deal breaker.   Get to the room and the air conditioning unit is pulled apart and the front cover is on the floor  and no air on.  Call the front desk and we are told to come back down and they will give us new keys.  I ask, "are you kidding me?  We have to wait for the elevator again, and bring back all of our luggage to come back up with new keys?"  The response is yes.  Great customer service!  However, a…

title: Did not enjoy this stay AT ALL
review: I stayed here before and the service was ok, they are under construction and when I came back they was still under construction, which wasn't a problem for me..the issue I had was the noise not with the construction but the damn guest..I was on the 7th floor and I guess I had some young kids on the same floor as me and the halls really late around 12am to 2pm making all kinds of noise then to top it off someone from the front called me at 11pm trying to get my credit card info when I refuse and said I would come down stairs they say oh no well can just take care of it in the morning mind you I had to be up at 4am to catch a flight.

title: Amazing staff
review: AMAZING!!!!!!! From the moment we entered, we were greeted with a pleasant smile. The hospitality is top notch.   THE ROOM It is comfortable, everything about it.   THE FREE SHUTTLE SERVICE I was blown away by that, it is free shuttle service within a one mile reach!!!!!! Pretty much everything is close by!   BREAKFAST   AMAZING   STAFF: SUPERB  INGA, MARCUS, DAVID, UFIMA(forgive me if it's spelt incorrect) from front desk THE CLEANING LADY ON FLOOR 6 AWESOME  SHUTTLE DRIVERS SPRINGER (THE MAN)  KENNY AND CHRIS  YOU GUYS ARE THE BEST :-)  UNTIL NEXT TIME IS from one Hilton to the next!

title: Under construction
review: We stayed here the night before our cruise. Part of the hotel is being renovated. No air conditioning in the halls and very noisy. Purchased a few things in their snack store. Outrageously expensive. However the staff was friendly and accommodating. Free shuttles to restaurants and to the port. Also free parking while we are away. Will probably be very nice once the construction is complete.

title: Trains!
review: This is a regular Hampton Inn with everything you always expect, except, they are going through a remodeling (Sept. 2016) and some area are under construction.  The issue for us was the hotel is very close to the train tracks.  There were trains going past the hotel most of the night and early in the morning.  If you are a light sleeper you will hear trains all night.

title: Not a great Hampton Inn
review: Just checked out of this Hampton Inn today. I spent 4 nights here while I was in town for a business trip. I typically love Hampton Inn's, but this one was not up to par. Let me start by saying the entire hotel is under construction. However, this only caused minor annoyances. The hotel does not appear to be in a great area. Driving in after getting off I95 seemed particularly shady. The parking garage was difficult to maneuver. There were bridges from the parking lot to the various floors (1-4), however, due to the construction, several of those bridges were closed. The Hampton Inn typically has a decent breakfast; however, at this location there was no variety. It was the same "instant-scrambled eggs" each day. Not to mention the lady setting up the breakfast at least two of…

title: Great Hotel
review: This hotel is great, stay here on all my visit to the Fort Lauderdale area, its close to the port and what a great shopping area, great restaurant-if you are driving its a breeze to get around to the shopping areas

title: Birthday celebration
review: Hotel under contruction. But very good service. All tbe staff specialy Fatima from the front desk. She was great during my stay and at the check out. I will stay next year to see the complety renovation.

title: Great Hospitality!
review: Awesome staff and beautiful upgraded room even though they're renovating. We definitely will come back! Dee and Aida did a great job with breakfast. They made my husband and I feel right at home. We had a great stay!

title: Excellent service!!!
review: We stayed at this hotel the night before we were going on a cruise with the entire family. The staff was very friendly and helpful towards our group of 18 people. They arranged all of the transportation from the airport as well as the cruise, and accommodated us very well. We felt like we were at home: the rooms were comfortable, the bathrooms were clean, and the breakfast was delicious. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone, and if I come back to Fort Lauderdale, I will be sure to stay here again.

title: Business in August
review: Awesome staff willing to help you. Hotel is good. Convenient to business dealings. Courteous van to Shops and shopping. Hotel is going through renovations but everyone is courteous and the rooms are great.

title: Super accommodating staff
review: When I arrived at this hotel after midnight the lobby was clearly under renovations (in fairness my assistant had warned me about this when she made the reservation). The desk clerk was incredibly personable and sincerely apologized for the condition of the hotel.   The room itself had already been renovated and it was clean, modern, and efficient. I particularly appreciated the ample power sources near the desk and dresser. It may be a pet peeve but it makes me a little crazy when I can't find sufficient power supplies in  a room for my computer, phone and tablet.  Upon checking out I had left my ipad in the room and hadn't realized it. House keeping found it and the hotel called my home. My wife then texted me asking if I could go back. I was heading back anyway to pick up my…

title: Nice update
review: Room was great ,you can smell everything new . Employees nice and smiley .The lobby and itself the hotel under renovation ,but still everything ready for guest. Thank you for the great update :-) Breakfast also had great selection from cold to hot type.

title: Plans Change
review: I drove from Atlanta to Fort Lauderdale on 8/22/16 and a 9 hour drive turned into 12.  I arrived at 1:45 am.  The front desk clerk was warm and welcoming, and very fast. she made check in a breeze and was supper peppy.  Love this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.  Event under construction, I was not disturbed, and the new upgrades are beautiful.

title: Downtown Hampton
review: For those who have been to downtown Fort Lauderdale you may know this as the yellow hotel.  Well, it is being renovated and will no longer be yellow.   For some this will be a good thing.  I tell you, if you are looking for a nicer hotel and offers a good value this is a solid option.   It's only 10 minutes or less of a drive to the beach and is close to Los Olas ave.   There are a ton of places to eat and shop nearby and this location has a private parking garage.   As of the date of my stay the hotel is currently undergoing active construction during the reno so get a room up high to avoid the noise!!!

title: Hampton Inn Downton Las Olas Area
review: Good value for money. Excellent location but nothing fancy. Fyi, There is construction going on so if you are in hotel from 9am - 6pm then it can get noisy. I was there for business trip And was out in conference from 9am - 6pm so it worked out perfectly for me.

title: Construction/Cold Water/No Whirlpool
review: Hotel under construction (to a degree it really should close); no hot water in shower or tub even after they came to fix it.  Whirlpool out of service with no notice and staff just shrugs their shoulders.  After using Hampton Inns for over 15 years, I'm done.  Oh and when I asked for a list of restaurants nearby, they gave me a map with one on it.

title: Just a So-So Visit
review: We arrived here for a one night stay before flying out of the Ft. Lauderdale airport. We arrived around 12:30pm, and I was prepared to sit in the lobby until a room became available for check-in. The entire lobby was under construction so they let us go ahead and check in.   While sitting in the room, someone knocked on my door around 2:30. I always lock the deadbolt but had neglected to do so this time. After knocking, they proceeded to enter the room as I was heading towards the door. It was obviously a hotel employee, who then exclaimed "Oh, they gave this room away". I said "sorry", then wondered why I was apologizing. She never apologized but said "oh well" and left the room. She seemed to be agitated that someone had been given that particular room.  It seems that they are…

title: No notice of construction work
review: The hotel was being renovated but there was not mention of this on the web site. Had to change rooms 3 times at check in to get a guest ready room Location was close to where I was working,  Parking lot was a tight for a large vehicle but had good security

title: Won't be staying here again
review: My company recently relocated our offices from W Palm Beach to downtown Ft Lauderdale (right on Las Olas).  I'll be visiting 5-6 times per year.  This is my second stay at the Hampton Inn and will be my last.  Never mind the massive construction project which has disrupted much of the hotel and is so noisy the front desk staff wear ear plugs (this should be over by mid-October I'm told).  I stayed in one of the renovated rooms, which was nice enough on the surface.  But once it got quiet, I heard the steady drip drip drip all night long from the bathtub.  At 630am the next morning I asked the front desk for someone to come look at it.  I got back to my room at 6pm and no one had come.  At 730pm, engineering finally came to look at it (I had a call for an hour and couldn't let…

title: Disgusting
review: Staff was excellent!! Pool disgusting! roaches!! Pillows rock hard! Room view was homeless people using street as washroom!!! Never again!! Disappointed in the Hilton Brand!! Will not recommend!! should not bother renovating will not help!!!
