title: One Night.
review: I stayed at the above hotel for one night on my way back from Key West to Orlando.   The hotel was getting a makeover when we were there, in fact we were the first guests in the room since it had been renovated.   The room, as you would expect was in excellent condition. It had everything needed; shower over bath, comfy beds, free WiFi etc.  Breakfast was included in our price and was very enjoyable.   Staff were friendly and helpful, car parking was around: $12 Per night. The hotel was very close to Las Olas Boulevard.   I would definitely stay here again if I was in this area.

title: Great overall
review: Great overall hotel. I will say there was a train very close by that ran regularily but not enough to really bother me. Had a newly renovated room that was perfect. Used the hotel shuttle to the airport and the driver was great and on time. I did have to ask for a blow dryer and after waiting for 1.5 hours I called again before it was then immediately brought up. Small issue but overall great and friendly staff!

title: experience
review: The room was very clean and the stay was very nice. The only problems I may have had was the parking, it was a small space to drive a full size truck into. But considering it was being worked on. So all in all I had a very nice stay, and it was close to the clubs down town if you wanted to go there.

title: Concert
review: I don't appreciate having to pay a parking fee when one of the parking levels wasn't even available which made finding a parking space challenging after being on road with three small children. Tell your customers upfront about parking fee

title: Convenient to Los Olas
review: This hotel is an average Hampton Inn. Close to Los Olas and the Riverwalk. If you wish to go further afield you will need transport. It was under renovation when we were there but the noise was during the day and we were out so were not inconvienced. Staff was friendly and unobstrusive. Laundry facilities were useable. The area around the hotel is a bit derelict but we were not overly bothered by panhandlers. Was a bit disappointed by Los Olas Blvd as a whole. So many empty spaces where business had shut down. Still it was a happening spot. Now that I have been there not sure I would return. Been there done that.

title: Summer vacation
review: We had a red eye out of ft Lauderdale airport after a stay in key west. We came in the afternoon before, walked around the stores and galleries of Las Olas, and were very impressed with the renovation in our room. Clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet!

title: Great location but loud during renovations
review: We stayed 2 nights through the weekend. The room was clean and comfortable. Location was our deciding factor as it was within walking distance to our event. It was a 10 minute drive to the beach. The Las Olas area is 5 minutes away. There is a CVS just down the road and a Publix a little further south, by the museum. Breakfast is available. Nothing special but the coffee is decent.  Loud during the morning due to the renovations but we weren't staying during the day so it was really wasn't much of an inconvenience. If you have to be at the hotel during 9 am to 5 pm, I would not recommend staying here. Aside from the noise from the renovations, the hotel was a great choice for us based on location.

title: Renovation from Hell
review: Stayed for Family Reunion with blocked rooms, but had everyone scattered on different floors.  Workers outside window. Jacuzzi dirty no water  in it.  Took three phone calls to get hot water in shower  Breakfast was the best part of the stay.

title: Wait until they make the rennovations
review: Whatever you think of when you envision a Hampton Inn, this isn't it.  They have a display in the lobby touting their upcoming rennovation (some of which is underway), but in the meantime it's a run down, shabby property.  That alone would not have merited a negative review, but they have a terrible problem with lack of cleanliness, including reusing sheets from one guest to the next without washing them.  (Don't ask how I know, but it was pretty disgusting.)

title: Wedding Stay
review: I enjoyed my stay. We stayed there a few nights before we set sail to get married. Everyone was helpful and the breakfast was delicious. They had renovating going on, but that was doing the day. The rooms were clean. They made the days before my wedding a pleasant one.

title: Great location
review: The location is awesome with so many restaurants and clubs around Los Olas. The parking garage lanes are small to maneuver especially if you are tired, or had one too many drinks🍷🍺🍸. The room was clean and had a fridge, microwave, safe. I will definitely be back, the only negative impact was the double beds, we wanted a king-size.

title: Great Hotel
review: Great hotel in an awesome location. There is a shuttle that will take you to Las Olas Blvd which is full of shops and delicious restaurants! The staff is pretty knowledgeable of the area and gave us great recommendations for things to do and other places to go. Housekeeping was awesome and kept our room clean and organized. Great outdoor pool as well!

title: Great Hotel for your vacation
review: The hotel is a peace of mind. The rooms are nice with fluffy pillows and clean linen. The pool and bar area is great. The breakfast was a money saver. It's not a continental breakfast, but a full healthy one. The staff is courteous, nice and friendly. They were always helpful. The hotel is in walking distance, but also a few blocks away to separate from the fun life.

title: Great Place to Park & Stay before a cruise!
review: Nice hotel, easy to find and great location to park & stay.  We used them before a cruise (check out their packages). Easy walk or take the free trolley to Old Town for a good meal & nice walk. Liked the secure covered parking garage .. only accessible with a room key.

title: Under renovation
review: Has a very convenient location.  Really close to las Olas Boulevard (within Walking distance)  They also provide a shuttle that can take you there if you don't want to walk.  If you are planning to stay late in Las Olas I will recommend you to take cab or drive (I did not look like a safe area to be walking late at night).  About the property, it is being renovated and they keep working even during the weekends.  Nice property, great buffet!

title: Bad stay for me
review: Decided to go to this location because of the distance from the airport. The front desk was very nice and helpful but my room was a nightmare. I checked into my room and there was construction noise right above my head. Then the sink was stopped up. Moved to a different room and more construction noise. I didn't know this prior to arriving.   However, the construction did stop around 5 or 6 so that was a plus. There is breakfast (which I didn't get a chance to eat), whirlpool, pool, and the location is very close to the shops, bars, etc. Won't stay again because I prefer a little more modern and upscale place.

title: Affordable Hotel Within Walking Distance of Las Olas
review: I stayed here with my wife to spend a couple of days on Las Olas Blvd.  The hotel is a nice hotel that is 5-6 blocks from the beginning of the Las Olas action.  It's not a bad walk but the hotel also has a courtesy vehicle that will drive you over there and pick you up.  Ususally no more than a 15/20 minute wait to take this vehicle.  You stay here because it is convenient and it is affordable. We were staying in an off month (June) so the rates were particularly low for Ft. Lauderdale.  The rooms are clean and well maintained.  The amenities are minimal as there are no restaurants, shops,etc. But the people working there were really great and were willing to assist us with just about everything we needed them form.

title: Hampton - In Town
review: I used Chase points to stay here, I am a HHonors member, hotel is getting upgraded which it needed, this is a good Hampton but not  a good location, I checked out and after 2 night and moved to the Hilton on 17th St. You cant get away from the $ 12 a day parking charge, all hotels get you

title: Tradition Ruin
review: To avoid any delays, i checked in online early when i received the email. Check-in was at 3:00 and i arrived at 3:45 to see that my room wasn't ready. No big deal we were planning on going into the Hot tub anyway. So we go change in the bathroom to change since the room wasn't ready. We get to the hot tub to find a sign that says SPA closed at the entrance to the hot tub. So we settled again to go into the pool... but QUICKLY gave up on that option when we saw a HEAVY white film of layered dirt/dust and what we hope was some kind of soap all over the pool. Sun bathed for a little while before we could finally check in. When we are checking in we inform them about the conditions of the pool and were told that the pool is closed. And there is a sign saying so with a not so…

title: Renovations
review: Clean room, but hotel was under renovations. We were awakened by all kinds of noise at 8 a.m. Also, I was charged to park in the garage, but the security gate wasn't working, meaning anyone could get in.  It was very hot in the hallways and the room smelled musty.

title: Hotel is luxurious and service is great
review: I loved this hotel. The location is very convenient and the staff were great. The shuttle drivers were extra accommodating and went out of their way to ferry me around. In addition I could walk to Las Olas and to the city bus for shopping.

title: Convenient but not great
review: The staff are lovely and the hotel is close to the airport which was convenient for us however this is not a hotel that I would choose to stay in again.  The area around the hotel leaves a lot to be desired and as a female i would not feel safe alone.  Whilst the hotel is clean, it could do with a lot of renovation (which I believe is going to be happening as per some signs that were around). The breakfast is very limited with not a lot of seating so if you go at a busy period you may not have anywhere to sit.  House-keeping basically means making the bed - used cups were not removed in fact they were just moved from one side of the room to the other which I found very strange.  Basically I would not stay again unless I really had to.

title: family gathering
review: We chose this hotel because it is close to downtown and the beach, but not in direct heavy traffic. From our check in to our check out was smooth and easy. Considering that there was non-stop renovation going on, the hotel was clean, efficient, and provided topnotch service.

title: Older but Convenient
review: This older HI is currently undergoing renovation.  Fortunately the construction has minimal impact on guests.  Although the property is older, it is in a good state of repair and all of the usual HI amenities are provided uninterrupted.  Rooms are fine: clean and comfortable.  Typical HI breakfast buffet, served on the second floor atrium.  Rooftop pool area is pleasant, although could use some shade.  Parking is a reasonable $12/night, but garage is cramped with some hair raising turns and close two way traffic encounters ($12 parking is a bargain in downtown FTL hotels). Location at the outer edges of Las Olas Blvd. is convenient.  Las Olas restaurants and shops are a 5 minute drive; Fort Lauderdale beach is 10-15 minutes away.  Really not much within walking distance.  There…

title: Construction
review: I wish the hotel would let their online guest know that there will be construction underway during their stay. I had a very bad night because I was unable to sleep during working hours. I was never told before o booked online.

title: Not worth your stay
review: I want to preface this review with compliments to the staff for being kind, attentive and helpful. However, this hotel is definitely not worth the price or your time for a stay. They are undergoing construction (even more of a reason to not stay there now) but may be worth reconsidering in the future.   We booked a room with two queen beds, nonsmoking, on Fourth of July evening  anticipating an early departure to the airport and were excited to come visit downtown Ft Lauderdale but sorely disappointed by the quality of this hotel.   Check in was smooth, though they had no snacks nor drinks left for our welcome kit and offered a bottle of water- not a huge deal but a lack of detail to note since this is part of the charm of staying with the Hampton Inn.  Parking was a bit…

title: Excellent recommendation for Hampton Inn
review: I often travel through the greater Miami area on business.  This hotel has a great proximity to Ft. Lauderdale airport. It is a very clean hotel, with a great price considering that it is the height of the summer travel season.  I highly recommend this hotel for either a short business trip and/or a family stay.

title: Great breakfast!!!
review: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and we really liked the hotel. The breakfast was the best I`ve ever had in the US! The staff was really helpful and polite, and the room was clean. But the neighborhood wasn`t that good. Many homeless people, and one of them was really scary and threatening. But I would stay at this hotel again, I just wouldn`t walk outside after dark, but rent a car instead.

title: Nice, quiet hotel with excellent staff!
review: Despite ongoing renovations, the hotel is already very nice. Loved the secured and gated parking, even for the additional fee, it was worth it. Rooms are large, clean and cool, breakfast is excellent and the staff extremely nice. The hotel is away from city traffic and beach noise, yet close enough to both city and beach to make it a good choice for a vacation stay.

title: Renovating
review: Hotel is undergoing much needed renovation. Not in a great area. There are better hotels nearby. Stayed at Riverside the next night. It was outstanding. Shower was in poor condition. Not sure I'd stay here after renovation but surly not during

title: CONSTRUCTION!!! CONSTRUCTION !! STAY AWAY !!
review: It is terrible to report that there is construction in this hotel COMPLETE renovations that just started as of the 20th and will go on for quite a while throughout the summer. I had a terrible week there the 20th through the 25th.  I ended up having to check out the 25th, three days early.  They should warn people ion the Hampton site that this is going on before booking.  Or at least offer some kind of discount.

title: Great stay
review: My husband and I enjoyed the stay at this hotel. We were welcomed by friendly staff, good location, and a clean facility.  Everyone was helpful and the hot breakfast was wonderful. We would definitely here again.

title: Dishonest and inept operation
review: I have stayed at Hilton chain hotels all over the USA for more than 20 years, many of them part of the Hampton Inn chain. This was thew worst stay and experience I have ever had. I booked and paid for two non-smoking rooms 6 months in advance. The staff at this hotel felt that they could pass off a room that was rank with smoke as a non-smoking room by simply shampooing the carpets. The staff were completely inept at trying to manage the problem. It was 1:30am before we had some sort of resolution to the problem. We had to SLEEP ON THE FLOOR of the hotel!!!!!! Fatima had no idea on how to resolve the matter or find alternatives. The housekeeping staff were abysmal, literally throwing linen and a portable bed in one room. Fatima and the housekeeping staff argued over what to do.…

title: Excellent value
review: Warm, welcoming staff, clean comfortable rooms. Security is also good as you need a room key to access the room floors on the elevator or to enter the hotel from the parking lot. It was great to have a portable table that I could use to work, or use it to eat while watching TV. The only challenge is the parking lot that requires a couple sharp turns on the ramp.

title: Great Hotel
review: This a great Hampton Inn, but not so good area. . Very clean, great staff and a nice pool. . And the beds are great to! Downtown Las Olas, is nice for shopping and dining as well. Oh and Hampton will provide a  shuttle which you'll definitely need unless you have your own vehicle.

title: Great customer service
review: From the time I walked into the building I was greeted withfirst class customer service. All I could say was wow!!!!!  Hats off to Kathy in sales, Fatima and Veronica at the front desk and Dee who severed breakfast everyday. Because of your customer service I will be back and I will tell my other friends about this hotel.  Fatima and Kathy, you guys rock.👍🏽👋 -Shirley

title: Awesome Location
review: Stayed for one night. Location is great as I found much to do in walking distance or a short Uber ride.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Also having a gated parking garage that is only for hotel guest

title: Friendly staff.  Dirty hotel
review: The staff was universally friendly and helpful. However, the hotel itself is in dire need of renovation. We were told by the clerk at the front desk that that was imminent. It is in a great location. We really hope this renovation happens or we will not stay there again.

title: Graduation Trip
review: This location was very convenient for my purpose. It was near all the convenient shopping areas and especially the beach. Only downside was the amount of room to park inside the parking garage, it was a little tighter fitting then most garages.

title: Saved by Fatima
review: We were doing a cruise out of Ft. Lauderdale on April 23. We decided to come a day early and booked an Xtra night. By error my wife had also booked a room at another Hampton Inn and was supposed to have cancelled it earlier. We had three rooms rented as my brother and sister were also staying at Los Olas. Well my wife cancelled the Los Olas and and we ended up at the other Hampton Inn. My wife is still recovering from cancer and was all sorts of upset. She was as upset as I have ever seen her. While at the other hotel my wife called Fatima at Los Olas and did manage to get a room for that night. We got there and was told she couldn't get us a room for the next night but she would do what she could. We met up with my brother and sister and went out for dinner. While at dinner…

title: Amazing staff
review: This is my second stay in this hotel and I am amazed with the courtesy of the staff - especially the front desk. Ms. Fatima has been f a n t a s t i c and made my stay memorable - she's always smiling (like she means it :)), she always goes that extra mile to help you out and make you feel how while away from home! Hotel is clean, managers are great, location is excellent - you have to come visit!

title: Very nice
review: Helped me find a parking area for my large van. Welcomed me and was very helpful getting my things to my room. Breakfast was good, on time, and hot. I had a good view looking out my window and room was nice and cool and clean when I got there.

title: Hampton inn las olas
review: The staff was amazing the location was good not far from the beach and loved how secured the hotel is you need your room key to get passed the second floor and also need your room key to access the parking lot. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again if I go back to that area

title: After Cruise
review: Very nice and clean establishment. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was decent enough. Pretty standard fare, waffles, cereal, pre packaged omelettes etc...Location was minutes from River Walk and Uber only charged $4.50 to get there. Will stay again

title: Simply Great
review: We had an amazing experience here! Marcus at the front desk was super nice and accommodating, he was more than willing to help us with any of our requests. All of the staff were super sweet from the room attendants to the shuttle drivers. The shuttle is great and complimentary to and from the airport which is fantastic. We were able to get all around Fort Lauderdale with either the shuttle or very cheap uber rides. I totally recommend this hotel! The rooms were clean and beds were great. Staff is awesome. If i stay in Fort Lauderdale again I will stay here for sure!

title: My Ft Lauderdale Hampton stay
review: We enjoyed our stay. Everything was fine, security measures, room, breakfast, and staff.  The only thing I didn't like was the pay for parking, the garage wasn't  the best to maneuver in and not a lot of spaces available. The location was easy to find and looks like the area may be in stages of development.

title: district manager
review: during my recent stay I was having a problem with my computer. I brought my computer to the front desk and assistant manager Kelly Matera spent over an hour with me and resolved the problem. Kelly very courteous and patient without her help I could not have gotten my computer up and running. I will return to this location during my next trip to Fort Lauderdale

title: Dirty room
review: Pros: convenient location, comfortable bed, fridge with tiny freezer area (unconfirmed whether it would preserve ice cream or make ice).  Cons: The room smelled like deodorizer. The furniture had a wood look but was a plasticy finish and had smears on it, as if someone had smeared an oily product such as Pledge on it. The bathroom had not been cleaned for some time. There were small clumps of hair in the sink. The floor looked like it belonged in a frat house. But the bathtub - OMG - disgusting. See photos.

title: One night stay
review: We were cruising as a family out of Miami with an overnight stay prior. We chose the Hampton Inn based on previous stays with the chain. Mostly because of the free airport shuttle. The stay was good. Room was nice and free breakfast was good. Only complaint is that we called and verified our flight and when to meet the shuttle. The morning associate was to leave word with the afternoon associate to give our number to the driver to call us at 1:30. When I did not receive a call I called the hotel back. I spoke to a man with reservations who said he was at the hotel. He told me over and over there was no shuttle provided. After arguing with me he told me we would have to take a taxi. A $23 ride later my party of 6 arrived. When checking in there was a sign on the desk that said…

title: Great hotel.
review: Great hotel. Good location. Very clean, staff friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.  Parking garage was a little tight going to second level but fine after that.  Like the convenience of parking on same floor as room.

title: Just what we needed
review: The hotel is located near down town Ft Lauderdale. The shuttle service was awesome. Customer service was awesome. The rooms were large, nice and clean. It was our honeymoon and it was just what we needed. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone traveling to the area.

title: Not the standard I am used to
review: I usually stay in Hampton Inn hotels but this one was a bit different. The building is old, although rooms looked as if they had been remodeled not long ago.  Furniture was ok and the bathroom was very nice. But still I didn't feel like I was staying in a Hampton inn. The place they have for breakfast is way too small, things run out and they take forever to bring new ones. During the weekend it was too crowed. The pool area is not the best, located in downtown I guess this is not a hotel for sunseekers, but the area didn't seem to be very clean, again we had to request towels because there weren't any. Lots of full ashtrays all over, not very nice either. Like I said rooms and bathroom ok the rest is under Hampton inn standards! Would try to find a different place next time…

title: They didn't leave the light on.
review: This motel offers a safe place to sleep and a forgettable dining experience they call breakfast. It is in walking distance to the International Crew Training facility but if one is driving, there must be better options.

title: Comfortable stay
review: We stayed here for about a week. Room was comfortable and clean and relatively quiet. Room would be really cold during the day and then get hot at night. As always love the neutrogena bath products!!  Our microwave stopped working halfway through the stay (didn't really need it, so we didn't bring it up with anyone) and the tv worked great except the only channel that didn't go through was animal planet so don't plan on watching any river monster marathons. Breakfast staff is very kind and always willing to go the extra mile. Some of the fruit quality could have been a bit better though (brown bananas.) Worst part? Parking is $12 extra per day and the parking garage is extremely narrow and a total pain to drive through. Trucks and vans- good luck, ya ain't getting through.

title: Where reservation is not necessarily a reservation
review: Reserved a room with double beds.  My confirmation said double beds.  When I attempted to check in (of course after running my credit card) I was told they no longer have double beds and offered a double bed.  This was acceptable.  Agent simply claimed nothing she could do and attempted to tell me *Diamond & Platinum member with other chains* that bed types were not guaranteed.  The staff is grossly incompetent but even worse, they refuse to correct their wrong and then blame the customer.  Lame!

title: New management is terrible
review: I've been staying here for quite awhile on trips for work. Since the new management/ownership took over, the service has been awful. 5 out of the last 6 times I've been here the cable/tv hasn't worked which has resulted in me moving rooms late in the evening after I've unpacked. The front desk staff are short and not helpful. We used to get a coupon for a free drink at the bar, they got rid of that. They used to offer cookies and water upon arrival, they quit offering that. There were 3 bugs in my bathroom today and I got in a few hours ago. I will not be staying here again.

title: Great stay in Fort Lauderdale
review: Had a wonderful weekend in Fort Lauderdale thanks to the kindness and expertise of the staff at this hotel!  The location was outstanding and the service was wonderful.  They even have a van that will transport you to the restaurants and cultural sites in the area.

title: Couldn't Ask For More
review: We spent a day exploring Ft. Lauderdale before leaving on our cruise.  This hotel offered everything we needed: courteous and helpful staff, clean comfortable room, free great hot breakfast, shuttle available to Port Everglades, close proximity to some attractions such as the Art museum.  Also, the front desk attendant suggested a shuttle service to see the Everglades.  She took the deposit and called for us. She also made other suggestions including the Air and Water Show down on the beach.  (Wish I could recall her name.)  After the Everglades, we returned to the hotel and walked down Los Olas Boulevard to the beach.  Was a couple of miles, but was very enjoyable.  We can recommend this hotel.

title: Clean and Comfortable
review: Stayed here a couple of days prior to cruise.  We loved it!  It was clean & comfortable with helpful, responsive staff.  Close to walk to a trolley stop and only $1.00 per person to ride the trolley to the beach.  Had a great time!

title: Affordable, Quiet and Value
review: The property was clean. Marcus at the front desk was great during check in. Fast. Check out was seamless as well.   It was a nice, central location and conveniently located as well. Overall we enjoyed our stay and have no complaints.

title: Great Stay
review: I have stayed here three times now and never had any problem.  The hotel is always clean, comfortable and the staff is welcoming.  A great value when you want to be downtown or near Wilton Manors.  The hotel is starting to show its age and would benefit from a little facelift but it is always clean and in good condition.

title: Needs some remodeling
review: The garage was cracked and way to narrow. I'm glad I took my Honda because it's small. If I would have taken my truck it would have been real hard to maneuver around in there. and the cleaning lady failed to Clean my room and get towels for me and my girlfriend. Breakfast was ok nothing special but could use some more varieties.

title: Business and pleasure by the sea
review: I had a great stay at this gem of a property within walking distance of the ocean.  We attended a conference close by at the convention center, then jit the Jacuzzi for a bit.  The next morning we enjoyed an awesome breakfast and went to the beach for a bit.  I loved that there were so many things within walking distance and it was a very cool neighborhood.  The best part was Marcus at the Front Desk.  He and Kelly took care of an odd billing situation I was in.  I also left a part of my power suit in the closet, and Marcus wrapped them up and sent them to me right away.  I was all set for my big presentation!  Thanks for a great stay.  I will most definitely stay again when in Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Business Trip
review: Very Nice, Very Safe, Not Thrilled with Having to Pay for Parking, but all the rest was GOOD!!!   I will stay here again!!! The breakfast bar was well stocked, the bed was super comfy with great pillows...close to downtown for walk to restaurants.

title: Fine for one night due to emergency
review: The location is a bit dodgy.  Lots of construction and crazy traffic,  Parking is free but If you are above 4th floor, it's a hassle hauling luggage from car to hotel to elevator to another floor.  Have to use key card for every time you need elevator.  They need more luggage carts that are easier to maneuver.     Marcus at the front desk was EXCELLENTLY.

title: Good precruise hotel.
review: Stayed one night before our cruise. Our flight arrived early so was afraid the we would have to wait for a room but when we got to the hotel the room was ready. Good start. The room was clean and had everythig we needed. Picked this hotel because it was downtown near the riverwalk. Walked along the river and Las Olas Blvd. Many restaurants along Las Olas. The room was very quiet and no noise issues within the hotel. The hotel bar was disapointing. Had 3 beers on draft that I would not drink. The so called tapas  were not tapas but eggsalad sandwich or a salad. The breakfast was good. Nice choices. Used the bus that the hotel sponsored for cruise passengers. It was $10 each and took about 10 minutes to get to Port Everglades. Cheaper than a cab. Overall had a good stay.

title: Great service!
review: My bf and I stayed here on our first trip to Florida. It definitely exceeded our expectations in soo many ways. The hotel is perfectly situated in an area that is easily accessible to all parts of the city and state.  The staff, including all managers go out of their way to ensure your satisfaction, and the free breakfast and wifi is great! We will definitely be returning here again!

title: Wonderful stay
review: Clean, convenient, friendly service. Comfortable beds, pillows and bedding. Enjoyed our stay. Nice pool area and hospitality room. Close to downtown yet convenient to beach. They have a van/bus and take you around area.

title: Slept Well
review: Clean, well planned , great people. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good and well stocked with good service. Parking was very accessible for downtown and ease of convenience was great. Garage facility very secure.

title: Would not stay again as a single
review: I love the Hilton brand but I wasn't to impressed with this Hampton. Walls were very thin. I heard lots of talk down the hallways all night long. I came in late evening and I was uncomfortable parking and walking to the bridge to the hotel. The security gate to the parking garage was open when I arrived and I had to park on the roof were there were people hanging out. I don't know if they were guest or not. My room was clean and I had a terrific view of Fort Lauderdale.

title: wonderful hotel
review: great amenities, close to everything  We had a first floor room with balcony, pool view. there was no noise heard form the pool area . very comfortable room. there was a cruise ship parked there, it did not interfere with services or quality of service.  Staff were wonderful.

title: Excellent property
review: This is an excellent property.  The lobby is clean and inviting.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  The room is spacious and clean.  The bathroom is well lit and has all the amenities I need.  The WiFi is fast.  Breakfast is good and includes many hot and cold items.  The location is convenient to many downtown Fort Lauderdale locations.  I would stay here again.

title: Front desk exceptional help
review: Front desk Was very helpful setting up an excursion and helping us with our first experience with UBER. Marcus set us up on the App and walked us through how it works.  That was extremely helpful. Our room was very clean and quiet and breakfast was very good with lots of variety.

title: Terry
review: Excellent service. Clean rooms. Breakfast items were OK for complimentary breakfast. Walking distance to Broward Performance Arts Center & Riverwalk area. Absolutely would stay again at this hotel. Parking was conv

title: Pre Cruise Stay
review: Good price but the place is a little tired. Walking distance to Las Olas Blvd. Concerns as it appears that people off the street were taking advantage of the complimentary breakfast. This was brought to the attention of the hotel. Pool was ok but extremely cold. The gentleman at the front desk not that friendly at first. The hotel tried to charge us for the cruise port shuttle that was free with our booking, we had to show proof of this that the hotel should have had.  Rooms were clean and spacious but would consider other hotels before returning here

title: Hated this hotel!
review: This was probably the worst hotel visit I've ever had - thank goodness it was just for one night staying the night before our cruise. The room seemed dirty, the location was sketchy at best - I would have been afraid to go out at night. The breakfast was just ok and the beds were not comfortable. The hotel staff was very stand-offish - not friendly at all. There isn't an inside pool, just the outside pool so if it's raining you're out of luck. Would not go back again.

title: Exceeded All Expectation!
review: What a incredible place! The best hotel with easy access to Downton and Airport. It has Garage access directly to the Rooms. The security level is perfect! The bar is very cozy, I loved facility to wash my clothes, the laundry room is very nice. The vending is the best I've ever seem, variety of things to buy. Comfortable Rooms nicely done. The staff here is extremely friendly and helpful, especially the front desk called David Gronowicz,He's extremely professional, very polite and the best front desk  that I have found in all the hotels that I stayed, He is the best! I congratulated the Manager called Peaches Crawford for the work she has done with her Team in this Hotel making us fell like we are in our home. I recommend this Hotel, because it is like "heaven on earth"

title: Average Hotel but in A Good Location
review: This is an average hotel.  I was surprised that we had to pay to park since the location wasn't in a busy area.The hotel is located near Las Olas and not far from the beaches and cruise port.  The bar area didn't feature any food.  The outdoor pool was clean.  The highlight was their breakfast.  There were a lot of people staying there when we visited but the breakfast buffet was kept well stocked.  The rooms were clean.

title: Great Location
review: This hotel is a great location if you are attending a concert at the Parker Playhouse. It is very clean, but a little dated. It did require driving to get to a restaurant.  Breakfast was fairly good. Staff was very friendly.  It should be noted that the on site parking garage has very narrow ramps.  It could be hard to get in and out in a larger car.

title: A place before cruising
review: The room was clean, comfortable and updated - a great surprise because the outside was not as updated. There was a free hot breakfast that was acceptable. A shuttle to Port Everglades is offered for $10 per person. The hotel was somewhat isolated from restaurants. The Riverwalk is about a half-mile away, but it was deserted on a Friday night. In the other direction about a half-mile, there are some fast food restaurants and a popular drugstore.

title: Don't stay here
review: I have stayed at many Hampton Inns all over and this is the first I was dissatisfied with! We checked us and I have a room booked for three adults. I get to the room and it is one King size bed. Wasn't offed any remedy cause they overbooked

title: Terrible
review: The front desk service was rude and did not make me feel welcome as a guest.  After finally getting a room key, I walked into a damp and musky hotel room that wreaked of cigarette smoke. You must use your room key to park and to use an elevator.

title: Late complementary breakfast.
review: One staff member claimed a "bagged" breakfast was ready at 5 a.m., 1 hour before normal breakfast. A second said, No. Only 1/2 hour before normal 6 a.m. time. We had to leave by 5 a.m.. So we left hungry.  No help.  Also disappointed that we ere not told of parking charge before agreeing to stay at hotel.

title: Exceptionally Clean, Friendly & Convenient.
review: My wife Miss Mary & I stopped in for a night prior to taking a cruise & very much pleased as to how we were treated.  The front desk Miss Kelly Matera was extremely accommodating in our check in, the room on 9th floor was great & hotel very quiet.  The location is close to restaurants & shopping & within 10 minutes to the Port for connecting with the ships.  We have already planned our next cruise & will be staying here again.  The front desk was extremely helpful in assisting us in finding a restaurant close by & giving great directions.

title: Smelly
review: Front desk was great but that's about it. Place smelled like cleaners, fabuloso or something like that Lights were missing in hallways carpet looks run down. Bar was supposed to close at a certain time but closed much earlier. My home gym is better equipped that this one

title: Exceptional Customer Service
review: I had forgot some very important jewelry in my room and didn't realize I forgot it till I arrived back home in Las Vegas! In a frenzy, I called the front desk and a man named Marcus attended to the issue. He was very pleasant and reassuring telling me that the maids are still in the process of cleaning the rooms and they turn in any items left behind to lost and found.  He said he would call back if anything was turned in once they finished the rooms.  He followed up because his shift was almost over and said they are not yet finished and he is headed home but Veronica would assist me further.  A few minutes later I got a call from Veronica saying my belongings were found.  She assisted in shipping the items right away.  I just want to thank the entire staff at The Hampton in…

title: Great central location! Nice staffs
review: The hotel has great location and nice staffs at check in. However, I experienced the shower head leak (or shower handle) that dripped very loudly to the tub all night long no matter how tight or many times I try to stop it. By the time I realized this I was too tired to pack to move to another room. I had a very early meeting in the morning.

title: Great stay
review: Very nice hotel and walking distance to a few shops and restaurants. Felt safe walking. About a 7min ride to an upscale mall. We used Uber to get to the mall and that was great and cheap as well. Overall very happy with this hotel. Will be staying here each time we visit.

title: Dead battery and all
review: MY wife and I have stayed at this Hampton Inn several times over the last 8 years when in the area for a cruise.  The covered parking with good security is a plus.  The rooms are always excellent and the staff are dedicated to making your stay pleasant and restful.  When we returned to the hotel after our cruise we were faced with a dead battery in our car.  Luckily the maintenance staff were already assisting another guest with the same problem.  The maintenance staff were able to get may car started and we were on our way.  They refused any $ for the help, and said they were glad to do it. Little things can sometimes destroy a great vacation.  This time a little car problem did not get in our way because the staff were kind and caring enough to help.

title: Pre cruise stay
review: We stayed at this location the night before our cruise and we were very pleased. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff were extremely helpful and went out of there way. The check in process was a breeze and everyone enjoyed the breakfast. Granted it was not a very big area and it did seem a bit crowded but you need to take into account that there are a good number of people heading out on cruises. The shuttle to the port was very organized and well run. It was a great experience overall. Upon our return to pick up our car we had a dead battery and without a second thought the management came to our rescue and got our car started!!!!!! Very impressed with the staff and this hotel. We would stay again.

title: Victorious
review: I told a few friends in the area that I was staying at this hotel and they seemed horrified and suggested I'd want to leave in a hurry. Look, it's not on a beach or in an amusement park, but the rooms were clean, the beds were great, it was secure and comfortable. They had free breakfast and everything worked and nobody was rude.   If anyone says something to you about the hotel that would make you question whether it's worth staying there, ask them when they stayed there and what their specific objections were.   If I'd listened to these opinions before I checked in, I might have elected to stay elsewhere and it would probably have been a mistake.

title: Nowhere near the quality standards we expect from Hampton Inns!
review: List of issues: 1. Cold showers, often low to no pressure.  2. Complimentary breakfast - area too small and overcrowded. Not enough stations - 1 toaster, 1 waffle maker, non functional juice bar and most times very little food.  Eventually we bought cereal and milk and ate in our room.  3. Our key had to be programed several times during our stay.  4. Found another woman in our room one afternoon, they had booked her in the same room we were in and by the time she realized the room was occupied, she had already started to unpack her suitcase.  To make things worse, our key would no longer open our room - had to reprogram again.  5. The so called complimentary internet WiFi kept disconnecting, often times we had to log on again several times in a single day.  6. Overcharged us…

title: Great Getaway Location
review: We've stayed at this Hampton 3 times as a pre cruise or shopping trip hotel. Always friendly, clean and reasonable. We ship packages in from Amazon and the staff holds them until we arrive. I highly recommend this Hampton. Great location for Las Olas shopping and dining.

title: Location OK, hotel is tired and dirty
review: Lots of online reviews say this hotel is a good location.  While it is only a short walk to the interesting part of Ft. Lauderdale, specifically Los Olas, we were quite uncomfortable walking the 4 blocks to that destination.  There is a large homeless population in the area and there are also some rough looking characters in the area, too.  After walking to the Los Olas area, we actually took an Uber back to the hotel, even though it was only 5 blocks away.....a bit too scary for us.  Hotel is dated, looks like a 1970's motel.  A/C in room is a window unit.  Doesn't function well, kept going off...then clicking, grinding...start/stop.....click....click...ratttle....then on for 5 minutes...then repeat the cycle.  Just an old hotel that has little to no investments since 1978…

title: Average dated
review: This hotel was average and a bit dated looking.  They advertise free cocktail hour and snacks and that is not true.  The breakfast however was excellent and the staff was friendly.  The elevators also advertised free cocktails and snacks which should be removed

title: Ok
review: Ok for the money. This hotel looks old and in need of a renovation. The location isn't the best but not terrible, this neighborhood looks run down and there are some homeless people hanging out nearby. The breakfast buffet was pretty good standard for the Hampton

title: Leisurely Weekend
review: Recently stayed at this property while in Ft. Lauderdale for a family wedding.  The hotel is conveniently located not far from the famous Las Olas shopping area.  The Saturday of our stay, there was a huge art festival on the street.  What fun!  The hotel staff could not have been more pleasant, and helpful; however, there were a few glitches which is why my rating is very good and not excellent.    First, breakfast foods and beverages were not replenished as quickly as they should have been on two busy weekend mornings when people were rushing to eat and get on with their days!  Secondly, the bathtub sides slope into the bathtub and were very slippery.  Two of us in our party (in two separate rooms) slipped - one going all the way down and injuring his knee,  and me just losing…

title: Pre-Cruise Reunion Stay
review: Good location, you can walk to nearby restuarants, bars, clubs. Our group enjoyed the location. The breakfast was decent, you are able to make yourself a fresh hot waffle. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Best Value for the area by far
review: I travel a lot and try to stay at Hampton Inn. This one was a little older than most Hamptons but very nice and for the area it is the best you will find for the price. I would highly recommend it. You will have to drive 30min-1 hr to find the same price and quality. If you get a good deal grab it.

title: Great Stay
review: This hotel gave us very early check in as a courtesy when our flight landed early so that we could sleep.  Fatima was so helpful with our daily plans-cabs, activities, etc and always knew how to help us. The night staff was most helpful.  The beds were comfortable and the daily free breakfast was excellent.  Best part is being near the bus central terminal, only a 3 block walk to the terminal and Las Olas Blvd

title: Fort Lauderdale, FL
review: The location of this hotel to the airport was advantageous. The property itself was only fair. It struck me as being a property that Hampton Inn bought without making much (or any) improvement on the site.

title: Business Trip
review: Overall a good experience.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  I've been coming here for over a year now on a quarterly basis and most staff seem to know me now and welcome me back.  Location is downtown and I don't recommend being on the streets after dark but I've never felt concerned while in the hotel.

title: Quick stop over
review: Arrived late 2:30 am. After a long drive. Front desk friendly and efficient. Room was standard Hampton Inn. Clean and comfortable.  We prefer Hampton Inn because of the cleanliness and bedding. We basically slept there and continued with our trip. Would stay again

title: Disappointing Hampton Inn
review: The problems started on my arrival when they said my reservation was cancelled. The front desk clerk didn't even offer to rebook the room.  I had to log back into my travel app and rebook the room.  This hotel is run down and the staff is rude.  When I asked if it was safe to walk to restaurants, the desk clerk said it was completely safe.  She even drew a little map, which I followed. She failed to mention bus station just up the street. Not the best area to say the least. Homeless were sleep on the sidewalks on the route to restaurants. The walk back from dinner was scary, at best.  The last straw was getting the bill at check out with a charge of $12.00 to park.  This  was not mentioned at any point, it just showed up on the bill.  I have never paid to park at a Hampton Inn…

title: Poor customer service, somewhat run down hotel.
review: We were going on a cruise out of Fort Lauderdale and chose this hotel because they offered a ship to shore package which was said to include parking at the hotel for the duration of your cruise, transportation to port, complimentary drink at the night of our stay, and a tote with coupons and other goodies. Before booking we called to confirm how the transportation worked because we only needed transportation from the port back to the hotel after cruise. The representative for the hotel assured us that there is a shuttle that will take us to the port and pick us up afterwards. Again we very adamantly emphasized "it will definately pick us up from port and take us back to hotel, right?" she said "yes, you will wait and look for the bus that says Hampton Inn". So after getting this…

title: Never again
review: Breakfast always out of food. Spent too much money for few amenities. Made reservations at one rate but was charged higher rate. Had to go to corporate to fix. Assistant manager Kelly needs classes in customer service.

title: Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale
review: Rooms are very clean, beds are super comfortable. Staff is always very helpful. A/C units in rooms are very old and many need repair. I've had to change rooms three times on two separate occasions because the a/c was broken. Hallways are quite hot, seems they keep the thermostat at around 80 degrees to save $. Breakfast is ok but if you're trying to eat healthy, scrambled eggs with cheese and cheese omelettes are not going to do it for you. Also, make sure you park inside the garage, don't leave your car in the lot across the street even for an hour. My rental was broken into in broad daylight on a Sunday.

title: Good Hotel
review: This was a great hotel. The stay was very comfortable. The rooms were nice and clean. The hotel serves a nice variety of hot breakfast. I was particularly surprised that they offered turkey breakfast meats which was an A+ on my list since I don't eat pork. We switch our hotel to stay here because we were in a hotel that was very nasty. They gave us a AAA discount since they didn't take Allstate Motorclub. Which was very much appreciated.

title: Location was disappointing
review: I stayed at this hotel because of the reviews, and although the service was fine and the room was clean and comfortable, the location was neither attractive nor is it particularly close to Las Olas.  It is not in a "walking area" so we took our car to go to dinner.  The TV in the room is very small.  Other than that, our room was comfortable.  I frankly would not stay here again because of location.  There are many other places available in much better location for the same or even lower price.

title: Macus' sunny attitude and professionalism
review: My stay at the Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale/Las Olas was for work but my mother came along for pleasure.  We arrived early (10:45) and knowing that rooms are not typically available until 3pm were surprised and amazed by Marcus at the front desk who made sure to get our room ready as soon as possible.  His sunny attitude and professionalism were a delight throughout our stay.  He helped my mother to locate a place to eat lunch at within walking distance, made sure she was comfortable in the lobby while waiting for the room to be ready, and found her as soon as a room was ready.  When I got back to the hotel later that day he immediately made sure I had a card to get to the room and answered all my questions about checking out.

title: Location Good, But Overpriced for Amenities
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for your wonderful review of the Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale Downtown - Las Olas Area.  Marcus is definitely an asset to our team and strives to ensure every guest he encounters is enjoying their stay with us.  We greatly appreciate you taking the time out of your day to write a review for us and to point out our staff's attentive, friendly attitudes.    We appreciate you staying with us and hope to have you back soon!  -Hampton Inn Management

title: Convenient
review: We stayed one night here in March because the hotel is close to Parker Playhouse where we had concert tickets.  Total cost, with parking, was almost $300.  It's comfortable, but hey, it is still a Hampton Inn!  Average size rooms - ours had a scenic view of a homeless encampment.  Next time, we'll just drive a bit for a better value.

title: A Comfortable & Enjoyable Downtown Visit
review: I arrived at the hotel  to an upbeat,friendly front desk staff. The check in process was quick & easy. My room was spacious and was stocked with everything I needed. The pool & bar area were inviting. There's a great Cuban Café down the street called  "Nuevos Cubanos".   After check-out, I had a billing issue that was quickly resolved by the Kelly Matera- Asst. General Manager. Overall, I enjoyed my time here and, can't wait to return for a longer visit.

title: Bug Infestation in Room
review: I cannot believe that TripAdvisor gave this hotel property an award for excellence. Upon checking into this hotel at the end of November, we always check in, get our room key and go check it out before we bring our luggage up.  In following our travel richual, I unlocked the door and hit the light switch to turn on the light.  Much to our horror, there were hundreds of little bugs running all over the wall and the light switch.  In disbelief, I hit the light switch on the other side of the wall, which was the bathroom, and there were hundreds more running all over the walls, floor and bathroom vanity.  Of course, we ran out of the room and down to the front desk to the young man who checked us in.  As we were explaining the situation, my husband was picking off the bugs that had…

title: great business experience
review: enjoy stay while on business good location near great restaurants and downtown locations five minutes from beach ten minutes from airport will use again when in fort Lauderdale florida rates were good

title: Convenient Hotel with Shuttle to Cruise Port
review: Booked this Hampton Inn Downtown Las Olas in Ft. Lauderdale, FL back in July 2015 for January 2016 on the Hilton website. At that time, they had a "Ship & Shore" package that included a welcome gift bag, a complimentary drink for 2 adults, free breakfast buffet, a free shuttle to the pier and free parking for the duration of our 21 day cruise.   Lovely hotel, quiet room, secure key-card access ramp garage parking & great breakfast. Breakfast is from 6 - 10 AM. Bar is open from 5 -11 PM.   We were checked in by Cinthya and given our gift bag, complimentary 2 drink certificates and signed up for our shuttle to the cruise pier.  I would highly recommend this Hampton! Total bill with tax was $254.19. Which was a bargain for leaving our car in a safe & secure parking garage for 21…

title: Hotel Old Needs Help
review: Stayed at the Hampton Inn for a business conference in March 2106.  Hotel needs help.  Arrived late, issues with clogged sink (yes, the water is visibly brown)...maintenance was in my room for an hour trying to fix, pouring chemicals down the drain until I felt sick and had to ask to  open the door for ventilation....finally insisted i get moved, called down to front desk she agreed, but hung up the phone before I knew the plan without even saying goodbye.    The conference room was okay...food was brought in.  If there is another choice I would not stay again at this Hampton...needs a major face lift and some training on customer service.

title: Pre and post cruise stay
review: I agree with previous review.. The hotel is not located in the Los olas area for those that have any mobility issues. A good 6-7 block walk . The actual hotel is okay . Clean but a bit aged. The breakfast buffet was passable but far too much disposable dishes and cutlery. Front staff was helpful when required. This hotel is far better suited as a business hotel and for those that want peace and quite . There is not much happening within the hotel nor within close walking distance. On a positive note they did give us an early checkin when we arrived there at 09:30am.  For next stay in Fort Lauderdale will look for another hotel.

title: Beautiful, comfortable hotel in business district
review: We stayed here after leaving the Miami cruiseport. The hotel is in an administrative area, near the courts, so there's not a lot in walking distance. There is a McDonald's two blocks away, and the hotel has a small shop for snacks, soda, etc.  I wish Hampton would start selling milk in these shops!  The décor seems newly updated, very old-fashioned elegant.  There's a great breakfast buffet in the morning, and coffee and fruit available during the day.  No airport shuttle, but taxi only cost $20 to the airport, and front desk will arrange for pick up. Very pleasant staff, both behind the front desk and at the buffet. Bedroom was very comfortable and quiet.  Building is H-shaped, so no bedroom is too far from the elevator. Two/three block walk puts you on Las Olas Blvd, near…

title: convenient and pleasant
review: Good value . After the luxury of a cruise this seemed a little down at heel but very adequate.  Not much available within walking distance as it is situated in the administrative centre of the city but very close to the BCT bus terminal  which gets you every where cheaply. The Sun Trolley is free.   My only complaint is the interminable playing of Forensic Files on the lobbey television. Dead bodies breakfast noon and night!

title: Xmas at Hampton inn fortlauderdale
review: Stayed here for 14 nights, only fault was the train in middle of the night.we have booked to go back again this year the breakfast was brill and the staff was great just didn't like walking out at night, may I say how good the people on front desk was

title: Hampton Inn  Ft. Launderdale, FL
review: This is an excellent hotel with good security.  It is located in a convenient location and near good restaurants. You have access to a healthy breakfast seven days a week.  Desk personnel were helpful and you were given a USA Today Monday thru Friday.

title: Overpriced but clean
review: On arrival to the hotel the desk staff was excellent, especially the young man that was working, can't remember his name, but he was super friendly! The hotel has a nice neat appearance. Our room, a double, was also very clean. No complaints at all with the actual hotel, just with the location. It is several blocks away from the popular areas, and to get to those areas you had to walk, or take a cab, by a lot of homeless people, which I knew about because of reviews I had read on trip advisor. They didn't bother us, but we were always in a group. One evening my husband, myself and two children, ages 12 & 14 walked to a local pizza place. As we were waiting for our order we noticed that there were at minimum 50-100 homeless people lying on the sidewalk across the street. We were…

title: Oldie but a goodie
review: Staff was good,  breakfast was typical,  but the morning staff was exceptional. There is a bar with a mini kitchen in this hotel;  not something I'm used to seeing so that was a plus. Hotel needs updating, but it is clean. For your money and the area, it's fine.

title: My Favorite Destination in Ft. Lauderdale
review: This is a great place to stay. I recommend getting a deluxe room, you get extra space and a pool view every time. David & Kelly do a great job making sure all of the staff is performing up to par! Breakfast is included and there's a full liquor bar with some quick bites if you don't feel like leaving the hotel. This hotel has great value for the price.

title: Overpriced for what it is
review: This hotel should not be listed as close to Las Olas Ave.  It is about a 6 - 7 block walk to the nearest intersection, and that is the end where the art museum is and not where the shopping and restaurants are. If someone has business with the city, city hall is next door.  But I felt it was deceiving by the hotel to list themselves as close access when in fact many people would take a cab to get to the desired part of Las Olas.  Hotel no longer offers complimentary beverages in the evening either.  When I ask, I was offered a soda out of the cooler in the lobby, which was okay, but not what I was expecting.  Hotel was clean and tidy, but about $50 overpriced per night for what it is.  I paid $190, which seems to me they are taking advantage of people with that rate.  I also…

title: Excellent Choice for Hotel Stay
review: Selected Hampton for convenience to the cruise port.  The rate was very good, full breakfast included and convenient to a number of eating establishments.  The rooms were big and clean.  Highly recommend

title: Good option for a stop-by
review: The hotel offers the expected quality of a Hilton brand chain. Large and clean rooms. Breakfast is included and good. Location is the main advantage. It is located just behind the townhall. There is a good parking too (paid). There are hotels better located if you want to extend the stay or stay at the beach. I recommend this one for a quick stop-by.

title: Not up to usual Hampton standard
review: Bed and pillows horrible.  Rooms could use up grade.  Sink slow drain and I reported it and when we came back 4 hrs later.  Not fixed.  Lobby and breakfast great.  Appeared they keep clean.   Will not book this location again.   Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxccxxxxcxccccccccccccccc

title: Incredible Customer Service by Fatima Hopkins
review: I have stayed here a few times but i have never been able to find the time to write a review till now. The service here should be seen by Hilton Corporate. Fatima Hopkins was so incredibly helpful and nice and went above and beyond for me with everything i needed.   At check in and the smile from this representative makes you want to smile and turned my bad day, good. The other front desk representatives Veronica and Marcus should be seen as well, what amazing service and professionalism. These 3 front desk representatives were amazing every time i  have came there.   The breakfast was good and the two young ladies who in the bar time in the afternoon deal with a lot with many other guests who were extremely rude to them for no reason yet it did not bother these girls one bit.…

title: bums location out front but noce rooms clean inside
review: Thought this was las olas. There was bums right outside the window while they starved we had free breakfast and felt like crap. So we went out and fed the homeless. Management handled it well and upgraded our room. It was a nice room basic nothing to special but clean and comfortable bed.

title: My stay in Ft Lauderdale
review: The Manager was excellent.  She helped me way above and beyond what I expected.  She got me the room I wanted at a very reasonable price.  The breakfast were great too. The Staff was attentive to my needs and excellent too,  Parking was a breeze.

title: Bad service Dirty Bathroom
review: The checking process started with the front desk person on the phone the entire time. Bathroom had a pubic hair on the toilet seat. Parking was full and difficult. Would not stay here again.  I have never wrote a negative review, but this place was motel 6 quality.  I was a Hilton Honors member until I stayed here.

title: Very nice
review: Stayed here for A1A half marathon and was very pleased.  Great location, secure parking behind gate, clean updated rooms and they have a restaurant and bar on site.   We reserved for 2 nights but just stayed one and they made change with no issue.  Wanted a few more pillows and they brought them up very quickly.  Great pool area and hot tub for after race.    Stay at Hampton very often and they rarely disappoint!!!

title: Nice Pre Cruise Stay
review: We stayed here several nights before going on our cruise. The hotel itself is nothing luxurious, and like most establishments at this time of year, was overpriced. Nevertheless we found the service friendly, the room clean, bed comfortable, and the location perfect. Certainly everything met our needs. We managed to book a shuttle to the cruise port for $10.00 per person, then later booked the same shuttle to pick us up from the port to drive us to the airport. Breakfast was ordinary and typical of Hampton. We enjoyed our day by walking to Las Olas which is about 15 min walk, then hopping on the Sun Trolley for $1.00 to go to the beach area. Later in the day, we took the trolley back to Las Olas then ate dinner at one of the restaurants there. We returned to our hotel by walking.…

title: Very disappointed!!
review: I stayed here for one night on business.  Hotel is not in a nice area.  I would not walk around here at night.  Las Olas Blvd. is blocks away.  Room was nice, but internet would not work.  Even went to the front desk for help.  Nothing.  Finally logged on while at breakfast, over 12 hours after I arrived.  In the elevator, an advertisement, invited me to the second floor for drinks and tapas from 5pm - 11pm.  All I wanted was a drink and food and did not want to leave the hotel.  Bar was open.  The kitchen closed.  It was 8:30 pm.  Had to drive to Las Olas Blvd, park and pay for an expensive meal.  Finally parking was awful.  Garage was small and narrow.  Almost could not get my car down the ramp, it was so narrow.  I could see plenty of evidence of vehicle striking the curb and…

title: Nice place close to everything
review: I would like to tell you how the restaurant was as I went down there at 920 in the evening and they told me they close at 10 so I couldn't order anything... Just what I wanted after traveling all day!  However the rooms where clean the staff was nice, and the location is great

title: Not the best  Hampton
review: I usually travel a  lot for work and was disappointed when I checked into my room and the deodorizing smell was overwhelming.  thinking, it's just one night - I can deal with this... the direct tv selection was very limited in channels.  Anything I wanted  to  watch tonight was not available to watch.  Anything over channel 34... good luck. Would not stay at this location again.

title: Great Business Experience
review: Business trip to Downtown Fort Lauderdale brought me to this Hampton Inn location, that is very convenient and walking distance to all Downtown locations, including the Museums and Las Olas.  Great staff and rooms. Excellent complimentary breakfast. Enjoyable experience. Look forward to my next business and vacation trip to Downtown Ft Lauderdale and the Hampton Inn,

title: Better hotels elsewhere
review: During my recent four day stay on Jan 31 ~ Feb 3.  I found some rude staff, smelly carpet, over priced parking, and the average breakfast at Hampton Inn at this location.  It is not my next choice when returning.   The ownership should replace the carpet on all floors, fix the slow elevators and noisy doors, improve the breakfast choices, and expand the bar area to offer more seating and food sections.

title: Told Shuttle Service, there was no hotel shuttle
review: Very frustrated. When making the reservation I asked if the hotel provided a free shuttle to and from the airport and to the location of a conference I attended. I was told "yes" and instructed to simply look for the Hampton van in the "shuttle area" of the airport. Which I did....for over 45 minutes.  No shuttle.  I called the hotel and was told "they have no shuttle at the airport nor anywhere else". I spent $300.00 on cab fare during the 3 days conference. Bonus, I only carry enough cash for tips, instead I ended up spending most of it on taxi fare as most them wouldn't take credit cards (even though they have stickers on the vehicles that state they accept credit cards). Hotel manager never returned either of my calls. I'm not hard to please and travel quite a bit for work,…

title: Room and staff nice
review: We stayed here due to proximity to cruise terminal and Segway tour. I agree the price seemed high but not much else in the area for any better at this time. The room and decor weretypical. The breakfast was good.

title: Good Base to visit Fort Lauderdale
review: Used this hotel twice in the last 2 weeks as a base in fort Lauderdale after travelling from UK.  Check in was speedy and the reception staff very helpful.  Big shout for Whidney as she was so welcoming and cheerful and a pleasure to deal with. Rooms whilst not modern were a good size and well equipped with mini fridge and microwave. Stayed in room 413 and 510 and happy with both.  Free Breakfast was a good standard and plentiful, with the hot selections rotating daily and well as the usual pancakes cereals etc. ( could do with breakfast tea for your UK Guests though :) ) Breakfast staff were very attentive even during busy periods and always smiling.. ... Gave you a good start to the day... Overall a nice friendly hotel and one I would use again.

title: Not my cup of tea
review: The staff was really nice, but the hotel has a weird "stale" odor and everything looks very old. They still have old school air conditioners and the microwave was so old it had a dial timer!   Not worth the $300 I paid to stay here for one night.  I was booked for a week but checked out the next day and ended up at a much nicer hotel for the price.

title: Not Your Usual Hampton
review: First, lt me say "yes-excellent service" like my fellow reviewers.  There's much better places to stay in Ft. Lauderdale and my overall experience made my hair on my neck stand up.  While they say "Las Olas", the hotel is on the other side of Route 1 and puts you on the far end of Las Olas, away from the bars and shops that make Las Olas, Las Olas! My gut told me I was on the edge of a more seedy side of Ft. Lauderdale and my room needed updating.  Things are broken, like the frame of the up & down arrows for the elevators, that a guest should never see. It reflects a standard of upkeep for the hotel less than what you expect from Hilton, along with a level of (for lack of better terms) violence and damage occurring in the hotel itself. (My room had damage from distuptive guests…

title: dissapointed
review: I try to stay at Hampton Inn when I travel the Hotel is always excellent, this one I paid the most ever and was the worse one I ever stayed at. Lobby smelled really bad and my room had so my deodorizing spay it was nauseating, maybe to cover up the smell.  When I say worse it was far from bad it was a good room and all but just not up to the standards as other Hampton Inn are. People were nice room was clean just smelly, I just really hated the price.

title: Fantastic customer service!!!
review: I found myself with a complex reservation situation, and Marcus D was instrumental in helping me sort it out. He was fantastic!  I travel to Fort Lauderdale several times a year, and I will definitely stay there for my future visits.   Hotel is well located. It is easy to get to off of Interstate 95 and very close to a wide variety of restaurant choices.

title: Great customer service,good location
review: We arrived after a flight from Manchester and over a two hour drive. We were checked in quickly and efficiently and given some guidance where to eat. Our original room was on the 2nd floor near the bar which we thought may be noisy if we went to bed early, back to reception and they put us on the 11th floor which was great Location is great and really handy for the Las Olas area which has all the bars and restaurants. Breakfast was very good and set you up nicely for the day We stayed here for a couple of days and when we arrived at our next location Key West we realised we had lost/left a Kindle. A couple of calls to the hotel and it couldn't be found. Towards the end of the holiday we emailed Kelly Matera to ask if anyone had handed it in. A couple of days later when we…

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: Recently spend one night at the Hampton Inn prior to our flight. The customer service is fantastic! The young lady at the front desk gave us a map and highlighted the route to Las Olas Blvd. As it was raining when we left the hotel to set out on our walk an umbrella was provided to us by the gentleman at the front desk. The great customer service at the Hampton Inn made us feel valued. The only real issue I found at this hotel was lack of outlets in the room to plug in our phone and computer. The location is great and the customer service is fantastic.

title: Excellent Customer Service, and Professional Staff!!!
review: You cannot put a price on excellent customer service and professionalism! The Manager Kelly Matera and her front desk staff Marcus and Whitney were the epitome of just that. After a long day on the road, it is good to meet staff that treat you as more than a dollar sign. I had a few challenges in getting a room on such a busy weekend, and they went above and beyond to  accommodate my family and their needs. They not only provided us a nice, clean room in a great location downtown. They ensured i was provided all the information of where to go to get food, and entertainment without being asked. I will come back to this location every time i am in this area!! Thank you for a job well done!!!

title: Professional Staff, Great hotel, Good location
review: My family shared in my joyous occasion of my retirement from military service in May 2015.  The Hampton Inn Downtown-Las Olas Area was our hotel of choice for lodging.  Upon our arrival the staff was very courteous, professional, welcoming and accommodating. I would like to give a special recognition to Fatima, she went out of her way to ensure all of our needs were met. Thank you Fatima for everything you did for us during our stay. The O'C family.

title: Hotel in need of renovations
review: good downtown location, but very tired and not well kept property.  carpets were threadbare and filthy, furniture in rooms was broken, equipment in fitness center was broken, cable TV was sporadic. Not a Hilton by any standards.  I have stayed at this hotel many times before, but won't be coming back.

title: Hampton Inn, ideal location
review: Recently spent two nights at the Hampton Inn.  The Front Desk staff were extremely helpful in giving directions to the places I needed to go. One lady even went over the road to find out the schedule for catholic mass when I enquired.  I am really sorry I didn't note their names, since they are all worthy or special mention. For those of you that do not fear public transportation, the bus Terminal is 150 yards beyond the back door of the hotel and I found it quite easy and convenient to get around with a $5 day card.  The business centre and breakfast area were well appointed and I had no issues with my room.  Breakfast omelettes were good also.  Overall, good value for money

title: Value choice
review: Nice location, easy to get to River Walk and cool restaurants and even a CVS and McDonlads close by. There is nothin exceptional about the hotel itself. As with other older properties - there is a serious lack of electric outlets in key places were they are required. The coffee maker was broken - but the free breakfast made up for that inconvienance. If you are look for a hotel before or after a cruise - a good choice.

title: Not feeling the value.
review: The rooms were clean but could use an update. They also charge for parking. The rugs in hallways are worn out . The front desk staff was very helpful! My biggest complaint I guess would be the high cost but it seems everything is over priced in this area. Felt more like a $75 to $90 Per night hotel.

title: Convenient location for transfer to cruise
review: The hotel is in a very convenient location, but like other viewers have noted, is a bit tired. Our room was comfortable and clean, but the bathroom is the most in need of an upgrade.  Service at the front desk was superior.  Friendly and efficient staff  each time we visited.  We dined in had a choice of so many restaurants to chose from it was a good problem to have.  Our room was just on the same level as the bar and breakfast area and was quite noisy in the evening.  We should have anticipated this!  Breakfast was good and the coffee was hot.  Sorry we can't comment on the pool although it did look inviting and clean.  Either way, it's a great location and our shuttle driver picked us up on time.

title: Probably a best buy in the area, but has its plusses and minuses
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review on your recent stay with us!  We are very glad to hear you found our location convenient to all the restaurants downtown has to offer!  We are very excited to announce our rooms will be undergoing a full upgrade this coming Spring.  We would love to have you back to show off our new look once the renovations are done next year!  Save Travels,   Hampton Inn Management

title: Typical Hampton Not Great Not Bad
review: We stayed for one night prior to leaving on a cruise. Everything was fine, nothing fancy. Normal breakfast was served in the morning. Nice stay that was exactly what you would expect and nothing more.

title: Need for renovation
review: clean room but old needs renovatioins both lobby and rooms Easy access to Port Everglades for cruise ship. Can walk to restaurants and shops on Las Olas Blvd. Distance is within one mile. Hotel is much too overpriced about $100. a day overpriced.

title: Good Location
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you very much for your review of our hotel.  We regret to hear that you were not 100% satisfied with your stay.  We are actually going to begin renovations on our hotel this coming Spring.  All of our rooms, lobby, bar and fitness center will be getting a full face lift.  We would love to have you back once the rooms are complete!    Our winter nightly rates are definitely higher than our summer rates.  This is due to the winter time being our high season.    Best regards,   Hampton Inn Management

title: Cruise shuttle to Port Everglades
review: Stayed at the Hampton Inn after Christmas. The location is excellent to Las Olas. This is an average Hampton Hotel so dont expect anything fancy for the value. The rooms were standard but clean and beds comfortable. You need your key to get everywhere in this hotel, which can be a bit frustrating, but understandable safety measure. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Really only negative was the parking garage. The key swipe to get in is a bit difficult to reach and be careful going in the garage it is a tight squeeze especially for large cars.

title: Was comfortable for the night before our cruise
review: We stayed at this hotel because the room pkg. included a shuttle to the cruise port.  They did not mention in our room for 2 adults and 2 children that we would have to pay for the children.  Hotel is showing its age.  It was pricey, but did include breakfast.  The breakfast was fine, but the area needs sprucing up.  I probably would not stay in this hotel again before cruising.  I like Hampton Inns, but was disappointed this time.  On a positive note the pool area was nice.  There were no perks for being a Hilton Honors member.

title: Fort Lauderdale, West Atlantic
review: Hotel was clean - rooms were small compared to newer hotels.  Breakfast was decent but nothing to brag about.  Limo service scheduled by hotel left a little to be desired.
