Had I not driven for 5 hours to get there, had not taken my bags to the room, or had a longer stay I would have left to find another hotel. The Hampton Inn brand name should be taken off that hotel, I was embarrassed to have my wife walk through the hallway to the room and am glad I did not let her go to the lobby.

title: My new Ft. Lauderdale destination.
review: Good Afternoon,   I am in receipt off your review and am actually quite shocked and am in awe.  This hotel just went through a renovation in October of 2012 and has great attention to detail with cleanliness as you can see in the other reviews.  I do respect your comments and will speak with my team and use your review as a learning tool - At the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale City Center our staff thrives on making each guests experience a memorable one.   Safe Travels,

title: Good choice of hotel if you have a car
review: I travel monthly to Ft. Lauderdale, sometimes weekly. I have never stayed at this particular hampton. It was by far the best in the area of any hotel I have stayed at over the years. The staff made me feel welcome, like I was one of their regulars. (Which I will be very soon) The bar added so much value to my stay. It is one amenity that I prefer in my hotel choices because of convenience. Great place. I'll spread the word to my colleagues if they don't already know.

title: Extremely Poor Hotel
review: Good Afternoon and greetings from Sunny South Florida,   I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and have made the decision to switch and make the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale - City Center your new home away from home!  You are correct in saying that the staff does make each guest feel welcome - We love what we do!     I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Comfortable Stay
review: You will need a car if you wish to stay at this hotel. Everything is too far to walk.  The Hotel itself offers a lot of great ammenities for the price and staff are courteous and friendly. The rooms are clean and smell fresh.

title: A pool that closes at dusk?
review: In town on business and really wanted to just sit in the hot tub to relax, but they close it at dusk.  I've stayed at a lot of hotels and most close the pool area around 10 or 11, but 8pm?  If you check in by 5 and go to dinner forget the pool.

title: PERFECT
review: We're so sorry that our pool times did not meet your needs and we appreciate your feedback. We'll be sure to keep this in mind as we make improvements to our policies. We hope you'll consider staying with us again in the area.  Kind regards,

title: Excellent value
review: Great location, friendly staff, and CLEAN :) This place is a perfect location with a fun night life right around the corner. Its affordable, clean and has a super comfy king size bed! You get more than your money's worth when you stay here and I highly recommend it for those visiting Ft. Lauderdale. The parking garage was also very convenient and safe as well.

title: OUTSTANDING
review: Greetings from Sunny Fort Lauderdale -    I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience at The Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale - City Center!   I always love hearing guests point out just how great the staff is and the attention to detail with cleanliness!  The staff takes pride in what they do and love what they do!  Which you can see makes a world of a difference!   I do look forward to seeing you at Fort Lauderdale’s Closest Hilton property to Trendy Las Olas in the future!   Safe Travels,

title: Nice hotel...careful, parking is not free anymore
review: This was a very nice 3-night stay.   This hotel is excellent value, handy  to numerous restaurants, downtown and attractions.   It is very comfortable with great amenities and included breakfast. The 2nd floor area serving breakfast was bright and cheerful adjoining the pool and terrace.  Other reviewers are right about the tight car park. The numerous scrapes on the side walls vouch for that!   We would definitely recommend to anyone including couples, business people and families. Also a great place to stay either before or after a cruise out of Port Everglades.

title: Our May visit to Fort Lauderdale
review: This Hampton Inn was ideally located for our visit. It's within 10 minute walking distance of St. Anthony Catholic Church  (Catholics, beware,  St. Francis/St. Clare that is directly catty-cornered to the hotel is not in union with Rome) and a variety of shops and restaurants on Broward Boulevard. The room rates are reasonable and parking in a multi-tiered garage is available from where guests can access their rooms.  The dining area and bar are conveniently located on the 2nd floor out of the way of hotel pedestrian traffic and is accessible from the pool area.  The suites are comodious and the bathrooms are spacious. All told, an excellent place to stay while visiting Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Very Clean Hotel!
review: This hotel was one of the nicest Hamptons we have ever stayed in. Very clean in the rooms, freindly staff, and they have a bar! When we checked in we were given each a complimentary free drink to use at the bar, there is free wifi and free breakfeast! For the location it is in the middle of the downtown area so not much around it is not near the ocean but it suited us fine for what we needed it for. There is a ton of restaurants and shopping  very close by on Las Olas Blvd. and there is a Irish pub a block from the hotel that I heard was good. This hotel does have room service and I mean a full menu with lots of variety. The parking lot is very secure and you can only access it with your room key as well as getting to your room in the elevator. This property is very safe, very…

title: GREAT location & GREAT hotel!
review: Hello from Sunny Fort Lauderdale -   Thank-You so much for taking the time out of your crazy schedule to share your experience ...   I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and took notice to the cleanliness of the hotel and friendliness of the team ...   The two things we pride ourselves on and they were noted all in one review!  Thank-You!!    I do hope to see you next time you are in Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: First Time in Florida
review: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. We arrived early and staff was more than willing to hold our luggage while we went to the pool and our room was ready. They called multiple taxis for us throughout our stay and gave us a late checkout upon departure. We were VERY pleased. Rooms were clean & comfy. We will definitely be back!

title: Hampton Inn-Ft. Lauderdale-Very Happy!
review: Greetings from Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   I appreciate your feedback and always enjoy hosting our guests here at the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale -   I am delighted to hear that you were able to get out and see all that Downtown Fort Lauderdale has to offer ... Just steps away from Trendy Las Olas with over 40 restaurants and boutique shopping we are in the prime location!   Taxi's are a dime a dozen ...  I am enthused that you were able to obtain one so quickly!   As for the staff ... they are the BEST and go out of their way to ensure each and every guest enjoys their stay!   I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Downtown Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: I don't always stay in Ft. Lauderdale, but when I do, I stay at Hampton Inn Downtown!!!!
review: I stay in Hamptons throughout the south, and though nice in their own ways, Hampton Inn Downtown is by far the best. I actually look forward to checking inn, great atmosphere, location and most importantly, staff. 10 out 10, thanks for a great home away from home.

title: New hotel right near downtown
review: A very warm welcome from your home away from home,   At the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale we pride ourselves on making each and every guest feel at home and special.  With our personalized touch our guests feel the way you do and not like a number.   Outstanding service and a very clean hotel makes our guests want to return.  We appreciate your loyalty.  Next time you are in town,  be certain to check out just how close we are to Las Olas...  a great spot just a few blocks away with an abundance of restaurants and boutique shopping!   I do look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Safe Travels,

title: Very nice stay
review: This hotel was within walking distance of the Las Olas area which has tons of great restaurants and shopping! Rooms were nice and hotel was newly renovated. Very secure parking, new breakfast area and great snacks/drinks available in lobby shop.

title: nice and clean hotel
review: Hello from Sunny Fort Lauderdale,   Thank-You for sharing your experience with us.  I am delighted that you had a wonderful experience and enjoyed all that The Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale has to offer.   We are just a few blocks from Trendy Las Olas which boasts over forty restaurants and delightful boutique shopping.  Thank-You for noting our new renovations,  we just added a full service bar with great food options in the evening.    I do look forward to seeing you during your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale,   Safe Travels,

title: Downtown Fort Lauderdale
review: My wife and I were going on a cruise and spent the night here prior to leaving. We used the package that allowed us to leave our vehicle in their parking garage while we were on the cruise. This turned out to be a great cost savings over parking at the port.  The hotel is in an older part of the city and the exterior of the building is clean but you can tell it is an older building. My wife and I when we arrived started to question if we made the right decision to stay there.  Once inside it was truly a nice facility that has been remodeled and all of the people working here were friendly and extremely helpful.   They also have a fully stocked bar at night which was the first I have seen in a Hampton. Most give a beer or glass of wine, but this was a full service pay bar, but we…

title: Ft Lauderdale Hampton Inn
review: Eat before you get there. Food at the bar is gross, and you don't want to be walking around in the neighborhood. Take a taxi to the port everglades terminal rather than the free shuttle. Its a huge bus that takes forever to load, and goes to 3 different cruise ships. What should have taken 10 minutes took us an hour. Breakfast was overcrowded, and they had some yellow pellets they were trying to pass off as scrambled eggs. Ugh.

title: Clean, downtown hotel
review: This is a typical Hampton Inn in Fort Lauderdale.  I appreciated the nice, large lobby and the upscale breakfast area on the 2nd floor.  Even though this hotel is downtown, I felt very safe.  The hotel was spotless and the pool area was very nice as well.  There is a $12 parking fee and it is a tight lot but I did not have an issue with my vehicle.  Your room key will access the parking, the entrance, the elevator, and of course your room.

title: Surprise! Now Charges to Park; New policy not revealed when reserving; this Hampton Inn now charges $12/night to park.
review: Greetings from Downtown Fort Lauderdale -   I am excited to read that you had a wonderful time in Fort Lauderdale and loved the hotel ... At the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale we take great pride in treating each and every guest as an individual and personalize their stay,   We are dynamically located to Trendy Las Olas that boasts over forty restaurants and boutique shopping.  Our hotel is spotless, Thank -You for noticing!  My housekeeping staff I believe is the best in the industry they are meticulous.    I look forward to seeing you at your next stay in Downtown Fort Lauderdale -  The closest Hampton Inn to Downtown Fort Lauderdale.   Safe Travels,

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Nice hotel, old but clean; good service and staff.  Low rating because of surprise change in parking policy; now charging $12/night for what was always included in the room rate.  No mention of the policy change when making the reservation, otherwise I would not have stayed here.  This is a management policy change; unfair to the staff to withhold the policy change when reserving, makes the staff the bearer of surprise bad news.

title: Suited out need perfectly
review: Thank-You for sharing your feedback -  I do appreciate transparent feedback as I always utilize it as a learning tool for my team.  The Hampton Inn is located in a great location, right in the heart of Downtown Fort Lauderdale just steps away from Trendy Las Olas with boutique shopping and over forty restaurants to chose from.  As for the parking fee that has been implemented it clearly states a parking fee on our web page as well as on all third party sites.  Having a secured four story parking garage to utilize is a benefit we offer our guests that has proven to be well received,  I do apologize that you were not happy with the $12.00 fee .  I am delighted that you were happy with everything else.  We do have a wonderful staff and very clean hotel that has just been renovated with a new second floor lobby, full bar and fitness center.    I do look forward to you staying at the closest Hampton Inn property to trendy Las Olas again in the future   Safe Travels,

title: Looking for a quiet, clean, service oriented hotel away from the crowds but close to beach? You found it!
review: Was looking for a hotel away from the Spring Breakers but close enough to visit friends at a near-by beach resort! We hit the jackpot...The rates were reasonable, the rooms very nice and clean(and quiet) , and the service was great!   The biggest surprise? The breakfast! It was outstanding! Not just the usual continental with scrambled egg fare...they had omelettes, potatoes, sausage along with a great buffet of waffles, fruits, muffins, cereal, etc! Best of all, it was FREE!!!! We were so grateful for that...our friends were asked to pay $21.95 each for a continental only breakfast at a near by resort! his makes a huge difference for "family travel."  The only negative and it had virtually no impact...the parking garage is a bit hard to manuever! Very, very, very tight…

title: Great Service
review: Thank-You for sharing your experience with us.  I am delighted to read that you were very happy with you stay and would gladly return for your next trip to Fort Lauderdale.  Being that we are an 11 story  building we have quieter rooms than perhaps some other properties.  Being in Downtown Fort Lauderdale we are located close to everything and yet far enough away to not attract the Spring break crowd.  As for our parking garage,  it has ample parking for all vehicles and prefer that larger SUV's and trucks are parked on the lower level for ease around tighter corners.  Just an added amenity for our guests to have a secured parking garage on site.   I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Safe Travels,

title: My favorite, most friendly place to stay in Fort Lauderdale.
review: I recently stayed at this hotel while visiting a college friend who had just moved to the area.  The staff was extremely helpful when we asked for restaurant suggestions and  asked about the "local favorites".  They knew exactly where to send us and we were never disappointed.  The rooms were comfy and clean and I would definitely stay here again!!  Great hotel!

title: EXCEPTIONAL!!!
review: Thank-You for sharing your experience with us.  I appreciate the time you took out of your schedule to acknowledge that are staff is on point and helpful and that the hotel is in a great location and clean.  We work very hard to make our guests happy and feel like they are at their home away from home...   I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels.

title: Safe and sound. Meets Hampton standards.
review: I love this Hampton the most of all my business travels. It is centrally located near the beach, Las Olas, downtown, grocery stores, bars and restaurants and I-95. I have stayed here often and love the staff and feel welcome and at home there. I recommend this location to all my friends and business associates and will continue to stay here when in this area.

title: a great place to visit
review: the Hampton Inn has always been a great place to stay...but this was the best.  The staff was very kind and helpful.  They really made our stay enjoyable. The front desk was knowledgeable, they helped us plan our day trips.. The breakfasts were great. The rooms were clean .

title: Within walking distance of Las Olas Blvd
review: Thank-You for noticing we are one of the best!  We try very hard to ensure each guests stay is personalized.  You made a great point, my front desk team does assist planning day trips and scheduling shuttles.  This helps our out of towners to familiarize themselves with the area  ( which helps the relaxation process )  I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Another great Hampton Inn experience!!
review: We stayed here for 1 night.  I always look for Hampton Inns for short stays as part of the Hilton family I feel the quality is above the other Inns, this location did not disappoint.  It was a ten minute drive from the airport, a ten minute walk to Las Olas Blvd, and a ten minute drive to the cruise ship pier. Our room was exactly as described.  It was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was clean and the shower had hot water and good pressure. There were drinks and snacks at the front desk available for purchase 24hrs, a restaurant (can not comment as we did not use) and free basic breakfast in the morning.  Other amenities was a pool, whirlpool and exercise room (again did not use since we only stayed one night). I would stay here again.

title: Great Location for Port Canaveral/ Los Olas Blvd
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   Glad to see that you enjoyed your stay  -  We are just a few blocks from Trendy Las Olas and the Riverfront, with boutique shops and restaurants in abundance this is a great location for our guests to sit at one of the European cafe's and take in all that Fort Lauderdale has to offer!    Thank-You for commenting on the rooms and the attention to detail they display my team takes pride in ensuring each and every guest is satisfied.   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Great hotel!
review: I stayed at this hotel recently with coworkers.  We normally stay by the airport but decided to give this downtown location a try.  The location is perfect, within walking/cab distance of all the restaurants and bars downtown.  I'm not sure why so many other reviews talk about the horrible location.  I'm pretty sure this is the only hotel downtown so close to everything.  I did see homeless people in the area but I've never been to a city that didn't have homeless people.  Come on people, they are harmless.  We were given complimentary drink coupons for the hotels' new bar which was a nice touch.  They even serve appetizers from the bar.  I don't always feel like going out so this is a huge bonus.  Staff were all extremely helpful and went out of their way to assist with any…

title: not worth the cost
review: We were on the 9th floor but traffic noise woke us up. The bar does not give quality wine and bar tender was over worked so don't stop there. High price for just average Hampton and I always stay at Hamptons!

title: Very average...
review: Greeting from Sunny South Florida,    I am saddened to see that you were not happy with our brand new bar!  It's actually been quite a hit since we opened which is why the bar tender seems over worked!  We are very busy  -  I have added a second person in fact to assist with the demand and all of our guests.  As for the quality of wine,  I assume you are referring to our FREE drink coupon where we offer a complimentary glass of our house wine or draft beer - ( this is also a success! )  I do apologize that the selection of our house wine is not one of your favorite, we do have a pretty decent wine selection to chose from at a minimal cost as well as an extensive sprits and beer selection.    I do Thank-You for sharing your experience with us and look forward to seeing you on your next trip to South Florida!

title: Nice hotel, like the addition of a bar!
review: This property doesn't exhilarate, nor does it disappoint. Couldn't say that the check in process was up to Hampton standard. The place was clean and for an older hotel - they have fixed up nicely, albeit some of the furniture in the lobby was showing signs of age. The pool area was nice. We ate our breakfast - poolside. The breakfast was basic and good. For an average hotel goer, you will be very satisfied. If you are accustomed to Hampton Hospitality - than you could feel a little let down. You will pay for parking which is probably the norm in Ft Lauderdale. I expect that with valet but...whatever. Since we were anticipating moving to Beach blvd we probably had our hearts elsewhere...would I recommend it - depends what you want. If you are gone to business all day, then yep!

title: Awesome hotel!
review: Greetings from South Florida,   I am glad you decided to spend your holidays with us!  At the Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale.  We try very hard to make each and every guest enjoy their stay with hopes of seeing them year after year! I will address your comments with my team and utilize them as a learning tool to improve in the future!   Safe Travels and I do hope to see you and your family on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!

title: Detailed Review of Pros and Cons
review: Second time here. Nice hotel - like that they have a small bar and food now! Read lots of reviews about bad location but I've traveled here with my family twice and had no issues. I like that it's close to Las Olas Blvd.

title: Excellent value
review: We stayed one night pre-cruise. As we had a late evening flight, we really only slept (very comfy bed and clean room) and had a nice breakfast. Arranged for a shuttle to the cruise port. We'd stay here again.

title: Grim Location and No Restaurants Nearby
review: Thank-You for sharing your experience with us.  I noticed you mentioned our comfy beds...  We just replaced all of our mattresses in the entire hotel along with adding a new full service bar with food options.  At the Hampton Inn City Center we take pride in our property as well as personalize each and every guests stay to ensure that you  - our guest is satisfied!   I hope to see you during your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Perfect Location
review: Favorable reviews here influenced me to book a room at this hotel, and I was pleased with the place except that the location is in a commercial area that is spooky at night, there are no restaurants within walking distance, and the garage is designed so as to make it easy to bump into something.

title: Great spot!
review: Thank-You for taking a moment to share your experience.  Being right in the heart of downtown there are more colorful areas then others.  In saying that,  we are just a few short blocks to famous Las Olas Blvd with trendy boutique shopping and over 40 restaurants to choose from  - certain to please anyone’s pallet.   Las Olas is walk able or for just $5.00 and less than 2 minutes away a taxi can pick you up right at our doorstep and whisk you to the waterfront and tons of restaurants!  This location is sure to please almost anyone ...     I hope to see you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale  -  I'd love to show you all Fort Lauderdale and the Downtown area has to offer!   Safe Travels,

title: excellent location and hotel
review: This hotel is right in the middle of everything fun to do downtown.  Very nice facilities and the secure parking is a nice touch.  Since my last stay the hotel renovated the breakfast area and added a bar.  All of this looks out onto the pool and you can set inside or outside to enjoy your breakfast or drinks.  The pool is very nice and they have updated the furniture with cozy areas for you to spend your afternoon or evening with friends.   If you are going to Ft. Lauderdale this is your spot.

title: Romantic Getaway
review: LOVE this place!!  It was our anniversary and of course hotels on the beach were booked, so we chose this one.. When we checked in I explained to Eric at the front desk that it was our anniversary and of course he wished us a Happy Anniversary, but when we returned from shopping there was a Bottle of Champagne and a Beautiful note from Eric wishing us a Happy Anniversary again!!  Kuddos to Eric!  The breakfast is great and you can prepare your own waffles. they also have a bar which is open from 5 to 11 p.m  everyday!!  I will say its not the best area, but they do have a shuttle bus or you can take  a  2 to 3 minute cab ride to Las Olas which is a Long strip of stores and great restaurants and its very close to the beach!!  I also have to give a special thank you to David…

title: Really pleasantly surprised!
review: Hotel is certainly near down town. Very nice, happy staff. Pleasant pool/whirlpool area. Downside - navigating the parking garage - a tight turn getting in and out - it can be done even with a full size SUV or truck.

title: Another great visit.
review: Hello from Sunny Fort Lauderdale -   It's always nice to receive a prospective from guests from out of the country -  I am delighted that your very long journey all the way from the Netherlands was pleasant and you had a wonderful time.  You are correct,  The Hampton Inn in Downtown Fort Lauderdale is certainly right in the heart of downtown close to all that Fort Lauderdale has to offer.  Just a stone’s throw away Trendy Las Olas with the waterfront, boutique shopping and a plethora of restaurants certain to please all pallets.  Beaches, museums , performing arts center and revolutions all within reach.  Our staff is very pleasant and happy as they do love what they do!   Thank-You for your kind words... I hope to see you on your next trip to South Florida!

title: Avearge
review: I travel extensively and look forward to my trips to Fort Lauderdale as the staff at this property is very in tune to the business traveler. The management staff goes out of their way to accommodate all my needs and the front desk staff has been taught just the same. They have recently opened a bar with a light fare which is great at the end of the day when you don’t want to go out. It would be great if they had small bar pizza or even a cold type of sandwich, don’t get me wrong the sliders and wings are great but when you travel a lot sometimes they are too heavy. Here again the service at the bar is up to par with the rest of the property. My hat goes off to Kelly Malone and Kelly Matera along with their staff Dawn, David and Allan just mention a few. With so many choices we…

title: NIce clean hotel with good staff--questionable location
review: Thank-You for sharing your experience with us.  I am always delighted to have a long time loyal guest share feedback with us.  We do try our hardest to ensure each and every guest's experience is personalized in effort to give you the " home away from home " feeling while our road warriors are away on business.  I am glad you pointed out our new Bar and it's food options that adds a wonderful amenity to the hotel for our guests.  Pizza is a great idea!  I will look into testing pizza out as an option and see how our guests take to it!  As always ,  I am open for suggestions and feedback as this is our way to grow and make your stay that much better!   I look forward to seeing you during one of your 100 stays a year  -   Safe Travels,

title: Decent enough hotel but priced on the high side.
review: Nice room, good location in the Business district of Ft. Lauderdale, but at USD 180/night, it is too expensive. Staff was very helpfull when asked, although they did not have a plug converter, something I think all hotels should have. Breakfast was OK, but not something they should rave about, the use of disposable plates and cutlery is certainly not my "cup-of-tea".

title: Great Value
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   Thank-You for sharing your experience and pointing out that the staff is very helpful and attentive to detail - our staff works very diligently to ensure each and every guests experience is personalized.  As for our plates in breakfast - Hampton Inn worldwide is very environmentally "green" conscious,  the plates are not paper nor Styrofoam they are actually taterware  made our of potatoes.  Each and every Hampton Inn hotel and employee strives to reduce the carbon foot print and made the world a more beautiful place for the years to come ...  I understand your thoughts but with this new tid bit of information hopefully you understand why we do what we do ...   I hope to see you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Febreeze fiasco!
review: Hotel was beautiful and the staff was very helpful and friendly, I love that the duvets are cleaned for every new guest. The room and hotel are  very clean and well maintained, even smells nice! That's a big one for me. Would  stay here again for sure!

title: Great stay. So comfortable and you can smell the clean. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.
review: Hello Utah!   One of my favorite states I might add -   I do appreciate the time you took to write a review and share your experience!  You are correct in saying that we have extremely clean rooms. Hampton Inn's nationwide want to make certain that every single piece of linen is cleaned for each guest.  I n efforts to spread the word I am sure you noticed the little sticky note stating that your duvet was cleaned!  Just a little piece of mind :)   We have a great staff that understands how a guest feels after a long flight or drive and how you want to feel on vacation ( relaxed and worry free ).   I hope to see you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Safe Travels,

title: Good hotel for the price
review: Enjoyed the location of the hotel as we took in some attractions near by and bus stops are nearby to get to the mall and beach! We stayed for 2 nights before our cruise left port. The hotel appeared to be clear but I was extremely disappointed when we opened the door to our room and all we could smell was Febreeze! Dispute the fact that I have a severe fragrance allergy I was quite disturbed that they would clean a room in this way. It seemed as though they were just spraying this to mask the fact that it wasn't clean! We spoke with the staff at the front desk who were very sympathetic and looked for another room for us with less of a Febreeze smell!! They did find us another room which was a little better. They told us they left a not for the cleaning staff to not spray it in…

title: Central location, slightly frustrating parking when busy. Rooms seem clean but "stale".
review: Stayed at this hotel for NYE. The location is very central (taxis, etc) but I would not say that it is very walkable due to the surrounding area (not awful, not great)  Being NYE they were totally booked and we ended up with a handicapped-accessible room. I have stayed in many handicapped-accessible rooms, but this one was absolutely horrible due to design of the bathroom. It had a standard roll-in shower but it was plagued with drainage issues. The shower itself is too narrow so the water just drains of of it, onto the main bathroom floor. There is a drain on the main floor but its location is under the sink and the floor is not evenly sloped. A HUGE puddle forms in the middle of the bathroom creating a serious hazard and inconvenience. The bathroom had very poor ventilation as…

title: Pre Cruise for 2 Nights
review: Happy New Year from the Hampton Inn Downtown!   Thank-You for your detailed review.  As you experienced New Years Eve is a very busy time of year  -  Being right in the heart of Downtown Fort Lauderdale it is easy to walk to Trendy Las Olas and hail a taxi.  You mentioned our breakfast and pool area ( Thank-You for noticing our recent renovation  - we are very excited about this as well )  We recently upgraded our pool patio, added new soft seating around the pool area, resurfaced the pool and best of all renovated the second floor lobby  with all new furniture and added a full service bar!  This allowing our guests to feel comfortable at their home away from home!   I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!  I promise we will WOW you!   Safe Travels,

title: Great Pre/Post Cruise Hotel
review: We stayed here for 2 nights pre cruise aware from previous reviews that the location was perhaps not the best. It certainly is a few blocks off the beaten track and late night walks maybe best avoided. Perfectly good for walking to dinner at some great places a few blocks away. Rooms are looking a little tired as are  the corridors but it did the job at a fair rate. Breakfast is what you expect at a Hampton Inn and it adds greatly to the value. A recent innovation is a cocktail bar near the breakfast bar which we valued greatly! The free shuttle to the cruise dock was good but bear in mind it may go to other hotels - despite what they say at the desk. Beware of buying returns to the airport for that shuttle from the cruise port  - it was chaotic there and they had no system in…

title: Clean Hotel at a reasonable price
review: Greeting from Sunny South Florida!   Thank-You for taking the time to share your experience with us ...  I am thrilled you chose the Hampton Inn Downtown for your pre-cruise hotel.  We are located right in the heart of downtown Fort Lauderdale  - As with any downtown location there are more colorful spots then others -  We are located just a short walk to Trendy Las Olas with over 40 restaurants and trendy boutique shopping.  Everything a trip to Fort Lauderdale would want and all just a short walk or a $5.0 taxi ride.    I do look forward to seeing you when you visit from beautiful Maine again in the future!   Safe Travels!

title: Great location
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on 12/19/12, the night before departing for our cruise.  It is located about 10-15 minutes from the Ft. Lauderdale Hollywood Airport, which the taxi ride was about $20.  We got a great price on Hotels.com.  They offer free internet service, a great hot breakfast in the morning and free shuttle service over to the cruise terminal.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  When we returned from our cruise, we stayed again on 12/30/12.  We had rented a car this time and was very pleased to see that they had a secured parking garage that required a room card to enter.  We were able to (free) park on the 4th floor where our room was located and it was nice and convenient.  Word of caution, drive very slowly in the garage, especially if you have…

title: Not much to say
review: I really don't have much to say about the hotel. I only stayed one night, and here's what I thought. It was easy to find. The staff was very friendly and more than willing to assist in any way.  Parking is limited, but I enjoyed the fact that it required a key to get in to it.  I did not like having to use a key to get to the room, but I understand why they do it. They do not offer room service, but will provide menus to local restaurants that deliver.   Other than that, I had a pleasant stay, and wouldn't mind staying here again.

title: Great hotel
review: Sending you warm wishes from Sunny South Florida,   Thank-You for taking time to write a review and share your experience.  We do offer key access to the parking garage and elevator landings as this provides a little more peace and quiet when we have sports teams staying on-site.  We have a great location and a fantastic staff that goes above and beyond to ensure your stay is personalized.    Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!

title: Typical Hampton Inn, good location---with to much hassle!
review: Stayed three nights hotel is great service is the best I have seen in a while.  The assistant Manager checked me in and explained the area she was helpful. Everyone I came in contact with was given to hospitality.  I loved that the pool was isolated and the breakfast area overlooked.  One thing was the price of a drink in the bar.  More than ten dollars is excessive.  Overall great and I will return.

title: good centrally located hotel
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale!   I appreciate the time you took to review our hotel ...  We do have a great staff and my AGM is one of the best!  We just added the bar with food options that allows the guests to relax a little prior to hitting the town or turning in for the night ...   We do strive to make each guests experience a memorable one!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!

title: Great place to stay
review: Typical Hampton Inn near Las Olas Blvd in Fort Lauderdale.  Problem is parking is a pain and getting to room is a pain.  Requires key to get in garage (Parking is limited and narrow spaces)and then key to get in building and then a key to get to your room on elevator.  It's clean and staff was nice but I don't want to hassle with parking and elevator every time I come in an out.  I like the location but in the future I'll find a property with less hassle.

title: best staff ever
review: i was stuck in florida an extra week because of hurricane Sandy and the hotel staff coddled me wonderfully  --  all my needs and questions were met with smiles and efficiency  -- an unexpected delight (also, they serve a great free breakfast buffet)

title: Good Value
review: Greetings from Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   I was delighted to see your review and am sad to have seen you leave but hoping that all is well back home with the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy.   Thank-You for the kind words,   Safe Travels,

title: Very comfortable and not overpriced.
review: Bottom line, it's a good Fort Lauderdale hotel. With many "downtown hotels", the area certainly isn't an area you'd take a stroll through - the hotel is rather centrally located and you really need a car in FLL.  PROS  Room was clean, comfortable and quiet Hampton Inn Breakfast was great (and I rarely eat a hotel's free breakfast) Garage parking which was rather secure (but their website shows they will soon be charging for parking)  CONS  The area of town is borderline questionable The staff could have been a less apathetic  Overall, I'd stay again if the price is right though my preference would be closer to the Fort Lauderdale Beach.

title: It's an okay location, but not city center
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale,   I appreciate the time you took to write a review and share your experience.  The Hampton Inn Downtown is a great value in an outstanding location ( 5 minute / $5 taxi ride to Trendy Las Olas and the Riverfront )  -   I was certainly surprised to read that you thought the staff was "apathetic "  - I have used your comments as a teaching tool with the staff.   We strive to ensure each guest's expectations are met and exceeded with service and cleanliness ).   I do look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: nice, strong improvements > my recommendation
review: We spent one night here as a stop off before driving to the Gulf Coast so wasn't too concerned about the location - price and comfort was more a factor in our decision to stay.  We paid £65 through Expedia but they had not informed the hotel of our request for an accessible room.  Not a problem luckily as the receptionist quickly sorted us an accessible king room, which was very comfortable and had decent amenities including fridge and large bathroom with roll in shower.   The self service breakfast was much better than similar style breakfasts we have previously had in hotels of this type.  We arrived in the dark so didn't really take in what the neighbourhood was like.  It wasn't until after sunrise that we saw that there were homeless folk sleeping under an empty building…

title: Good downtown location
review: We stayed here on Nov 11th  after our trans-Atlantic cruise This hotel is not up to the usual Hampton standards and we would not stay there again. The staff was curteous. The hotel was full the night before so we could not check in until 2PM - We did walk to Las Olas and enjoyed Brineys and watching a Football game, the yachts going up and down the river. The hotel book left a great deal to be desired - there were no restaurant ads - in fact we did not see any thing but fast foods on our walk to Las Olas. We had a very early flight the next day and they did not bother to get us  breakfast on-the run bags

title: Excellent budget option
review: We stayed at this hotel for one night only prior to a cruise. We were greatly surprised at the quality of the room and the facilities for the price we paid. Room and bathroom were impeccable with little touches you don't often see in other hotels such as multiple power sockets to plug/charge gadgets, a laptop tray, etc. The breakfast area looks newly renovated and the service, although basic, was very polite and attentive, they even brought us bottle waters to our table without us asking for them. The location in downtown is a good geographically speaking but there are several abandoned buildings around so might not be that safe after dark. Having said that, we went for a walk in the morning and experienced no problems whatsoever.

title: Great Location for Las Olas
review: Let's cut to the chase - this hotel is not a 5 star property nor on the water, but for business or spending a night/weekend going out in Fort Lauderdale this is a great option. Stayed here weekend before Halloween and take advantage of Las Olas celebrations...  Pros: The rates are normally super cheap. Easy redemption options for Hhonors members. Free breakfast. Within walking distance of Las Olas (MOST IMPORTANT BENEFIT in my opinion!)  Cons: On edge of area in transition.   Verdict: This property is a very functional hotel and easy to get in/out of. I recommend for people looking for a deal but still pretty nice.

title: They never stop improving!
review: I have been staying at this hotel on and off for the past three years and I must say there has been dramatic improvement over this time span. I have become familiar with the staff as I stay here often and they sure can be friendly. They informed me that they have been constantly making improvements like renovating the bathrooms, replacing the mattresses, upgrading to flat panel TVs, increasing the wifi broadband, refinishing the pool, and now the best improvement of them all... They are installing a bar! They have also remodeled the entire 2nd floor breakfast area and it looks gorgeous; the fitness center also looks a lot better now. I can't wait to see what they come up with next.

title: Great place to stay before your cruise
review: We stayed here in transit to our cruise and every aspect was well worth it...location, price, the free shuttle service as well as the room was extremely clean. Las Olas (and restaurants) was just a 15 minute walk away and the front desk gave us a map of the area with location and numbers for most of the restaurants. On the map some of the restaurants indicated that guests of the hotel would receive a discount on their meal which we utilised.  Our only grouse was with the breakfast which was a very limited selection and a bit cold.

title: Great value!!!
review: Highly recommend it! Great hotel in a central location. Clean and comfortable rooms,  breakfast is well stocked and delicious. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped us with advice. Parking in a secure garage is superb! We arrived very late, but everiyhing went smooth. Best Hampton Inn of all 3 we stayed in Florida!

title: Good Stay
review: We stayed here on a group tour. The hotel has recently been refurbished. Our room was excellent and clean, the bed very comfortable and well air conditioned. The pool area was very nice and enjoyed a nice cool down there. The walk in to the main restaurant precinct was about 10 minutes. Secure locked parking. Would recommend this hotel to others.

title: Best of the best
review: My husband and I often stay at Hampton inns when we travel. We love the clean rooms, friendly staff and free breakfast!  We stayed at this Hampton inn and was so impressed that we wanted to write a review.  The front desk staff was very friendly and professional. They made my whole family feel welcome.  The room decor and breakfast were both the best we've ever seen. Thanks for a Wonderful stay!!!

title: Good Hotel at reasonable rates
review: We stayed there a few more days than intended in August this year due to Hurricane Issac. Staff were very helpful, rooms clean & beds very comfy. They don't have a Restaurant but do supply a free breakfast which is quite sufficient & you are able to help yourself to coffee/tea 24 hrs a day. As we didn't have transport, the Trolley stop was right out the front, which would take you down to the restaurants or shops. A 5 minute walk also took you to the bus station, so very happy with the location of this Hotel!

title: Great customer service
review: The Room was clean and the beds were so comfortable.  Everyone on the staff was very accomodating, especially the young man at the front desk named Thomas.  He is kind and friendly and always has thebiggest smile.  A great expereince.  We will be back.

title: A nice hotel at a reasonable price
review: This is an upscale Hampton inn in downtown Fort Lauderdale. The room is clean and service is friendly. They offer a free breakfast which is well stocked. If you book in advance, you should be Abe to get a nice room for around $100 a night. As with all Hampton inns, there is no restaurant on site. But it is close to many nice restaurants downtown.

title: Great Experience
review: I have stayed at numerous hotels through the years. When I find a place that is clean, hospitable, and managed with a top quality staff, I will continue to stay at the establishment. I have had to change the times and dates that I would staying at the Hampton Inn, due to my work schedule, and the staff has been nothing but accomodating. On more then one occassion I have had the pleasure to deal with the assistant manager Kelly Matera. She has gone above and beyond to make my stay pleasurable. To date - when I have to go to Ft Lauderdale I will make sure i stay at the Hampton Inn, because I know that it will be a smooth and pleasurable experience due to the friendly staff and accomodating management!!

title: Hampton inn fort lauderdale
review: I have been using this property for about three years both for meetings and overnight stays. The staff has been excellent meeting our needs in the meeting space and sleeping rooms for our group. Both the manager Kelley Malone and her asst. Kelly Matera have gathered a staff that is exceptional.

title: No complaints... Great option if you're in Ft Lauderdale!
review: I'm a regular Hampton client and this hotel was also a great experience. Very good rooms and service, though the hotel was under renovation. The very few uncomfortable aspects, natural in a renovation process, didn't eclipse our stay and I would certainly go back.  Being downtown is not an issue, because the hotel is within a few block from LAS OLAS and all the interesting things from Ft Lauderdale's nightlife and busier places. Besides that, having free parking (doesn't apply tomost hotels by the beach) is also very convenient.  Try it out, it's great!

title: Hampton Ft Lauderdale 6/12
review: Great hotel in a central location. Great value. Clean and comfortable. Secure car parking. Area a bit run down but no problems experienced. Good free breakfast but like all free buffet breakfasts gets very busy towards finishing time and staff cannot replinesh items quickly enough.

title: second time around not so good
review: this is a lovely hotel, nice rooms and pool and great location. when we were there they were refurbishing the breakfast room, fair enough, the hotel advertises as tea and coffee in the lobby 24 hrs, there was none in the lobby and you could not access the drinks in the alternative breakfast room. when this was mentioned to the front desk at check out, she said that's because of the refurb, no apologies- then don't advertise that this is available if it is not! small thing i know, but this is one of the reasons we stay here, we stayed last year and drinks were available in the lobby and breakfast room 24 hrs. would not stay again

title: NEEDS CLEANING/UPDATING
review: The staff was friendly and helpful. The Hotel needs new carpet/paint. Internet is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE! The direct tv doesn't work very well either. Would not stay again for over $75/night and would still have to reconsider as Internet access is key today.

title: Close to downtown nightlife
review: We stayed here after reading the reviews. It was close to Los Olas and two city blocks from the downtown area with all the bars. The hotel has a bus/shuttle stop right outside its main doors for convenience if you don't have a vehicle. It is close enough that if you want to enjoy yourself with all the nightlife has to offer, cab fare should be fairly inexpensive. We had a car but always having those options are a plus! It was clean with secure, covered parking and a great value for the area. Would stay here again!

title: Customer service resides at this location
review: I am a diamond customer of this chain and obviously travel frequently with my job. Visiting the many different hotels it becomes common place to compare one environment to the next. This hotel is not only clean, comfortable and centrally located, but the staff is friendly, hospitable and second to none in my opinion. To the extent that I inadvertently left my phone charger in my room and they made sure that it was not only found but returned to me at my convenience. Assistant General Manager Kelly Matera takes customer service to a whole new level and this was certainly not a single instance of good service. I have visited there on many, many occasions and the positive attitude pervades the entire establishment. This is definitely somewhere that you would want to bring the…

title: "Awesome place to stay"
review: The hotel is well maintained and very clean. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful.  Ms. Kelly M. and Elizabeth were a pleasure to deal with, both of them was able to take care of all of my needs.  And last but not least the breakfast as well as the staff was wonderfull!!!!!!!

title: Great place to stay
review: The hotel was very clean and well maintained which is a big plus to me. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Kelly M. Was a pleasure to deal with, she was able to direct us to all the great places to go in fort Lauderdale thanks for your help.

title: Average
review: The staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean. Note that it is in the very rough part of town which I didn't like. We spent the night there before getting on a cruise ship as it is only 3 miles from the port so cost about 15 dollars by taxi to get to the port. Eat before you get there as there is no dining in the hotel except for breakfast. We had to drive ( we saw so many dodgy characters and decided not to walk) to Las Olas to dine the evening we got there, which was very nice. For those cruising, I recommend doing the ship and shore option where you pay extra 30 dollars to park your car and get it back whenever you return from the cruise and parking was secure. It helped us a lot and was the main attraction for us.

title: Nice place
review: It's a solid Hampton Inn. The front desk greeted us pleasantly and was very helpful. The rooms were very clean and the hotel was clean and updated. The breakfast area was very nice as well.

title: Very Pleased :)
review: A warm and comfortable stay!  Definitely one of the better valued hotels in Ft. Lauderdale. The rooms were clean, smelled fresh, and have great bedding, as always. The friendly staff made it inviting and were courteous throughout the entirety of our stay. Bonus: Great breakfast with a variety of options!  We would undoubtedly stay here for a return visit.

title: Best Weekend Ever
review: Hello from Sunny South Florida -   Thank-You for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am excited that you had a wonderful experience.  At the Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale we strive to exceed your expectations....    Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Downtown Fort Lauderdale!

title: Very Enjoyable Experience
review: Very nice hotel. Room was very clean and the service was fantastic. No problems with early check in and late check out. Breakfast was above average, and the hotel seemed very secure. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Good deal if you don't mind a short drive to beach and Los Olas
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale!   Thank-You for taking time to write a review -   I appreciate that you touched base on a few aspects of the hotel -  The cleanliness is above par as my Director of Housekeeping is very detailed.  The staff is great!  They work very hard to ensure our guests are Happy!   I appreciate your comments and look forward to seeing you in the near future ~

title: "LOVED IT"
review: If you are looking for a better rate than the hotels on the beach, this is the place to stay.  Free parking and just a 5 minute drive to Lauderdale beach and Los Olas.  Nicer lobby and breakfast area than most Hamptons.  Front desk staff VERY helpful, especially Kelly.

title: Short and good experience
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida -   I am delighted to hear that you had a great time at our hotel - At the Hampton Inn Downtown City Center we are centrally located to Trendy Las Olas, museums and night-life as well as Port Everglades and fortune 500 businesses ...   You are correct in saying the staff is terrific!    I appreciate your comments and look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!

title: The Staff Makes You Truly Feel Welcome
review: EVERYONE WAS EXTREMELY FRIENDLY STAFF AND GUESTS . Wish we could have stayed longer,very relaxing 4 day. Staff is very helpful with any questions you may have from where Togo for dinner or what time the cruise ships leaves AWESOME TO WATCH LEAVE.Close to everything, I would suggest renting a car , makes getting around easier parking and WiFi are FREE not like other places. Landed at 1 pm in the pools by 2 pm GREAT PLACE

title: New Years at Hampton
review: This hotel is very well kept.  I am a Hilton Honors Gold member so I tend to stay with the Hilton Family.  The breakfast is great, the rooms are clean, and the staff is very nice. The neigborhood is not the greatest but most downtown cities usually aren't.  The property is secure though!

title: Cruise Advisory
review: Greetings to one of our valued Hilton Honors Gold Guests,   Thank-You for your feedback!  I appreciate your comments on how secure our hotel is - we take pride in our hotel and our first priority is our guests.    I look forward to hosting you and your team again at The Hampton Inn City center!

title: Great place to stay.
review: My wife and I called to book a ship and shore package for our cruise in May.  We asked about tranportation to and from the port and were told that it was included along with parking at the hotel.  Upon check-in we were informed that the complimentary shuttle was only one way to the port and we would have to make alternate arrangements to get back to the hotel.  I am glad we found this out before standing around at the terminal waiting on the shuttle to pick us up after the cruise.  It should have been clearly stated when we made the reservation that transportation was only one way.  When we were told by the booking agent that transportation was included, we naturally assumed that meant both to and from Port Everglades.  Needless to say we were very dissatisfied.  Parking at the…

title: Just your average HI
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida -    I appreciate the time you took to write a review on our hotel -   I do apologize for this miscommunication.  I did look into our verbiage on our website as well as third parties to verify the accuracy and it clearly states that the service is only one way - We do this due to the fact the vast majority of guests leave for the airport directly after their cruise and with the new ships holding 5000 to 6000 passengers it is near impossible to timely transport guests back from the terminal to either the airport and or our hotel -  The Port Everglades council has allowed for hundreds of taxi's to line up for ease of disembarking passengers to be moved quickly to their next destination ...   I do appreciate your feedback and hope to see you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida,

title: Convenient to cruise port.
review: This hotel is located in a great location, close to the beach, fine dining, downtown Ft. Lauderdale and many other attractions at a very fair rate.  I was here on business and like the fact that I felt secure in this hotel.  With many Hampton properties it's come and go as you like which always makes me feel like anyone could be anyplace inside.  Not so here they make you feel safe and sound.  That being said, the rooms are comfy, clean and quiet.  The higher floors offer better views but I was on the third and no issues. The staff is very friendly and always making sure the guest is taken care of.  I'm a Diamond memeber and most locations really don't care that you travel more than you are home, but not here.  Everyone was great including the Assistant manager.  If you are…

title: Great except....
review: I booked this hotel pre cruise specifically for the parking. I called Hampton Inn on the number listed for this hotel which turned out to ne a central number not actual location. Explained I wanted to leave my car here for the week and she said no problem and I asked if there were any fees and was told no. Well upon checkin I was told it would be $10 or $15 a night for parking. They were not willing to even listen to my story and made no apologies. I called the central office and they said to pay it then send in the receipt and they would look into refunding it bc their system didn't note it was a pay lot. Other then that thinks were ok.....

title: Very Clean Hotel with Excellent Staff
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida!   I do apologize that you were given the incorrect information from Central Reservations gave you the incorrect information.  I have made contact with them to resolve for future guests ... Thank-You for sharing.   Safe Travels,

title: Horrible Experience
review: We stayed at this hotel pre and post a cruise from the port of Miami.  The beds and pillows were comfortable, the rooms were very clean.  The breakfast was excellent,fresh fruit, hot waffles, real oatmeal, and two steamers with other hot fare one morning american fries and turkey sausage and the other omelets and sausage patties.(as well as all the other usual breakfast food). The room also had a refrigerator and microwave.  They have a small convenience snack shop with that includes beer and wine as well as some frozen foods,  The pool and hot tub are outside on the second floor.  The only thing not clean was the gym, spray bottles should be provided so each exerciser can clean up after themselves.  Sweaty equipment is gross!  Everyone expect to clean up after themselves. The…

title: Nice Stay in Fort Lauderdale
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida -   Thank-You for sharing your review with us...  I have to agree our hotel is very clean and our staff is Excellent!  The staff is trained to anticipate our guests needs, exceed expectations and always go above and.  Our hotel is not the typical Hampton Inn hotel -  We are located in the heart of downtown and convenient to everything ( beaches, cruise port, hard rock cafe ) all a short taxi ride away ... and walking distance Trendy Las Olas with lots of boutique shipping and restaurants with great night life!   Hope to see you in the near future -

title: Perfect Stay
review: Aside from it being in a rough part of town and being run down and not very clean, the staff is very unhelpful. We stayed at this location because of its location in respect to the venue we were visiting that evening. It turned out to be a big mistake and cost me a lot more than the alrady high rate of $250 per night. We checked a bag in their "secured" closet and recieved a claim check for the bag. When we returned to get our bag, they didn't have it, it had been stolen by "an undisclosed third party" and hotel policy is not to compensate the guests for their loss. Apparently they turned it over to their insurance company who denied the claim, saying it was a "no fault" occurance. The hotel, after about 10 phone calls compensated us by crediting our night stay, but I am…

title: A lot more than I expected from a Hampton Inn..
review: Well first of all I wanted to jump for joy when they let us check in about 5 hours earlier than we were supposed to because we had a early flight.  There is coffee all over the hotel too, no matter what level so that helps with early flights too! The room was spacious and comfortable, bathrooms clean and stocked.  The breakfast was great and although there isn't much by the hotel, Las Olas about 10 blocks from the hotel.  Would stay here again& again!

title: Nice Hotel for an Overnight Stay
review: Hello Atlanta -   I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience - We do try to be accommodating and allow for early check-in's when available.  his allowing for you to enjoy the rest of your day!   Thank-You for your comments!   Safe Travels,

title: Great Choice!
review: Like most Hampton Inn's the one in Ft. Lauderdale downtown is nice and wll managed.  The breakfast room is open and spread out, very comfortable, the rooms are clean and well maintained.  The shuttle that the city runs through town stops right at the hotel which is great if you want to check out more of the town.  If there is one drawback to this Hampton Inn, it is the location.  It is located in kind in kind of a deserted area, there are a few small businesses around but for the most part this area of town is dead.  I arrived at night and there was really no where to go that was within walking distance (and there is no bar at the hotel).    Overall I would recommend this hotel for it's proximity to downtown and the ease of getting downtown via the shuttle, but if you are here…

title: Pleasant Hotel in DownTown Fort Lauderdale
review: Hello from Sunny South Florida  -   Thank-You for sharing your experience with us!  We do have a very clean hotel with a great staff!  As for the area,  We are right in the heart of downtown - a few blocks to the south we have Trendy Las Olas and the River front which has wonderful restaurants, boutique shopping and night life is great!    I hope to see you in the near future -   Safe Travels,

title: Decent place to stay, neighbourhood kinda run down
review: This is an excellent hotel for the price. Great value!  The staff was great and very friendly. We were traveling with small children. They were friendly and they were very accommodating.  The security at the hotel was great considering the area. We all felt very safe.  This is a good location if you have a car and need a home base for your day to day activities.  The breakfast is wonderful with something for all!  Read the other reviews  .... This is why we picked this hotel for our brief visit to Fort Lauderdale.

title: Excellent place for Pre-Cruise Night Stay
review: Comfortable room, friendly staff, easy access from FLL and to Port Everglades. Breakfast buffet in the morning with coffee, juices, make-your-own waffles, eggs, biscuits, sausage, cereals, fresh fruit. Wonderful pool on 2nd floor that was a very relaxing spot, especially late evening. Easy access to area restaurants, less than 10 miles to Hollywood Hard Rock Casino.

title: 3 Day Business Stay
review: Hello Virginia,   Thank-You for sharing your experience.  We do have a wonderful "non-typical" Hampton inn right in the heart of it all ...  Very close to the cruise port and even closer to trendy Las Olas! Hard Rock is nearby as well allowing for not only beach fun but a little night time fun as well -  Our pool deck being located on the second floor is a great spot to hand out and relax...  overlooking the Fort Lauderdale skyline and as soon as our full service bar is built ( August 2012 ) this will be a hot spot !   Thank-You for your comments on breakfast and the staff!  At Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale -  The team certainly gives 110% to make your stay relaxing and memorable!   Safe Travels,

title: Good pre curise hotel
review: Breakfast was real hot food, not the microwave type!  Staff was GREAT and helpful everytime I rounded the corner. Need room key to go over floor 2,,,,,  This is quite location for being downtown.  Not much in walking distance to eat, really need a car or the shuttle

title: Review Ft Lauderdale Downtown Hampton Inn
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   Thank-You for taking the time to review our property -  I appreciate your comments on our hearty deluxe complimentary breakfast -  We do cook the real stuff and it changes from day to day allowing for our business clientele like yourself to not become bored with the same old items ... As for the staff, they try very hard to be attentive and make your stay wonderful.  I do appreciate your comments and look forward to seeing you on a future stay -   Safe Travels,

title: staff willing to work with us
review: I searched all hotels in the Fort Lauderdale area prior to our Feb 14, 2012 cruise. Had it narrowed down to 3 and chose the Hampton Inn based on the positive reviews. We flew in a day early for our Valentine Cruise on the Carnival Miracle.  I thought there was airport shuttle to the hotel but not. They have free shuttle back to the airport. So it was a 25.00 taxi ride for 4 of us including tip. The hotel lobby was very nice and open, looked very clean. Our check in was very speedy and Kelly was the most helpful person behind the counter. She gave us info on tours, places to see and go and places to eat at. There is a free downtown trolly that will pick you up and take you to downtown, about 6 blocks. You can walk too. We ate at the Cheesecake factory for lunch. For supper we…

title: Very classy on the inside...neighbourhood....
review: We had a one night stay here, the place was beautiful. My only concern was the neighbourhood. We took a Grey Hound from Orlando and ended up walking from the station to our hotel since the cab guys didn't want to drive us for a 2 minute ride. Which I can understand from there point of view, but walking through what looked like the ghetto with all our suite cases was not cool at all. It took us 10min to reach our hotel. We checked in no problems, the front desk staff were very friendly. We got to our 11th floor (I believe) room and the room was very nice and clean(and once again I love the how they change the comforter on top too, makes me feel better about sleeping in a strange bed). So we are settling in and all of a sudden we hear police sirens, no biggy. Until we keep hearing…

title: Good jumping off point...if you have transportation.
review: Thank-You for taking the time to share your experience.  The hotel is located in a Downtown area that has a lot of colors if you will.  The Greyhound station being a 10 minute walk is a tad more colorful than where we are located.  The Hampton Inn Downtown City center is just a few blocks north of Trendy Las Olas a very hip hot spot for boutique shopping and restaurants with outdoor cafe's and a beautiful waterfront area, close to fortune 500 businesses and a $5.00 taxi ride to Fort Lauderdale Beach ...  The hotel as you mentioned in beautiful and the staff is on point ready to please.  I am delighted that you did have a wonderful time in Fort Lauderdale and loved the hotel...   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale -

title: Nice clean hotel
review: Hotel and area: This is a typical Hampton Inn, which means, by my experience, it is clean, well-run and pleasant. The area is empty at night as it is surrounded by office buildings and there are a fair number of "wanderers" at night in the area. However, property security is very good at the hotel, with locked parking levels (FREE!), room floor access only with room keys and actual security patrolling the property day and night.  It is a quick (20 minutes, on average) drive from the airport and it is easy to find. There are gas stations, at which to refuel, on the way back to the airport.  Within short drives (5-15 minutes) are: Las Olas Boulevard Galleria Mall The Beach and Atlantic Ocean!  Check-in: There is short term parking for check in and the check in process was quick…

title: Typical Hampton Inn in downtown location
review: Hello Maryland,   I must say, I think your response may just be one of my favorites!  Very detailed and accurate too...  We take pride in our property which clearly reflects in yours and many other reviews.  I appreciate your comments and hope to see you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Safe Travels,

title: Convenient, pleasurable stay
review: We spend only a few hours here post cruise.Had a 10PM flight and didn't want to hang around the airport after getting off the cruise at 10am so this hotel was the only one with vacancies at short notice.We didn't feel safe walking in the area  and as there wasn't a restaurant on site we ordered in food for lunch and dinner.Had to use room key on the outside doors and in elevator so I felt safe in the hotel. The coffee/tea station  in lobby was well stocked and there was a fridge, coffee maker, microwave in the room to  store and heat up our food.The bed was very comfortable and clean!They wash the comforters with each guest so that was the first time I didn't remove it from the bed before sleeping. Got caught up with my emails at the computer room, internet was fast and free.A…

title: I'll be back soon!
review: "I stayed in this hotel recently while I had home repairs done.  It is located right downtown near where I work.  Parking and internet access were both free in the hotel which was a huge plus- paying for these things at other hotels really racks up. The breakfast served every morning was very nice and offered anything you could possibly want.  My room was spacious and very clean.  There was a mini-fridge and microwave in the room which helped since I had to stay there for 5 days. Every staff member I came in contact with was overly friendly and eager to assist me with any requests I had.  I had some documents I needed to print off last minute before a meeting and was able to do so with no problems in the large business center located in the lobby. The front desk was also…

title: Nice friendly place
review: Hello from Sunny South Florida!   I am excited to see that you had a wonderful time in Fort Lauderdale and had a chance to experience all that the Hampton Inn City Center has to offer --  Our staff is wonderful and tries to go above and beyond to treat each guest as a VIP ... Having an onsite parking garage that is secured and complimentary allows our guests the ease of convenient covered parking in case we have a sun shower or two without the hassle of getting wet :)   Thank-You for taking the time to review the hotel -   Safe Travels and I look forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale

title: Dated property
review: Stayed at the Hampton Inn in Feb 2012. Was attending a conference at the convention centre.  Reception was very welcoming. I am a HHonors Gold member and was immediately welcomed with a drink and snack. Reception staff greeted me every time I walked past.  Room was clean and fresh. Reasonable size.  Breakfast in the morning was included and was different every morning. Don't usually have a heavy breakfast and the breakfast was more than adequate.   Surrounding area is not very exciting. Had a car so it didn't matter as I could drive around, including to the convention centre.

title: I highly recommend this location
review: I came here for work in February and found the property to be dated. The fan in my room clicked constantly and I had to shut the bathroom door to sleep at night. The rooms had a musty feeling - almost the humid quality that you'd have in an old beach house. I feel like they need to update the ventilation system so the hotel doesn't seem as musty. The hotel is not in a great area at all and I did not feel safe here at night. If I had been traveling alone, I would have felt even more uncomfortable. The front desk manager was very nice and he made the experience better.

title: Great Place to Rest Before Cruise and Leave your Car
review: Good Afternoon,   As always Hampton values our guest's comments and observations.  As you will note from the last year plus of reviews this property has made substantial strides to improve the hotel, area and staff.  We are slated to begin renovations in April including a full service bar on the second floor which will add to the many amenities that Hampton Inn already offers.  I do appreciate your feedback -   Safe Travels,

title: great place
review: Everything was top notch.  The breakfast saved us a lot of ,money.  Great pool, hot tub, and the entire staff was helpful and courteous.  I highly recommend  this hotel.

title: Satisfied Travellers.
review: Hello Hatfield, Pennsylvania,   I appreciate your feedback and you sharing your experience.  Top Notch...  That pretty much sums it up ... I will share your comments with my staff and ensure that I use it as a motivational tool.  Keep warm :)   Safe Travels,

title: DOES THE JOB!
review: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in Dec for two nights before catching a cruise. The price was $150 per night taxinc. We were satisfied with the hotel, the staff and the cleansiness of our room. The free breakfast they offer was good with a variety  of choices. They also run a free shuttle to the cruise ship port, which saves some shekels but was very crowded, make sure you leave in good time. lt rained a lot and they loaned us some umberalas which was a nice touch. The hotel is only about 2 blocks from the main bus station, from where we caught a bus to the Sawgrass Mall which is an hour away by bus. Security on the doors of the hotel and only the use of you door card would enable you to use the lift were welcome safety measures. The area around it looked a bit dodgy but there…

title: Great Experience
review: Good Morning -   Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience!  You are right! Hampton Inn's do offer a value market product.... I like to think of it as a three star price and five star service.   This particular Hampton Inn offers an attached parking garage that is secured and complimentary. As well as free Wi-Fi throughout the building, complimentary breakfast which is a full hot breakfast and a staff that is on point! Willing and ready to go out of our way to ensure you have a relaxing and pleasurable stay...   Hope to see you on your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale -

title: Great Hotel
review: We needed a hotel close to the Broward Center for Performing Arts, staying just a night in FLL before driving down to Key West. The location is very dowtown, i.e. not good for beaches, but very fine for culture, shopping and dining.  The Hampton more than serves the purpose. Not the most interesting of neighborhoods, but ample free parking, ten minutes walk to Las Olas and fifteen safe minutes to the Opera House was convenient. Good service, great rates and a well-kept room certainly will make us come back. The breakfast is not particularly good, but it is included, and of the same type/ quality as in other Hampton's. If we were staying for more than one night, The Floridian Diner is five minutes drive away, so the breakfast does not detract!

title: Prior to a cruise
review: January cruise made us think about going to Ft Lauderdale a day early incase of bad weather.  We had family members coming from northern cities and did not want anyone to have a flight cancelled. Four rooms one of them handicap, and no complaints from any of our group. Hampton Inns always have a good breakfast spread with very personable staff and this was no exception. No restaurant in the hotel so we ordered pizza, wings and salad and had them delivered. Our rooms were on the second floor, which is also where the breakfast area is located, so we pushed some tables together and made use of the coffee, plates,etc.  It worked out great! Leftover pizza went to the front desk and it was well received! There is no shuttle from the airport...about a 10 minute, $20 cab ride, but there…

title: Nice Stay before a Crusie
review: I am delighted that you chose the Hampton Inn!  The Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale we strive to make your vacation effortless and relaxing - Your home away from home.   I appreciate the time you took to write a review and share your experience!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Downtown Fort Lauderdale -

title: Affordable option in downtown FT Lauderdale
review: We recently stayed here for 1 night prior to our cruise. This is a typical Hampton property with an outstanding complimentary breakfast, free wi-fi, and a free shuttle to the cruiseport. Make sure you reserve a spot on the shuttle at check in as space fills up for the best times.    The room was a usual hampton room which is fine for one or two nights. The hampton does not try to nickel and dime you like other major hotel chains.  The front desk workers were very polite and nice. The coffee and cookies in the lobby were a nice touch. I would recommend this Hotel pre or post cruise. It is also an easy walk to Las Olas blvd where you will find plenty of restaurants and night life  Another thing I would recommend for cruise guests is to purchase the shuttle service from the…

title: Great place for a pre cruise party
review: Hello Atlanta!   I am excited that you had a great time in Fort Lauderdale and hopefully an even better time on your cruise.  You are correct in saying that Hampton Inn's do not nickel and dime you like other chains ... Our breakfast is awesome and now with a make your own waffle station.   The shuttle is complimentary and great tip about reserving a shuttle for your return to the airport! Our shuttle company now has more space so the ease of reserving a shuttle is even better!   Thanks for sharing your experience!   Safe Travels.

title: Very nice Hampton in downtown Fort Lauderdale... great location!
review: We had trouble finding an affordable hotel to stay in the downtown area. After alot of research this was definitley the best within budget. Fantastic decor. Accomodating staff. My problem with the HAmpton Inn breakfast is not exclusive to this hotel. I don't like the use of disposable plates, cutlery etc. The breakfast food however is good. And i especially like the 'make your own waffles' facility. The best thing about this hotel was an evening reception for the guests which was complimentary and provided us with free drinks (alcoholic and otherwise) as well as delicious appetizers. Free internet and printing was another plus. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

title: Great place for stay, park and cruise
