review: We stayed here before going off on a cruise.  We found the staff very helpful and friendly.  The room was clean as was the hotel. The cookies and the apples were a nice touch.  The breakfast was really very good.  We stayed in a Hampton in Orlando the previous night and thought breakfast there was good but this much better  We were able to  leave our rental car here in a secure area whilst we went on our cruise.  A shuttle to the dock was included and it was only $15 for a taxi back.  This was the first time we had driven in Fort Lauderdale and were a bit apprehensive but the drive from the turnpike to the hotel and back was really easy.   Will definitely stay here when we cruise again

title: Inexpensive, but smelled moldy.
review: I love the opportunity to connect with a guest that has had a wonderful experience and has taken the opportunity to share.  The Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale is a great location for pre-cruise ... just a short drive complimentary shuttle ride to the cruise port and you are "free sailing".   Our freshly baked warm cookies are sure to delight each guest and assist with making them feel at home ...  Thank-You for your comments and feedback!   Safe Travels,

title: Best if you have a car
review: The hotel is new (ish) and the staff is really nice and attentive. They're very inexpensive and the breakfast was surprisingly good. I've stayed there twice, and had friends stay there twice, and all four times the room smelled stale/moldy.

title: Great Affordable Hotel
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   I always welcome guest feedback as it is a way for the hotel to meet and exceed your needs in the future -  I was rather surprised to read that you had a "moldy" experience as in August and September we detailed cleaned each room including shampooing all the carpets and utilizing an ozone machine in each room.   I then noticed that you stayed in August and your trip advisor post did not hit our Trip advisor page until November....  I assure you our rooms as you will read are spectacular and very well maintained and clean ...  I would love for you to give us another chance in the future ...   Safe Travels,

title: Convenient  and comfortable
review: We stayed at this hotel before a cruise.  The primary reason, other than it was a Hampton and we love getting the points, was that they had a free shuttle to the port.  The hotel was clean, the rooms were wonderful.  It had obviously been updated recently.  The breakfast provided was just what we wanted with plenty of room to sit.  While we didn't use the pool area, it looked very inviting.   The shuttle service was exactly as they had said.  Once we checked in, they made a reservation for our party at the time we wanted.  They were easily able to accommodate 7 people and a wheelchair.  There was no charge for this, but my cousin staying did pay extra to park her car for the week. The only negative, was that there was not much within walking distance.  Luckily for us, we had…

title: Good Choice Downtown
review: We decided to stay here for three nights prior to ours cruise based on the previous reviews in TA and we were not disappointed - I would agree that the area is not the best but we walked everywhere and whilst we passed plenty of homeless persons, which surprised us, they presented no problems for us.  A ten - fifteen minute walk took us to Las Olas Blvd which provided plenty of choices of restaurants including the must visit Cheesecake Factory.  I would have no hesitation in staying here again and would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay downtown.

title: Good value
review: Hello John from Scotland,   I appreciate the time you took to write a review.  It is always wonderful to hear that a guest had a great experience and enjoyed their stay!  I am delighted that you had an opportunity to experience trendy Las Olas and the Cheesecake Factory!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Kelley

title: wonderful
review: I stayed here from 10/3-10/4/11 and would recommend this property to business travelers doing business downtown.  I appreciate the free wi-fi and free parking!  The hotel is clean and welcoming.  The fitness center had 4 precor machines including treadmill, eliptical, and 2 bikes--each with thier own tv and audio. Nice breakfast selection included.  If you are an Honors member and are not offered bottled water be sure to ask.  Also loved the fact that the Asst. GM, Kelly, was open to the feedback I provided her.   Only drawback is that there are not any restaurants within walking distance that i could tell.  Overall this hotel is a good value.

title: Location could be better
review: Hello Orlando!   Greetings from Sunny South Florida -   I am delighted that you had an outstanding experience and decided to share it with our viewer's.  We are definitely a great choice for the leisure and business traveler!  The free Wi-Fi and secured parking garage are always amenities that are certain to delight.  Our staff goes out on a limb to ensure you feel like your right at home!   Thank-You for sharing your experience!   Kelley

title: WOW  A real hidden gem!!
review: lovely hotel, large rooms, comfy beds, breakfast area excellent lots of room to sit, lovely food, lots of choice. nice and clean you need a car, to get around no places to eat close by, but no problem. parking is included in price which is a big plus, to choosing this hotel, nice view from room on the 11th floor, customer service spot on all friendly, including cleaners and porters and breakfast staff. the evening reception food mon to thur 5.30-7pm was lovely, snacks, soft drinks and beer was lovely, a nice touch. would  definitely stay here again.

title: Nice hotel but. Needs a little tweaking
review: Stayed here a week ago and all was well until our room was double booked and someone came in while we were there! Not good. Came back a week later and booked in, our room had a leaking A/C, carpet all wet and the desk chair would not rise from very low at the desk. Have to say that maintenance responded  quickly and gave us a new chair and moved us to another room But house keeping should have checked this.

title: Nice Hotel and great staff!
review: Greeting from Fort Lauderdale,   I appreciate the time you took to share your experience.  At the Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale we take the guest experience extremely serious and want nothing more to ensure that you are happy and leave a little bit more relaxed!  Please know that your comments and feedback have been used as a learning tool.   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!  Kelley

title: Kelley Malone is the reason we LOVE Hampton Inn
review: I stayed here for a night with a few friends when visiting Ft. Lauderdale. The Hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff were very personable and always willing to help, even if you and a few friends were using the hot tub late a night. We had a car so not sure if it was close to public transit but there was a small mall near by and it was a few minutes from the air port.   I was very happy with my stay here and would stay here again.

title: Absolutly fantastic, best trip so far
review: I am excited that you had a great time and fell in love with our staff!  The staff is great.... the hot tub and pool area is warm and inviting and located on the second floor which allows for the city lights in the evening - always delightful!   Thanks for taking the time to write a review and share your experience,   Kelley

title: Loved it! Great Service!
review: Kelley Malone deserves to be in a location where families can benefit from the overall Hampton Inn experience and the company's message.  We celebrated my mom's 70th birthday here and Kelley went above and beyond to make sure our stay was worthwhile.  The location of the hotel was not working for us....this establishment is more for business endeavors...however, Kelley made it a valuable experience.  This hotel does the little extras that make you feel your money was well spent....such as the home baked cookies every day at 4 pm.....I raved about them and Kelley had a whole box waiting for me in the room the next day....she's the best!

title: Family had a great time in Fort Lauderdale and at this hotel
review: On a recent family get away to Fort Lauderdale we stayed at this hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Added bonus was the welcome reception during the week. Free wine and beer - a treat for mom and dad! We would stay here again.

title: Absolutely incredible.  We plan to return.
review: Hello from Sunny South Florida -   Glad you had a wonderful family vacation!  We take pride in the hotel and train our staff to always go above and beyond and treat our guests like family.  As for the cleanliness the housekeeping team is outstanding and picky!  They love to ensure that you are happy as do I !   Thank-You for taking the time to share your experience!  See you next time you are in Sunny South Florida -

title: Loved It!
review: We were very pleased with our rooms.  The staff were so helpful.  They even suggested places to dine and provided us with directions

title: Loved it !!!!!!
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale!   It is always nice to hear that you had a great experience! I am delighted that the staff was helpful and assisted you in finding restaurants and things to do in the area!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale

title: well recomend it to family and friends
review: Downtown Ft.Lauderdale was such a hard place to find a hotel in and I finally came across the this one and it was almost if it was meant to be! The hotel was very nice, clean, and minutes from all the fun stuff you can imagine. The hotel staff was courteous and some of the nicest people I have ever met in Florida. I believe the girl at the front desks name was Dawn, who helped my family and I get checked in swirly and let us know on some of the great places to visit in the area. She was a pleasant employee and The hotel was just as pleasant to stay in. If visiting South Florida defiantly pick this hotel.

title: GREAT PLACE!!!
review: My girlfriends and I had our 50th birthday celebrations here...we would come back in  a heartbeat!! The hotel was very clean and the personnel was very friendly...Dawn Bury at the front desk was especially helpful and I'd like to extend a personal thank you to her. I will definitely recommend your place to my friends and family!!

title: Excellent location, security, and staff
review: Happy belated Birthday!   I am delighted that you chose us to spend your Birthday with ...  Dawn is one of our newest team members and we love her!  Dawn displays the meaning of hospitality - goes out of her way to make each guest happy and obviously left you with a memory.  Thank-You for the kind words...   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!

title: Great hotel
review: I appreciated the secure, covered, free parking. Breakfast was good. Very clean bedding. Quiet. Free wireless internet.  Not a vacation ocean view, but an excellent downtown hotel.

title: Very Friendly Staff!
review: I appreciate your review ...  We are an excellent downtown property located directly in the heart of Fort Lauderdale.  The hotel is quiet and the second floor pool adds a little serenity to your stay.  Thank-You for commenting on the wireless it is free and rather quick as well (recent upgrade in the works)  Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale!

title: Not a bad little place
review: I stayed here recently with my boyfriend and had a great experience. The people at the front desk were very helpful and nice. The room was clean and spacious with a comfortable "heavenly" bed (as they call it) and fluffy pillows. They give you a laptop desk along with the actual desk which is helpful for two people with laptops. On the side of the desk there are lots of outlets, also very helpful for people that have lots of devices to charge!  The shower nozzle has several settings on it for more or less pressure which is great for when you need to get all the sweat, sunscreen, and seawater out of your hair or need to be gentle on your sunburned skin! The sink area has lots of space for toiletries.  The hotel has a few parking spots around back but the majority of the parking…

title: Great experience, but a little pricey
review: I was very happy with my experience at this hotel.  Check-in process was quick and parking is free.  It was difficult to open the door to my room on the 11th floor - you had to basically throw yourself at the door.  The room itself was fine - nothing was broken and everything was clean.  I slept just fine (no loud noises, comfortable bed).  The hotel offers complimentary breakfast, which is nice.  There are breakfast bags that people who are on-the-go can grab.  However, there wasn't a lot of options for vegetarians (high sugar cereals, yogurt, fruit of poor quality).  I loved that coffee/tea/hot chocolate stations are available 24/7 on the 1st and 2nd floor, and there are sometimes cookies in the lobby.

title: hotel was clean and affordable and the service was excellent.
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   I am very excited that you decided to share your experience with all of our future travelers!  We at the Hampton Inn City Center strive to always treat you like your at home with memorable service with a warm relaxed feel –  I have addressed your minor issue you had with the door opening not as easily as it should have ( you were right! ) Thanks for letting us know - It’s been addressed!  We add a bit of “Hamptonality “to our service which is always certain to leave you with a smile and time to relax and enjoy all that Fort Lauderdale has to offer!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Safe, secure, free parking
review: The service, price and room were all excellent and although it's a little off the beaten path was worth it and i'd definitely stay there again.

title: Wonderful stay, Safe
review: Greetings from Sunny South Florida,   I am very excited that you decided to share your experience with all of our future travelers!  We at the Hampton Inn City Center strive to always treat you like your at home with memorable service with a warm relaxed feel -  We add a bit of " Hamptonality " to our service which is always certain to leave you with a smile and time to relax and enjoy all that Fort Lauderdale has to offer!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny Fort Lauderdale!   Safe Travels,

title: Great hotel, especially for cruise travelers
review: The hotel is as promised.  It is a nice Hampton Inn with a few extra touches.  The two bed room is queen beds, which are always appreciated over double beds.  There is a manager's reception on M-W which serves snacks, wine, beer, and soft drinks.  The pool is small, but nice to sit out on.  The breakfast was varied and better than the last Hampton Inn we stayed at.  This one had little boxes of cereal, instant oatmeal, in addition to the hot breakfast item, bagels, waffles, and fruit.  The parking was secure in a garage.  The workout room was large and sufficiently equipped.  The hotel is in an industry area, within walking distance of the Las Olas Boulevard, however, I wasn't sure if it was safe to walk to the few blocks and instead we drove.  This area of town has many…

title: Excellent value.
review: Have stayed here many, many times.  Great value, good rooms, good location (you probably need a car, but who doesn't in FL), godo check-in service, free wifi, free breakfast.  Overall, always enjoy staying here.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Thank-You for your review of the property. I agree with you, Hampton Inn as a whole = value.  The thing that makes The Hampton Inn City Center stand out is our attached parking garage that has complimentary parking while you are a guest at the hotel and our manager’s reception that offers hearty appetizers Monday - Thursday and complimentary Beer, wine and soda.  I am delighted that you had another wonderful experience!   Safe Travels,

title: Couldn't get any better than this
review: We stayed and the Hampton Inn for two nights (Thursday & Friday) prior to boarding a cruise ship.  We arrived quite late but made to feel very comfortable by the staff.  One very positive we discovered was the small "mini mart" in the lobby.  After our long flight we bought a bottle of wine to enjoy in the room and wind down. Our King Deluxe room was very clean and other than the emergency vehicle sirens was very quiet.  The hotel was sold out both nights so one would expect the breakfast buffet area to be totally jammed.  However, it is quite large and there were always tables available.  This may have been because some guests chose to eat outside by the pool but the staff cleaned tables very quickly when people got up making room for newcomers.  A very well done by the very…

title: Great Service
review: Hello from Sunny Fort Lauderdale,   I am thrilled that you had the opportunity to experience our hotel first hand! It truly is a hidden gem... I appreciate your comments on the staff being friendly and energetic and the breakfast standing out and meeting your needs.  The Sun Trolley which you mentioned makes getting around the Downtown area effortless and simple!  I will pass your comments on to my staff -   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale! I hope your cruise was amazing and you made beautiful memories~   Safe Travels,

title: Good Value
review: I travel for business every week and visit this location often. Great hote, rooms are always perfect, staff is amazing and always go out of there way for the guests. Good location.

title: ok, but no shuttle pickup and dont use their computers!
review: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Plantation pre-cruise and just loved it. So, we stayed an extra day after wards in Fort Lauderdale, and decided to stay closer to downtown this time. They say they have shuttle.... Well, they do not do pick up from cruise line... (they drop off, you would think they can pick up while there!)  And they do not do shuttle to the airport!  So, $20 from cruise port for cab, and another $25 to the airport. There was only two things that I looked for while booking: shuttle and breakfast.  Breakfast was good. Like others have said, the bed looks very lumpy but it was comfortable.  But, don't use their computer. I used it to check into our flights and decided to check my email while there. It was hacked, and everyone in my gmail addressed book got spamed.…

title: Pleasant one night stay
review: Thank-You for taking the time to write a review. I always value the opportunity to learn from our guest’s feedback... I would like to address the shuttle comment - Being that we are not an airport hotel we do not have a shuttle from the airport   - However, just a short taxi ride               (4 miles)  you are right in the heart of downtown to experience all it has to offer!  Trendy Las Olas, The river front, museums , performing arts center  and much much more  -  As for pick up from the cruise port ... With 3000 -4000 passengers disembarking from the ship there is no possible way that a shuttle that holds 10 passengers would be affective or comfortable to the guest ...  Taxi's are a dime a dozen at the cruise port and makes it an easy transition for passengers that want to get back to the airport and quickly zoom back to the hotel ... I do apologize for any convenience. Our goal is to make things as easy for you – our guest -  As for the computers ... I have to advise that you look at other areas that you may have used the computer... With any Hilton property the computers are protected and secured while you are online and delete out all cookies and history once you are offline.  I do apologize and understand the frustration you must have had    - But I can honestly say that this is not due to our computers at the hotel.  I do hoe you had a wonderful cruise and have many memories that you will cherish for years to come!  Safe Travels,

title: Not in safe location
review: Room not ready upon arrival so we walked a few blocks to Riverwatch.  Received call on cell phone that we could check in.  Appreciated the free parking but really required close attention using the narrow winding entrance to park.  Security precautions were evident in the use of key to use elevator and guard outside of hotel.   All areas of the hotel were clean and well maintained.  The bed was comfortable and the room quiet.  The only thing lacking was electrical outlets.  No place to plug in charger or hair dryer except in the bathroom.   The breakfast area was nicely laid out with the standard breakfast options.  We especially like the choice of a robust coffee.  For an in city, short term stay we were very satisfied.

title: Great Pre -Cruise stay
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale!   I am delighted that you had a wonderful stay!  My staff takes pride in   going above and beyond and making you feel like you’re at home and special to us.... We love having you here!  Having the time to walk just a few short blocks to The riverfront and trendy Las Olas is always a delight and a pleasant way to relax, take photo's and take in all that Fort Lauderdale has to offer!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Sunny South Florida!   Safe Travels,

title: A  SYNOPSIS  OF  THE  IDEAL  GETAWAY  VACATION
review: Stayed at this hotel 1 night pre cruise with a group.  Not in a good area - fed the homeless across the street in the parking lot on Saturday night.  We had a purse snatched from a woman on the steps at the main entrance to the hotel.  Hotel had no security.  ed Wait15 minutes for police to show (they did seem to catch the guy).  Choose a hotel in a safer location.  Also it has no restaurant, and closes one is several blocks away.

title: Good spot in downtown area
review: We spent one night at this hotel in order to catch a flight the next morning.  The hotel is convenient to the airport and a short drive to the beaches.  If you are hoping to spend a lot of time at the beach, you may want to look at hotels that are walking distance to the waterfront area.  The hotel does have a nice pool area, and offers free parking in a secure garage.  The only downsides are that the hotel hallways and rooms  felt a little dated compared to newer Hampton Inns (such as the new Hampton Inn in Homestead/Miami South), and the housekeeping staff didn't do as good of a job cleaning the room as I have experience at other Hampton Inns.  This hotel recently started offering a nice complimentary late afternoon happy hour and snacks  in the breakfast area, although not…

title: Pre JamCruise!
review: Greeting from South Florida,   I am delighted to hear that you had a wonderful visit to the Hampton Inn Downtown Fort Lauderdale! We are located right in the heart of downtown which makes it easy for travelers to stroll to trendy Las Olas to shop or choose one of the amazing resturants... take a walk by the water from and the perefct location to stay the night before your cruise!  You are correct ... We did just begin a Managers reception in the evenings... Just a little something to Thank our guests for choosing us!  This is offered Monday - Thursday 5:30pm - 7:00pm ... Hope to see you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale,  Safe Travels,

title: The most welcoming and comfortable hotel I've stayed in for quite some time.
review: This hotel and all of its staff was incredible, it was beautiful, comfortable and very accomidating.  A wonderful lady in particular, Kelley M..., shoot I know there are two kelley's, ths one that recently transferred from Asheville was wonderful.  We were a big group and a celebrating group at that, (which is my nice way of saying we are fun but could be mistaken as a pain in the you know what) and she bent over backwards for us to make sure we had everything we needed or desired. Thank you so much Kelley!  I left your card in my fiance's wallet and unfortunatley we live in different towns, sorry about the spelling and not knowing your last name. Thank you thank you thank you! Even IF the rest was bad, which it wasn't, I would come back to this hotel just for her! Mo

title: An Oasis in the desert!
review: I am delighted that you returned to the hotel from 2009...  As you noticed the hotel has made wonderful changes to both the hotel in it's standards as well as the staff! I appreciate the time you took to comment on the hotel and my outstanding Assistant GM!  I look forward to seeing you all on your next PreJam Cruise get-a-way!   Safe Travels,

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: I travel a lot and stay at a variety of hotels.  The Hampton Inn Downtown stood above the rest.  It was a very convenient location for downtown, easy to get to the port and airport, and really comfortable.  Most places have the usual amenities: tv, cable, internet, fridge, microwave, etc etc but the hospitality and very professional staff were magnificent.  The free happy hour was a great surprise and the cordial and able staff and pleasant interior design all contributed to a wonderful stay.  I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone traveling to Fort Lauderdale, whether for a quick in and out while going on a cruise or staying for an extended business stay.

title: in praise of Kelly Matera, assistant general manager
review: Hampton Inn in Fort Lauderdale's downtown City Center is a hidden gem, and one of the biggest reasons is because of its asst. general manager, Kelly Matera.  She was absolutely professional, resourceful, and attentive, as our party had a scheduling snafu and there were not enough rooms available for all of us.  Ms. Matera took it upon herself to contact the internet travel booking agent and find us another room of comparable price for New Year's Eve downtown Fort Lauderdale, while securing two rooms for us at the Hampton Inn with queen-sized beds.  Had a wonderful stay in Ft Lauderdale, due in large part to her efforts.

title: 5.0 star Service at a 3.0 star price!
review: Hau`oli Makahiki Hou  -   There is nothing better then receiving a glowing review on one of my staff members!  Kelly is a true asset to our company and is always willing to go above and beyond to assist guests in efforts to make their stay memorable!!   Safe Travels,

title: Still a great choice
review: This has got to be one of Fort Lauderdale's best kept secrets! My husband, our son and my mother all stayed in one very spacious hotel room before setting sail on a cruise ship for the holidays . The staff is so friendly and goes above and beyond the call of duty to help you with any and everything.   The hotel has a Trolley stop right outside their front door and a city bus terminal a couple of blocks away. This was really convenient and saved us a ton of money in cab fare. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the hotel decor incredible. Their website photos don't do this property justice.  This hotel does not have room service but that does not stop them from providing food service to your room. we were offered several menus to choose from and we ordered…

title: Friendly staff - clean room - everything worked!
review: Thank-You for an outstanding review and all of your very kind comments....  We have to agree with you that are " Hidden Gem and a well kept secret " .. But, with enduring reviews like yours the word will get out for sure!!  At the Hampton Inn City Center we pride ourselves on FIVE STAR SERVICE at a three star price!!!    Safe Travels,

title: Great boutique hotel
review: I returned to this hotel again this Christmas.  This time I stayed for 5 days.  It was very nice.  Positives:  Free and secure parking in a downtown location; convenient location; nice breakfast; clean room; friendly staff.  Negatives:  Security in the hotel needs to be improved.  Not sure if there is a night watch person, but there should be.  I had two separate issues with people who should not have been in the hotel.

title: Nice!
review: Really nice hotel with free parking.      Probably the only complaint was that the wall A/C unit blew into the curtains so it was really hard to keep the light out in the morning.

title: Good value
review: Thank-You for sharing your experience with our future travelers!  We do have a wonderful location and a four story secured parking garage that is attached to our hotel that is complimentary!  Which assists in our mission of making your vacation effortless... allowing for a bit more “you " time to relax.... I did notice your comment about the AC blowing the curtain’s... we have installed a deflector that will prevent this from occurring in the future -   Thanks again for your feedback!   Safe Travels,

title: Best Place to Stay in Ft Lauderdale Best Breakfast, People and walking Distance to everything
review: We stayed here pre-cruise using Hilton Honors points.  I was a little concerned because of previous reviews that the hotel is in a bad part of town.  What we found was that it's in a part of town that has nothing around at night or on the weekend.  So, we just had the front desk call a cab when we wanted to go out, which worked fine.  The hotel itself is nice. The front desk folks were very pleasant, and our room was large, airy, and clean.  Although they don't have room service, they do have a contact with an Italian restaurant that delivers, and we thought the food was great.  The breakfast was more than generous, with both hot and cold items.  We would have no hesitation in staying here again.  It would have been easier with a car, though.

title: Great Pre-Cruise Stay!!!
review: Greeting from Sunny and warm South Florida!!    Thank-You for sharing your experience...  Our breakfast is a great amenity and our rooms are spacious and clean -  and I appreciate you noticing!  We are only a $5 taxi ride from all Fort Lauderdale has to offer!  Trendy Las Olas is just three blocks from the hotel with great shopping and fantastic restaurants.  The Beach is a short drive down Las Olas - A perfect way to start or end your day!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!  Safe Travels.

title: Excellent Place to Stay!!!
review: If your looking for a place to stay, this is the place. the price is right and the best part of that is the place is so nice, the people go out of there way to help in anything you need, the breakfast is a real breakfast, not a continental and the bagel with the egg,cheese and bacon on it and melted is the best. along with all the other selections they have. Hot tea and coffee all day and night,  cookies in the afternoon and apples, walking distance to the Riverfront/Las Olas Area and many other things. internet room for you, and a really really nice thing they do if you are going on a cruise they shuttle you there for free. All i can say this is the place to stay and they have brought back service to the hotels how it use to be. Other places need to take lessons from this…

title: I went back, nuff said
review: Stayed at the Hampton for the second time. As with the first time, the hotel does what it says, provides good clean accommodation, with friendly helpful staff. I was amazed there seemed to be no staff left from the previous visit, but as with all this chain, the staff were well trained and knew how to provide hospitality. Sitting out by the pool in the evening working (as the broadband extended that far easily) was a real bonus.  If you want a hotel local to Las Olas Boulevard (where you will find plenty of restaurants etc) and the water taxis down to the marina, this is a great place to stay.  Be warned though, this hotel does not do lunch or dinner, not that you would want it with downtown Fort lauderdale just a $5 taxi ride away.

title: solo101   Excellent staff,welcome me with a smile and willing to meet my every need
review: Greeting from Fort Lauderdale!...  I appreciate the time you took out of your schedule to give us your feedback!!  There have been a lot of positive changes at the hotel ( Thanks for noticing! ).  We have raised the bar of expectations and hired the " right " talent to provide the service you are looking for...   I to love the pool deck!!  Located on the second floor away from all the hustle and bustle ... with wireless service makes for the perfect opportunity to catch up on some emails and relax with a glass of wine ( a taste of vacation and work at the same time! ).   Safe Travels and looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Las Olas!!

title: Convenient downtown hotel with accomodating staff.
review: This is truly a hidden gem. The price was affordable.Staff appears to be happy and willing to be of service. Breakfast was hot and staff helpful with a smile. My experience @ the Hampton Inn Downtown was great..Also I was booked for transfer to the cruise port, this was done on time with expertise. I want to thank you for your service.Thanks to all staff members

title: TRULY A HIDDEN GEM!!!!
review: Thank-You for taking the time to comment on your wonderful experience!!  Our staff truly enjoys their position which shows to each and every guest ... I love hearing that the staff is " Exceptional"  ... The hotel is located in a great location with complimentary shuttle service to Port Everglades .. Just one more amenity to make your stay and vacation effortless and memorable!   Looking forward to seeing you on your next trip from SC to Florida!

title: Great Location for Downtown Ft lauderdale.
review: Stayed here for a few days while on a business trip to Fort Lauderdale.The hotel is conveniently located downtown, very close to Las Olas blvd. and not too far from the beach. Very nice pool area with plentiful poolside seating. Great breakfast buffet with large area to sit and enjoy your breakfast. Convenient snack bar at front desk stocked with wine and beer and the ever famous hampton cookies hot and ready for you on arrival.Rooms were a good size with small convenient fridge, bed was more than adequate.I used the fitness area every day and although it is not huge it has the main equiptment that you would need for a cardio workout.Good value for a Fort Lauderdale hotel.

title: Excellent Customer Service and Satisfaction
review: Just a short note to express our appreciation for a excellent stay at your Hampton Inn. My wife and I arrived on  Oct 8, 2010 and Oct 14, 2010, and was greeted by a very warm and caring staff, who made us feel welcomed as we hit the lobby with a big Hellllloooo's and smile's, they showed enthusiasm and expressed real "Customer Satisfaction & Service".         The accommodations were excellent and we found your facility very neat and clean. We will be sharing this information with family and friends and you can count on us returning.                                                                            Pat & Peg Woods

title: Last Minute Legal
review: Hellllloooo's and smile's are what we are all about!!   At Hampton Inn Downtown City Center we love hearing that our team showed enthusiasm and expressed real "Customer Satisfaction & Service".  Having a great staff that shows a sincere passion for their position and their guests as experienced during your stay can make the world of difference!   At Hampton - We love having you here!!    Looking forward to seeing you on your next visit to Fort Lauderdale -

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN DOWNTOWN FT LAUDERDALE
review: Being a lawyer is difficult.  Last minute out of state trips are part of that difficulty.  I work for an insurance company and often between the accident in question and start of litigation, our clients move.  Mine moved to Ft. Lauderdale, so off I went to depose her for trial.    I got in late at night, had to leave for deps early in the morning.  The staff were kind and helpful.  The room was crisp and clean and a COMPLETE refresher afterthe flight and a NIGHTMARE deposition. The 24 hour business center was a GODSEND and if I couldn't find something - the staff practically RAN to find it for me.  Would DEFINITELY stay there again.

title: Home away from home...but quiet :)
review: Hello from Sunny Fort Lauderdale!  I am excited that even with your whirlwind schedule you took a moment to review the hotel!  The staff strives every day with every guest to make your stay memorable.  I appreciate the comments regarding the staff's professionalism and how the Hampton Inn City center is located conveniently to all the law offices and court house's .  I have extended a legal rate for all attorney's in our reservations system .. be certain to check it out on your next stay!

title: We loved it
review: The staff and facility at the Hampton Inn Center City in Ft Lauderdale are very impressive. The hotel is located right in downtown in short walking distance to business and entertainment. Security is very good.One thing I really like was the parking garage next to the motel connects, so if you are staying on the 3rd floor, you just park on the 3rd level of the garage and walk straight across to the rooms. All covered walking, so weather is not a concern. The complimentary breakfast was better than average with a member of management circulating around make sure everything needed was avaiable and all visitors were comfortable. I would not stay anywhere else in Ft Lauderdale.

title: Wonderful!
review: I visited this hotel for the first time this past August on a business trip & loved it.  The staff was very friendly & helpful.  I wasnt familar with the area & the front desk gave me wonderul recommendations.    My room was also a delight.  It was very clean & had everything I needed.  The bed was also wonderful.  I asked for information about purchasing one because I loved it so much.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  It was one of the best hotels I've stayed at in a while!

title: Impressed
review: Greetings from Fort Lauderdale!  I am always excited to have someone that has never stayed here before and leave a loyal Hampton Inn guest!  The staff at the Hampton Inn City center prides itself on taking care of the guest and making each guest feel special!  The cleanliness at the hotel is held to extremely high standards and I appreciate the guests that take notice!  I am thrilled you had a wonderful experience and I am looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!  Safe Travels -

title: Great place to stay
review: I have been at this hotel in the past and I must say that the hotel, staff and location are delightful.  Perfect for my needs. Thank-You

title: Sold on Hampton Inn....
review: Thank-You for taking the time to review the hotel -  It is great hearing positive feedback after all the wonderful changes we have made at the hotel !!  Glad you had a pleasant experience ... Looking forward to seeing you on your return to Fort Lauderdale!

title: Comfortable with an accomadating staff.
review: The room was spacious and very clean! The font desk staff were very helpful and professional. When we visit Ft. Lauderdale, I'll stay at the Hampton Inn.

title: Would recommend for weekend trip downtown
review: Went in April, rooms were very clean, bed was great, walking distance to everything good downtown, and i didnt hear any noise sleeping

title: Bad area and unsafe hotel rooms.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write such an outstanding contribution. Thank you for mentioning the hotel staff and superb attention.  Warm Regards, Kelley Malone

title: Room smelt bad and had no opening window
review: This is my second time at this hotel and I will not stay here again.  I travel often for business and look for a clean, safe, reasonably priced hotel.  This place is located several blocks from the main business district in a very rough neighborhood.  DO NOT walk unless it is in a group and you don't mind being bumped and panhandled on the sidewalk.  The homeless sleep in a park two blocks away.  My second night at the hotel, I came back to my room and the door was open.  The room across the hall also was open when the couple came in after dinner.  Apparently, the maid forgot to shut the rooms after cleaning them.  The next day, I came back in the middle of the day to change clothes.  When I went into the room, I just threw the safety lock on, but didn't lock the dead bolt. …

title: Great, safe & local restaurants close by
review: Thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review. Thank you for mentioning the friendly staff service and the welcoming lobby. We are embarrassed by the service which you encountered through out the property and have utilized your feedback to improve our property. We would love to have you back to regain your trust in our brand. Warm Regards,...

title: Disappointing, overpriced hotel with smelly rooms, people dossing outside at night and a distance from restaurants.
review: We arrived here for a second week in Fort Lauderdale, having previously stayed at the Hilton Fort Lauderdale Beach Resort. We expected this hotel to be of a lower standard than the Hilton, but we didn't imagine it would be this bad. First impressions of the hotel weren't too bad. The check-in staff were friendly, and the lobby looked ok. However, when exiting the lift, everything looked very shabby. The carpets are very outdated, and the ice machine outside our hotel room was incredibly noisy. When we opened the door to our room, we were hit by a horrible musty smell. The air conditioning was on full, but we couldn't tell if this was making the smell better or worse. We desperately wanted to open a window for some fresh air, but the window was non-opening. The room was very…

title: We felt like queens
review: My sister and I stayed at the Hampton Inn for a "Girl's weekend" - We LOVED it!  We had one of those exit guide magazines that you pick up at a rest area, with walk-in hotel deals.  We live near Orlando and decided to just drive off to Fort Lauderdale and find a place to stay when we got there.  Using the exit guide, we started out near the beach and checked out a few local hotels, as well as national chains.  They seemed either a bit seedy, lacked parking, or not really safe for 2 "girls" traveling alone.  We drove up a little ways into town and tried the Hampton Inn near Las Olas.  Got a room right away and no trouble for the coupon.  Our room was amazing!  We felt like queens!  Two big, fluffy beds with about a million pillows and a luxurious bathroom.  We could walk to the…

title: Great Location, great value, nice hotel
review: I really liked staying here.  The location was excellent.  Now, I wouldnt roam around the area at night alone, but it was great during the day.  I could walk down to Riverfront and the shops at Las Olas.  It was a short drive to the beach and to the clubs and fabulousness that is Wilton Manors.   I liked the security, the free secured parking, the room was pretty nice (no fancy flat screen yet like other Hamptons) but a nice bed.  The price was much lower than any other comparable hotel in the area.  I paid under $100/ night in FL on Christmas with a free breakfast and free parking and free wifi.  The breakfast crew was fun and great.  The front desk crew was fun and helpful.  I stayed there for 2 nights and enjoyed it.

title: Just OK
review: The lobby and other public areas are above average for a Hampton Inn. The rooms are rather small. Our first room on the 4th floor was yucky. The tub had been painted with a white paint???...and it wasn't a good paint job....very odd. The bathroom wallpaper is very busy. I love bright colors, but it is a little too much when trying to apply makeup.  The bathrooms could use a little updating. The biggest problem was stained sheets with dark hair in them. I am blond...not mine. :( Our second room,which we had to move to because Houskeeping was already gone for the day and couldn't change the sheets ,was a little better. Of course, I was worn out by this time, because I had unpacked already in the other room, and had to pack it all up and move. This room had hair in the bathroom and…

title: Possibly the best Hampton anywhere
review: I'm a big Hampton fan. Simple, clean, efficient, and no nickle-and-dime-ing like flagship brands. This property tops the list of Hamptons. Extremely friendly, accommodating and professional staff. Convenient and easy to find location. 10 minutes from airport, 10 from beach. Free parking. Well appointed rooms. Big screen TV and a rolling workstation! Breakfast was a little hit-or-miss: First day, stellar. Second day, a Saturday morning, not so stellar. But still adequate. Will make it a point to use this hotel whenever I do biz again in Fort Lauderdale.

title: Pleasantly Pleased
review: I travel often and normally do not write reviews:  However, with the downturn of the economy we (my company and I) have chosen limited service hotels rather then full service for obvious reasons.  I have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past “stuck in a sense."   This past time it was different, my dry cleaning was delivered to my room prior to my arrival or me having to call three times and in the end go down stairs and get it myself, my room keys were ready for me upon my arrival and the staff had a renewed sense of expecting my needs as if I was a VIP.   Kudos to the new owner!

title: I keep coming back
review: I have stayed at this hotel a lot (maybe 6-8 times?) I love it and continue to return.  For those of you who are familiar with Hampton, it is what you would expect. Lobby is fine, the staff is generally nice, the exercise room and business center are as they usually are at Hamptons… good, nothing too fancy but good enough to fit your needs.  I don’t typically eat breakfast bit from what I saw it looked good.   I can’t say the rooms are spectacular as I have stayed at Hamptons that had better beds, cleaner rooms etc not that there is anything wrong with these rooms, they are just older.   (I have also stayed at much worse).   With everything I said above, I would rate this hotel a 3 BUT in my opinion the location is fantastic. They don’t charge anything extra for parking which is…

title: THIS IS THE BEST HOTEL I EVER STAYED AT WITHOUT A DOUBT
review: If you are looking  for a hotel where you will get treated like Family  this is the  one for you . All the staff from the manager to the desk clerk  and the ladies serving the full breakfast  and I do mean Full there were many choices.  and you can even sit outside and eat . I  was alone and I was worried about security but not there. I Liked the fact that you needed your room key to get in to the elevator so people could  not just get in on any floor that were not staying at the hotel  that made me feel safe . I liked that they had a business center that was available 24 hour also not like other hotels that charge you by the hour to use there computer  and a $1.00 to print a boarding pass .location was great for me i walked every where and also took the water taxi  which was a…

title: Loved the hotel and especially the service.
review: We enjoyed three days with 12 family and friends. This was a family reunion which was to board a cruise ship after the third day at hotel.  All the hotel staff was kind and helpful. Very friendly and ready to assist your every need. I must mention that on the third day we left to board cruise ship in Miami when my wife realized she left a garment bag at hotel. Unfortunately, we were on our way to Jamaica. I talked with hotel staff who coordinated storing our items and then getting them to us when we returned. I must say if you ever want a nice stay with friendly staff, stay here. Just ask for JP, hes's great!

title: Cheap and cheat
review: They charged me the full amount without warning me by email or by phone even if I didn't go. They din't send any confirmation by email and charged you anyay. They are crook.

title: excellent location and clean rooms
review: service is excellent, smoking rooms very clean and confortable, very good location near nightlife area, I liked best the security and privacy of the hotel

title: Excellent customer service
review: I've always received excellent customer service at the Hampton Inn Downtown with very prompt attention to any issues or questions I've had

title: The ideal stay for downtown Fort Lauderdale.
review: This hotel was an unexpected stop for us.We needed to be in an area where we were in close proximity to places to eat and of interest.We were very lucky to find The Hampton! We stayed for ten nights and I have to say didnt regret one!. The room had two Queen beds and the linen lived up to The Hamptons boast of quality. We were without transport and relied on cabs and later public transport which although I am sure amazed and bemused the hotel staff we found good, cheap and interesting.The Sun Trolley which is a free service by Broward County runs right by the door of the hotel and the drivers were very helpful. The Bus Terminal is a short walk away and you can go literally anywhere for peanuts.Amtrak is also on this route so the worlds your oyster.There is Las Olas Blvd which…

title: GREAT HAMPTON INN....THE BEST
review: TO PILAR Group Sales & Meetings Manager  Hampton Inn Fort Lauderdale – Downtown / City Center   We want to thank you many times for such a wonderful stay at the HAMPTON and all the attention from your staff. We had about 70 rooms for our event for the 3rd. year now   The Group Sales & Meeting Manager  was the most elegant, patient, helpful in every details answering to all our questions always smiling and willing to help and to adjust…..  Before the Event, PILAR called us a few times to reconfirm all reservations. She had the patience to go through one by one and we felt very good and comforted by such a service to make sure that all was under control.  At all moment, she was an outstanding professional giving us all the support, and certainly she went beyond and beyond our…

title: My home away from home
review: I've been staying at this for business travel hotel for the past three years. Although it's in downtown Ft. Lauderdale, it has more secure parking than most of the other hotels in the area. The hotel is also close to many good restaurants, however what I enjoy most is that the employees at the front desk always make me feel welcome on my return visits. It's good seeing the same people! Keep up the good work!

title: Fantastic hotel - the staff and just wonderful!
review: I stay at this hotel fairly frequently and have always had a great stay!  The staff (especially Marife and Jossi) are so accomodating, and always ensure the time spent at the Hampton is memorable.  Good location, nearby to plenty of bars and restaurants. Its impossible to fault this hotel, and I'd certainly always stay here when i head to FL.

title: Great Escape in Ft Lauderdale!
review: live in Seattle ,WA and Fort Lauderdale was my primary destination for spring break fun and sun.  I was amazed that this hotel was a Hampton since it looked like a full-service hotel from the outside.     The rooms were just perfect—complete with a microwave, refrigerator, coffeemaker, free wi-fi, and a flat screen tv for viewing pleasure.  WOW!  I did not have to pay extras for the extras.  Usually, I prefer the Marriotts but if other Hamptons were like this – I will be staying at Hamptons more often.     This hotel also offered trolley service into the downtown area.  If you take the trolley, just make sure to tell the driver where your destination is otherwise you will be riding the trolley on a complete route.  It wasn’t bad though since I got a tour of the downtown area! …

title: Great!
review: We were only there for one night but everything was great!

title: This is a top notch business class hotel
review: I am a regular customer. I travel for my job and am in Ft Lauderdale several times a year. I choose this Hampton for it's central location, it's friendly and helpful staff, and the many amenities they offer.It is a clean, safe and very well managed operation.  I would never hesitate to recommend the Hampton City Center to friends and family on vacation, or to customers and associates traveling on business.

title: staying at the hamptons ft. lauderdale is like coming home
review: The Hamptons at Ft. Lauderdale for me is a very pleasant experience whether it is the management or the domestic staff everyone is friendly & you feel like you are returning to see friends. The rooms are pleasant & spacious, the food court is very functional & suits my busy life style whilst i am staying in the hotel. Easy access to all of the facilities within the city, although it helps if you have your own transport. Ft. Lauderdale has everything you need, i have been visiting on business trips now for almost 7 years, its friendly, easy to get around, the restaurants, shops & amenities are great, you feel safe, even if my business is in Miami i would rather stay in Ft. Lauderdale.

title: This is the best hotel in the country for me and my money.
review: I have stayed at this hotel many times and the staff is wonderful.  I travel often but rest and relax the best here.  I always feel cared for and safe.  It is clean, pleasant and has all of the amenities.  Plus, the staff always goes the extra step for guests.

title: They make me feel at home.
review: The staff at the hotel are what make the difference.  They make it a point to remember you and most often by name.  The entire staff acknowledge you with a smile even if you are just walking by.  The rooms are always clean and the parking is convenient and secure.  I travel a lot and this hotel is my choice of places to stay.  I do feel very much at home and the beds are great.

title: Clean, comfy, and I'll be back.
review: Walking into the room I was very impressed with the size of the bed, the layout of the room, and the direct, easy access to the pool and hot tub.  I arrived alomost two hours before check in and the front desk staff said it wouldn't be a problem getting into the room early and checking in.  I was so relieved that I could put my bags away and change from clothes from traveling all day without any hassle.

title: Choose another Hampton Inn by the Port for Cruises
review: I was and still am disappointed about this Hampton Inn we would never stay here again. We booked it based on others reviews and man were they off. We were on our way to a Royal Caribbean Cruise the following day and choose this one based on reviews. Well THERE IS NO FREE SHUTTLE SERVICE FROM AIRPORT OR TO THE PORT. Unlike the Hampton Inn Airport and Port Hotel. So we paid $131.00 guaranteed room in January. Never do that again. Well after you add in $25 taxi to hotel and $20 taxi to port for 4  people the room ended up costing us $176.00. If we had chosen the other hotel the cost would have been $130.00 and free shuttle. The walk to the shopping district is over 2 miles with kids not a good idea, nothing in the area to see. We thought our kids could swim in the pool....YUCK! It…

title: FINE PLACE TO STAY
review: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton on April 5th before catching our flight back to Canada after returning from our cruise.  The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable and was situated downtown.  In the morning, they served a great breakfast which was included in the stay.  The pool/hot tub area situated outside was clean and situated on the second floor.  The front desk staff was very helpful in giving us directions and suggestions on things to do and places to have diner.  All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  The price was right and it has everything you need to make your stay nothing less than you would expect.

title: great pre cruise stay
review: we stayed at the hampton inn for 2 nights pre cruise. our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. my husband and 8yr old daughter and myself had a 2 dbl bed room. the free breakfast was plentiful and the free tea and coffee at reception was a nice touch. there is a nice swimming pool which we didnt have time to use with plenty of loungers . the surrounding area is very quiet and slightly rundown but we always felt safe and used the trolley to get around which at this time of year only operates at weekends and walked ,approx 15 min walk to las olas boulevard. fort lauderdale is lovely place and even if you,re only there short while have a trip on the water bus, a cheap way to see a lot . the waterways and the houses are fabulous. we ate at the cheesecake factory on las…

title: Great Hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here in July of 2008.  We attended a comedy show at the Seminole Hardrock Casino and spent the night nearby.  The hotel is within 5 miles of the casino.  Our room was on the 3rd floor so we were to park in the parking garage for hotel guests only and walk directly to our room.  The garage is secure and we felt safe parking there.    Our room was spacious and very nice.  The bed was extremely comfortable and we wish we were spending more than just one night there.  The hotel provides free internet and the free breakfast was delicious.  They had a hot dish and the usual items, bagels, cerealk etc.  We would stay there again in the future.

title: Great Hotel In A Bad Area
review: As we approached the Hampton Inn City Center around 11 AM, my thoughts wandered to Puerto Morales Mexico near Cancun. We saw lots of buildings boarded up or partially demolished and several men sleeping in doorways or sidewalks in near the unused buildings.  Entering the Hampton Inn City Center, we observed an impressive lobby with a balcony, which we learned, housed the complimentary breakfast area. The room was typical Hampton Inn with the exception of the bedding. The mattress was soft and rough on my back.  There is a nice pool area with whirlpool and plenty of seating for sunbathing. The fitness room is well equipped and convenient to the elevators. We used a taxi from the airport to the Hampton Inn City Center that cost $14.60 plus tip. The hotel has complimentary parking…

title: Nice Property, Good Location,  Ok Neighborhood
review: This was my second stay at this particular Hampton Inn.  I was down for a business trip and had a friend of mine tag along, so I thought this would be a nice alternative to the other Hamptons in the area, which are your standard 3 or 4 story Hampton on side streets away from downtown.  This property is a nice high rise in the city center, only a 2 or 3 block walk from the "river walk" area with lots of upscale shops and restaurants.  My favorite part of this hotel is its secure parking, its high rise feel, and its really nice pool area, which my friend enjoyed while I worked.  :-) The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable.  I will say I found the bed a bit soft, and not what I have found to be the standard mattress in most Hamptons, which are very comfortable. But it was ok. …

title: Excellent Value
review: My partner and I stayed here the night before our cruise on the Caribbean Princess.  We arrived very late (after midnight) and were greeted by Cesar, the nighttime desk guy.  He was friendly, and had us in the room in about five minutes.  The room was clean, and exactly what we expected from a Hampton Inn.    Even though it was spring break time, the hotel was absolutely quiet and beautifully maintained (meaning no kids running up and down the hallways in the night or drunk college kids).    We took advantage of the quiet and enjoyed a dip in their 2nd floor hot tub, which was just what we needed after a very long flight.  Towels were provided by the front desk.  Their free breakfast was quite nice.  They had it set up so you could make your own sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit,…

title: Excellent value
review: I spent a night here before my drive down to Key West.  It was exactly what I was looking for, a clean, comfortable place to spend the night, relatively close to I-95, and a good complimentary breakfast.  Parking is provided in a gated parking garage.  Check-in was fast and courteous.  The hotel is located within walking distance of the shops and restaurants along the RIverwalk.  The hotel is located a fair distance from the beach, so if the beach is your primary destination, this won't be the most convenient lcoation for you.    This was the first hotel I've been in that actually required a room key to operate the elevator, so there are additional safety features.  The complimentary breakfast was well-stocked and had a decent variety.  The breakfast area was fairly spacious and…

title: Good Place To Stay
review: Excellent covered and gated non-valet parking.  A free trolley appears every 20 minutes to take you to the main shopping and restaurant district (important because parking space is very scarce in Ft. Lauderdale).  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms and baths are large and clean.  Wifi internet access is available in the rooms, and reaches to at least the 7th floor.  There is a good and varied free breakfast available on the 2nd floor breakfast promenade.  Slightly pricey, but costs only about 1/3 the very pretentious luxury resort hotel we visited, which did not provide free amenities this hotel provided.  We would stay there again.

title: Good Value in Fort Lauderdale
review: Considering the high price for hotels in Fort Lauderdale this hotel is good value.  While not on or near the beaches it is a good choice for a precruise night if finances are a consideration.  The rooms are very clean and the beds/linens wonderful.  They offer a hearty buffet breakfast from 6-10 a.m. consisting of fruit/yogurt/muffins,breads,toast/cereals, eggs with biscuits and gravy - another added value.  There is a Publix a few blocks away if you have forgotten anything for your trip and they do offer a shuttle to the cruise port in the morning.  We called a cab, however as the lineup for the shuttle seemed very long.  Staff was friendly and courteous and we would definately stay here again.

title: Great Value
review: Pros: good rates, clean rooms, friendly staff, free self-parking in gated garage, many safety measures (room key needed to use elevators). Free hot breakfast, small fridge and microwave in room, small fitness room open 24 hours a day. One half mile walking distance to Fort Lauderdale’s Las Olas blvd with all the great shopping  and restaurants (ie Mancini's,Cheese Cake Factory, Riley Mcdermott's) . Close to i-95.   Mixed: has "heated " pool (too cold for my liking). Trolly to town runs” every twenty minutes"(not always on time)   Cons: in room safe not working (even after several attempts for engineering to fix it) ice machine not working on our floor (but they had time to print up a fancy "out of order" sign) laundry dryer didn't dry well.  All in all it was a good experience.…

title: Loved Hampton Inn City Center
review: Just returned from 3 nights at Hampton Inn.  We found it clean, quiet, comfortable and convenient.  Everyone at the front desk was very nice (even when we arrived at midnight).  It is a couple of blocks off a main street so there was no traffic noise, and we never once heard our neighbors (which I found amazing on a weekend).  There is plenty of parking and the location is convenient to everything.  We will definitely stay there again.

title: Pre-cruise holiday in the sun
review: We flew in from Italy for a 5 day pre- cruise holiday and were not disappointed, this hotel is in a great location with all facilities around them from shops, malls, cafes,restaurants,bars, banks, however the hotel itself is self contained with everything you need.All room rates include breakfast and what a breakfast- never seen the likes as much as you can eat and if you are on the run out the door a packed breakfast is provided. The staff were of the highest standard, friendly, efficient and nothing was to much trouble Reception had coffee and cookies on the go all day. The rooms were large , clean and with all you need, tv, fridge, tea making, internet, hair dryer- very comfortable beds too One point i will raise is that the aircon could not be switched off/ and you could not…

title: Great price for nice room
review: We recently stayed here for a night after returning from a cruise. The hotel was very reasonably priced, especially for Fort Lauderdale. Our room was very clean & comfortable. The staff was friendly. There was ample free parking, a rare thing in Fort Lauderdale. And the Hampton Inn free breakfast. The hotel is located downtown fairly close to the Riverwalk area. We had hoped for walking distance to restaurants & shopping, but it was too far, and I was leery of the neighborhood. There was however, a trolley stop right at the front door, so it was easy to get to restaurants, shopping & the beach. If you want to stay right in the thick of things, this is not the place. If you a want comfortable lodging with a reasonable price tag, don't hesitate to book a room here.

title: Great Beds!
review: We stayed at this hotel for one night post-cruise.  The rooms were very clean and looked to be brand new. The hotel staff was very helpful in directing us to a good mall for holiday shopping. What I can't say enough about is the great bed in our room. It was one of the most comfortable sleeps I've ever had in a hotel. I'd definitely return if I needed a place to stay in Fort Lauderdale.

title: Great All Around Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed here for one night at the end of our cruise out of Port Everglades. I selected this hotel because of the value ($125/nt plus tax) and the reviews here in TripAdvisor. I wanted something close to Las Olas, since I had already spent three nights on the beach before the cruise.  Overall, I was extremely impressed with the place. We arrived at 9 am, well before the normal checkin time. We were promptly given a room and welcomed to partake in the continental breakfast (which, frankly, was of better quality than the food from the cruise I was just on). We spent the day sitting by the pool, which was well kept and quiet. A 5 minute walk took us to the restaurants and attractions around Las Olas. Our room itself was large, new, and clean with a very comfortable bed.…

title: I'm picky and this place was great
review: I have never written a hotel review but I said when I get back to CA I have to write one on this place.  I was having dinner in South Beach Miami and decided there was no way I was staying there as most everything is quite old and the few that weren't were very expensive.  I like the Hampton so called and made a reservation and drove the 30 min to get to it.  I was so pleased with the place.  It was clean, clean, clean and pretty and secure.  The swimming pool was beautiful.  The breakfast was great as usual.  If I go back to that area, I will make it a point to stay there.  The picture they have of the room doesn't do it justice.  When I stayed there they had big fluffy white comforters and linens.   The place was very comfortable and the staff extremely accommodating.

title: Good home base
review: Never having before been to Ft. Lauderdale, I picked the Hampton Inn Downtown for a short weekend getaway trusting to the mostly positive write-ups here. My overall impression is essentially the same. The hotel is located a few miles north of Ft. Lauderdale airport and took about 10 minutes by cab ($15-17) with minimal traffic. The hotel is next door to City Hall, Court Buildings, and Library. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Las Olas St. night life area and Riverwalk. I saw little in terms of stores, etc right next to the hotel but a block to the east there is a CVS, a Starbucks, sandwich shops, etc.  The hotel is wonderful. The staff was very accommodating, letting me check in early and making sure I was settled. The room was clean and smoke free and good size. There is a…

title: Comfortable and Convenient Downtown Hotel
review: Business took me to Ft Lauderdale and a two night stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown.  The hotel is located on Andrews, two blocks north of Broward.  After picking up a rental car it was about 10 minutes from the airport to the hotel.  The hotel has a multi-level parking garage attached.  Because it takes a room key card to enter, you park on the side of the hotel, check in, and then park your car.  Even though the hotel was full, we had no trouble finding a parking spot on one of the higher levels.  Check in was friendly and reasonably fast.  My two colleagues and I arrived very late and were pleased that our room preferences were honored.  Two of us received accessible rooms X309, but the only difference we could tell was the bathrooms.  My room was #309, far enough from the…

title: Great hotel but mediocre staff!
review: This hotel is great...very clean, well maintained! They even gave me free breakfast coupons and free wifi access.  But, the staff were pretty unfriendly and dint have the normal attitude you would get at a Hampton Inn/ Hilton!  But still this hotel is worth every penny you will spend for it!

title: Short stay at the Hampton Inn City Center Downtown
review: My wife, kid and I stayed at the Hampton Inn City Center Downtown hotel August 3-5. This is a nice hotel. It is definitely a good value for the money, considering its downtown location.   Check-in: Quick and easy. Didn't need the reservation number, just the last name.  Room: Pretty nice. Beds & pillows were comfortable. Had a fridge and microwave included.  Bathroom was good, with all the expected goodies. Safety box did not work and, after contacting front desk twice and receiving two promises, was never fixed.  I must note that you need your room key card to use the elevator, the laundry room and to access the parking. Excellent. Felt safe all the time.  Breakfast was decent, with plenty of hot/cold options, cereals, breads & juices. Plenty of tables available.  Check-out:…

title: Glad we found it!
review: I spent a chunk of time looking for a hotel for two days for our extended family to stay before heading out on a cruise. I kept coming back to this one because of the reviews written in the last 6-8 months on Tripadvisor. I looked elsewhere as well.  I ended up emailing the hotel through their website and received emails back from the manager, Patsy, and her assistant manager. They offered me lower prices than I could find on any website.  There were two things that concerned me: 1) no free transportation to and from the airport or the cruise port, and 2) some of the reviews of the surrounding neighborhood. When I called and talked to Patsy, she informed me that they had just begun testing a van for transportation to and from the ports. It still wasn't free, but my…

title: Hampton Girl!
review: This hotel is very clean a nice! You have to use your room key once you get in the elevator and then choose the floor you wish to go to. It has garage parking, but the garage is very narrow. So if you are driving a hummer you certainly will not be able to park in the garage. If you are going to Port Everglades it is about 3 miles from the Port. My husband and I enjoyed it very much. I love Hampton hotel's, I am a Hampton girl!

title: This hotel is first rate in every way
review: I must say I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Although most of the reviews on here are very good, I don't think they convey just how nice of a hotel this is. I stayed for one night on business and found this Hampton Inn to be exceptionally clean to the point of perfection with very modern updated rooms and a very comfortable bed and linens. The room was quiet with everything I could have wanted including microwave, refrigerator and free high speed internet. The staff was very courteous and helpful and the lobby looks like something from a much pricier hotel. In fact, the room also looked much more upscale considering it's reasonable price. I honestly was not expecting such a nice room.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: If this is what Hampton's are like, then I'm Inn!
review: Well for the price, the standard of this property in terms of the foyer, rooms and facitlies (business centre etc.) is not unlike what you would find in a much higher class of hotel chain (sorry Hampton Inn if that offends!).  The rooms actually have a little of the wow factor. The beds are huge and comfortable, the bathrooms are spotless and well fitted and all the touches are there. Fort Lauderdale riverwalk is only a few blocks away and so the location is great too.  We found the hotel by chance on a stopover driving down to Miami and we basically got lucky. The breakfast is good and the internet access was free with 3 or 4 terminals to use to cover off all those pesky emails!  Best part of this hotel? The front desk staff and staff in general. I have to admit we were tired…

title: Solid hotel for price
review: I stayed in the Hampton Inn on the night of the 15th for business.  I arrived late, but check in was smooth as usual.    Parking is on a deck attached to the hotel.   If you get there late you might have to park on the top floor which is not covered.  The deck is very tight so take care not to scrape your car or others.  Hotel was clean and the lobby was big and open.  The business center had 4 computers, all attached to a printer and easy to access.  The rooms were nice.  The view from my side was of the neighborhood surrounding, but others had views of downtown.    One unexpected plus was that they had 3 HBO channels, instead of just one, which offered additional movie and show choices.  Breakfast was on the 2nd floor over looking the lobby and the pool.  Usual Hampton…

title: Very good hotel downtown
review: Very good hotel near Ft. Lauderdale center and Broward Performing Arts Center. Stayed for 4 nights with two kids aged 2. Room was newly renovated and was very clean. Has all you need to your stay. Small fridge, microwave, TV with internet access, free broadband. Have a vending machine and ice machine working well near room. There were also a coin laundry on the same floor. Staff were always very helpful. Should say their free breakfast buffet was VERY good. Secured garage was a plus also. Have connecting bridge from garage to room floor, very helpful (ask for a third ou forth floor room). Didn’t use other amenities.

title: last minute stay
review: We did a last minute check in on Tuesday April 3.  The hotel was great.  However, our room (212) appeared to be an old hospitality suite so it was very large, but needed additional rennovations.  I would advise anyone to stay here especially because of its location and free parking.  The hotel is minutes to the beach and Port Everglades and its location on Andrews make it accessible to anywhere in the area.

title: great hotel
review: we stayed there for 2 nights and we could not have been happier, staff was WONDERFUL, clean room, and the breakfast buffet was good too. we got lost getting there and they were so nice to talk us in to their parking lot, they even drove us back in their shuttle when we returned our rental car, i would go back there again, they answered all our questions and Diane the manager was so WONDERFUL, they all had a great sense of humor and it was a joy to stay there,

title: Stayed here pre-cruise
review: Stayed here a Saturday night pre-cruise.  Physically the hotel is very nice.  Large lobby.  Nice pool area although the hot tub was not working the night we stayed there.  As someone else mentioned all the vending machines were not working.  I guess they want you to go down to their little shop next to the check in.  Help was very nice.  Allowed us to check in early, although the hotel seem quite empty, I think they cater to a weekday business crowd.    Felt safe walking to the Las Olas area for dinner and back although the opposite direction did seem a bit seedy.  I thought it was a bit pricey at $200 for the night but would stay there again if I had business downtown.

title: excellent Hampton Inn
review: If you are Hampton Inn fans, this is one you should try. They do all the expected Hampton things well, including the breakfast buffet. The secured parking is an extra plus. Local friends told us the area around the hotel is not the best, but we knew we would not be walking around so that was not a problem. The bed was very comfortable and the closet held a regular blanket so the heavy duvet was not a problem in this hotter than usual January.

title: not satisfied
review: i traveled here on business for six days for a training course which was a couple of blocks away. i put a lot of faith in trip advisor as to where i book my stays so i hope someone finds this helpful.  the hotel appears to be relatively new. the lobby, room and bathroom were all clean and well kept. the bathroom was a little low budget but acceptable.  i caught the hotel at a bad time...wouldn't you know it their satellite dish was out of commission for my stay so the normally limited channels you get from a hotel was limited even further...unfortunately all of the 'normal' channels were not working like abc, nbc, espn, etc. so i missed all of the football games. i survived though :) the pool was well kept and the gym, for this type of hotel was adequate. i saw another reviewer…

title: Never a bad experience.
review: I have stayed here so many times that I have lost count. When visiting Fort Lauderdale, this is Hampton Inn my always my first choice. Well managed, well kept and clean. The folks at the front desk always welcome me back with a smile and truly make me feel appreciated here. Security at this hotel is very good. An example of this is that the elevators will not give you access to the floors above the lobby and pool unless you have a room key. I have easily stayed here over 50 times and have never had a bad experience!   The hotel is also centrally located in Downtown Lauderdale and only a couple of blocks away from the restaurants and bars on Las Olas Blvd.  If you stay at this hotel make sure to go to Las Olas and visit O’Hara’s Jazz and Blues Cafe. This is a great local’s hang…

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: My hubby stayed in this hotel at the end of august for 2 weeks and thought it was very nice.   For an average price room *standard* it was more than nice and extremely clean.  Staff was very nice and attentive as well.   Great place to stay for a convention etc. downtown.  :)

title: Good downtown choice
review: A friend and I spent a long weekend at the Hampton Inn and enjoyed our stay.  It is downtown so if you are looking for the beach scene this is not for you.  The parking is free and secure so it is easy to get anywhere you want.  The room was nicely furnished and clean.  They have a nice breakfast area with a big variety of choices.  The pool is nice and is just outside the breakfast area.  The only downside was you have to use your room keycard for everything and sometimes took a few swipes to get the thing to work but the system did make you feel secure in the elevators and the parking garage.  The Riverwalk is a short walk from the hotel.

title: Found our place!!
review: We only spent one night at this hotel, but it was a great experience!  Very lovely rooms, clean, loaded with conveniences, free internet, comfy bed, spacious bathroom.  There is a little 'shop' located next to the check in counter with drinks (both w/ and w/o alcohol) and frozen dinners, snacks, wine, and last minute items such as bandaids and batteries.  I found this to be a genius set up!  The parking garage is only accessable by room key which made us feel comfortable parking our car overnight.  Of course, the area is very safe anyway and a short walk to the Las Olas excitement!  The breakfast was a cute variety of danish, small sandwiches, fruit juice, breads and cereal.  My only complaint is that the fruit was a bit too ripe.  Also, it is a bit cumbersome to have to use…

title: Would not return
review: You get what you pay for! At $109.00 a night I should'nt complain...but I will! Stayed here to attend a wedding at the River Walk. The rooms had cheap K-mart style furniture and the bed's comforter was stained. The tub's drain needed to be cleaned as the water would not go down. The pool had garbage floating in it and the spa smelled so bad that my wife and I had to get out. I am not usually a critic and make the best out of what is handed to me but it would be unfair for me not to mention these issues. A great place to flop if your in college and want to share the room with four buddies. A married couple from New Jersey getting away from the kids for the weekend...NOT!

title: good for downtown location
review: Very good location for downtown if on a business visit. Would not recommend it for typical travelers though due to location. Was very clean & comfortable, but no maintenance crew on duty on weekends/nights as I had to switch rooms as the TV wasn't working and there was no one to repair/check it on sunday when I checked in. Didn't use the amenities except for the parking (covered/gated) so won't comment on same. Reasonable rate for the area.

title: Decent Hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights when we first arrived in Fort Lauderdale.  I thought the price was a little high for a Hampton Inn but we also stayed during the peak season so every hotel is high.  The people were very nice and helpful and the hot breakfast each day was good.  Parking was not a problem and the location was great.  It was within walking distance of Las Olas and was very convenient to the downtown area.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed mid december for 3 days. The hotel was very clean and staff was excellent. Very close to several attractions and secure. Good but not great free breakfast. Room was good with free mini frig and micro wave and ample free parking.

title: Very pleasant stay
review: We were escaping the inconvenience that Hurricane Frances left us......no water or power at our house.  This hotel is very clean and very conveniently located.   If you are doing business in downtown Ft. Lauderdale,  the location is tops. It's not too far from the beaches and shopping.  Very secure as well.  Accommodating and friendly staff.  The breakfast in the morning is top notch...the only negative is the coffee!! yuck!!  I would definitely stay here again.  I've stayed at many Hampton Inn's,  and this one is the best.
